loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón de 50 años de edad, reside en el cantón piedra azul, de San Rafael Oriente San Miguel,el es un agricultor, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos de las edades 22, 12 y 8 años quienes dependen económicamente de él. Don Ramón aprendió a cultivar el maíz por su padre que desde pequeño le enseño a sembrar la tierra, y desde entonces él lo tomo como el oficio principal para mantener a su familia, ya que lo realiza todos los años.
Él solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su siembra de maíz, la obtención de este crédito le ayudara a don Ramón a tener una mejor cosecha y una mayor producción para la alimentación de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir cultivando el maíz para poder obtener ingresos que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y poder darle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para salir adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramon, 50 years of age, resides in the Piedra Azul (Blue Stone) canton in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel. He is a farmer, married, and lives with his wife and 3 children, ages 22, 12 and 8, who are economically dependent upon him. Ramon learned to cultivate corn from his father who taught him from the time he was small, to sow the earth. And since then, every year, Ramon has pursued this as his principal trade to maintain his family. He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his corn crop. The loan will help Ramon obtain a better harvest and greater production to feed his family. His aspirations are to continue cultivating corn in order to be able to obtain income that will help cover household expenses and give his children the education they need to get ahead, improving his quality of life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE FOR HIS CORN CROP

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lebina

texts.en:
Lebina L. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a handicrafts (basket weaving) business. She lives in Prk. II, Nangka, Argawanon, San Remegio, Bogo, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her handicrafts (basket weaving) business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 6,000. Lebina is now borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more materials for business.  This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lebina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and assures their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for business

loans.name: Nurjan's Group

texts.en:
Nurjan R. is the leader of the group. She is 33 years old and married. She has three children, 2 daughters and a son, the eldest of whom are school pupils. The main source of family income comes from cattle breeding.  Nurjan’s spouse is a farmer. The family also has two sheep and in order to increase the herd they need to purchase more sheep. This is why she wants to get a loan. In the future Nurjan is planning to give a proper education to her children and to develop her family’s business.

Shailoo S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and a widow. She has had to bring up three daughters alone. The eldest daughter raises money by working as a teacher in Orlovka village. The others are schoolgirls, and all of them support their mother by helping her with the housekeeping. Shailoo is building a house, if all the conditions for cattle breeding are provided. The loan purpose is to purchase livestock animals for further fattening and breeding. In the future the family wants to finish building their house and to develop their business.

Yimanakun J., 63, is married. He lives together with his wife. All of their children are already grownups and live separately from their parents. The family business is farming, but temporarily it has been paused. The loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals for further fattening and breeding. In the future Yimanakun hopes to improve his family wealth and to develop the business. 

Tolobek J., is 36 and married. He and his wife, who is a farmer, are bringing up three small children. Tolobek knows how to breed cattle and wants to start his own business in this familiar sphere. The loan purpose is to purchase livestock animals. In the future he wants his children to be well educated, and he is planning to increase his cattle stock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Paul Owino

texts.en:
Paul Owino O., age 32, is an electrician and electronic technician. He is known for repairing electronics and fixing electrical cables. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. He intends to use the money to buy some electronic parts to add to his stock. This will enable him serve his clients better.
 
Paul's secondary business is the sale of cereals. With the profits expected from this loan, he hopes to expand this business as well as to buy materials for his electronic repair business.

Paul and his wife, Joan Atieno, have four children. They live in the town of Migori.

loans.use: To buy tools for his electrical and electronic repair business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria D. is a farmer from the town of Surallah. She plants and harvests rice crops. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from selling her harvest. Gleceria works hard to improve her business and be able to sustain her family's needs. She also started raising pigs to add extra income to her family.

Gleceria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleceria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Juan Leonard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y luego lo distribuye a los mercados y tiendas. A la vez el socio trabaja para el sector privado, el socio es una persona muy emprendedora y de esta manera saca a su familia adelante. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como maíz,purina entre otros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for the Triumph), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 46 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Juan divides his time between his daily activities and his business of raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. He then distributes the animals to markets and stores. Since he works in the private sector, Juan is an enterprising person who tries to move his family forward. He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his business such as corn, animal feed, and other items.

Juan is grateful to those who helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as corn, animal feed, and other items

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan de 40 años, trabaja en las noches como comerciante de mariscos y en la mañana confecciona y cose ropa. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabaja durante 15 años para poder mantener a su familia. 

Desde pequeño él comenzó con las ventas de mariscos para tener sus propios ingresos, poco a poco con la lista de clientes que tenia por las ventas de mariscos pudo promocionar sus servicios como confeccionista. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano terminando los pedidos de ropa y en las noches vende mariscos de todo tipo recorriendo las calles. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para su negocio de costura y mejorar su viviendo comprando materiales de construcción. Uno de sus objetivos en el futuro es tener cuartos de alquiler para generar más ingresos y que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old.  He works nights as a seafood vendor.  In the mornings he sews and makes clothes.  He lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and has been working for 15 years to support his family.

Juan started selling seafood when he was young so that he could have his own income.  Little by little, through the customer base he had for his seafood business, he was able to promote his services as a dressmaker.  He currently starts work very early in the morning, finishing off clothes orders, and then he sells all kinds of seafood in the evenings as an itinerant street vendor.

Juan would like to use his loan to buy fabric for his dressmaking business and to improve his home, buying building materials.  One of his goals for the future is to have rooms to rent out so that he can make more income so that his daughter doesn't want for anything.

loans.use: To buy fabric and building materials

loans.name: Yumdermaa

texts.en:
Yumdermaa R. is a 47-year-old single mother who lives with her 6 children in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, on a fenced lot. Her oldest son works for a security company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her next oldest sons are university students and her youngest two children attend a local secondary school. 

Yumdermaa operates a small cafe in her town. She started her own business in 2006 by operating a flour trading business. After years of operation, she has managed to establish a stable cafe business in her local community. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her children's tuition fees but aslo provide for her entire family. 

For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business at a stable level so that she can afford to build a house on her fenced lot, and save more money for her children's future education. She  requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of materials and supplies for her cafe in order to make a variety of meals.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, es un exitoso hombre de 42 años, que junto a su esposa Ángela, cuidan de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en Pueblo Pardo (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Fidel es la agricultura, ahí siembra una variedad de frutas entre cítricos como: carambola, naranja, tangüelo, asimismo mango y palta. Ya tiene 14 años de experiencia, por ello en cada cosecha obtiene los mejores frutos, ya que todos los mayoristas del mercado central de la capital, conocen de su buena producción. En adelante tiene planeado vivir en la capital, en compañía de su esposa Ángela, que trabaja en un hospital público, ahí desea abrir un negocio propio como una tienda de comestibles o un restaurante. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Caramboleros”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es un hombre trabajador y comprometido con el progreso de su asociación. Para la próxima cosecha de cítricos necesita obtener buenos frutos, por ello está pensando invertir el aporte que recibirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Fidel is a successful 42 year old man who, together with his wife Ángela, takes care of their 2 children in the home that they own in Pueblo Pardo (in the central Peruvian forest).  Fidel is an agricultural worker, planting a variety of fruits including citrus such as: starfruit, oranges, tangelos, mangoes and avocados.  He has 14 years of experience, and because of this he gets the best fruit in every harvest and all of the bulk sellers in the market know of him and his good product. In the future, he plans to live in the capital with his wife Angela, who works in a public hospital.  He would like to open his own business there such as a food store or restaurant.  

He belongs to the village bank "Los Caramboleros" and this is his sixth loan with MFP, where he is known to be a hard worker and is committed to the progress of his association. He needs good fruit from his next citrus harvest, so he would like to invest his portion of the loan in the purchase of some sacks of organic compost, which he will spread over his 4 hectares of farmland.

loans.use: Buy organic compost

loans.name: Predeswinda

texts.en:
Predeswinda is 25 years old and married. She lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan and supports her family by operating two businesses: a general store and an aqua-farming business. Predeswinda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and aqua-farming businesses, Predeswinda is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 PHP. 

Predeswinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase inventory for her general store. This will be her second loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She repaid her previous loan well within its term. Predeswinda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase general store inventory

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda, 59 years old, is a married woman from the town of Bunawan. She earns a living through rice farming. She spends her day cultivating her land and keeping it free of weeds and pests. She also makes sure her rice crops are growing healthy. Florenda sells her harvest to the community. She hopes to earn more so that she can provide the increasing needs in her household.

Florenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar es abogado y su esposa es profesora; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que el cliente desea mejorar  su vivienda. Oscar es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. El cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en: Oscar is an attorney and his wife is a teacher.  They will use the money from this loan to buy building materials so that they can improve their home.  Oscar has two children and his home is located in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz.  He is very happy about the loans he has gotten.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Les Fines Fleurs 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Guensly  est le coordinateur  de son groupe Les Fines Fluers.
 

Guensly  habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE  d’Haïti où il y a peu d’électricité   et l’eau est très limitée.

GUENSLY vend du tennis soulies et autre  pendant les 5 dernières années.

Avant de faire le commerce, Guensly était un élève et aussi facteur.

Guensly  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du soulier et de tennis. Guensly  voudrait utiliser ce prêt pour un agrandissement total de son commerce.

Guenly vit toujours dans le concubinage il a un enfant.

Son objectif principal c’est devenir un grand commercant durant toute sa vie d’avoir de grand magasin de commercer avec l’exterieur pendant toute son existence terreste.
texts.en:
Guensly is the coordinator of his group, The Delicate Flowers. 
Guensly lives in the city of Ouanaminthe in Haiti, where there is little electricity and the water is very limited.
Guensly has been selling tennis shoes among other things for the last 5 years. 
Before selling things, Guensly was a student and then a mailman. 
Guensly would like to use this loan to invest in his tennis shoe business. Guensly would like to use this loan for a total expansion of his business.
Guensly lives with his wife. He has one child.
His principal objective is to become a big businessman and to have a big store with an outside area for the rest of his life.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes

loans.name: El Pejamo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el penjamo, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la colonia donde viven, la historia es acerca de Nélida M. Ramírez, ya que ella es la representante del grupo, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos Beatriz, Uriel, natividad y betzaida de los cuales solo tres están estudiando uno está en primer año de prepa, otra en primero de secundaria y la menor en segundo de primaria, ya que la mayor esta casada, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad porque en el pueblo donde radica no hay muchas personas que tengan este negocio, ya que es un lugar un poco pequeño, además de que le deja buenas ganancias, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de mas artículos como son: aceite, sal, azúcar, refrescos, aguas, pastas, leche, galletas, arroz, frijol, papel higiénico y jabón.
La meta que se ha puesto doña Nélida es darles una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y así tengan una buena profesión, para que se hagan de un mejor futuro, también quiere hacerse de un local, para que pueda tenerlo muy bien surtido y así mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.
Nos cuenta que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones, les gusta mucho el trabajo, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, ya que ellos se conocen de hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras, no les gusta defraudar a las personas que depositan su confianza en ellos.
Nélida le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos va a der cambiar su vida y la de sus hijos, puesto que a hora tendrán una mejor educación.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Nélida son: verónica, María, fulgencia, Antonia, Ana, elisandra, orfedelia, Elsa, y Araceli, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta de ropa, abarrotes, venta de comida, maíz, carne, tamales y frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Penjamo.” They decided to name it this because that’s the name of the neighborhood they live in.  

The story is about Nélida M. Ramírez since she’s the group representative.  She’s a widow with four children:  Beatriz, Uriel, Natividad and Betzaida.  Three of them are in school: one is in 10th grade, another in 7th and the youngest is in second grade.  The oldest is married.  Nélida sells groceries.

She says that she went into this business because there aren’t too many people in her town in this business since it’s a pretty small place.  Besides, it produces good profits.  She will use the money she asked for to buy more stock items like: oil, sugar, soft drinks, water, noodles, milk, cookies, rice, beans, toilet paper and soap.

The goals Nélida has set for herself are to provide her children with quality education so that they will be able to study professional careers thus being able to forge better futures.  She also wants to acquire a locale to stock it really well and improve and increase income.

She tells us that all her fellow members are responsible people, that they fulfill their obligations and enjoy their work very much to improve themselves and overcome any difficulty; they’ve known each other for a long time and she says that they are people who pay their installments.  They do not like to disappoint the people who trust them.

In the name of herself and her family, Nélida thanks FARC and Kiva because thanks to them she will be able to change her life and the life of her children because now they’ll have a better education.

Nélida’s fellow members are Verónica, María, Fulgencia, Antonia, Ana, Elisandra, Orfedelia, Elsa and Aracely who carry out various activities like: clothing sales, groceries, sale of food, corn, meat, tamales, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma B. is from the village of Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anselma owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Anselma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Anselma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anselma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Anselma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for her General Store such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anselma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her General Store such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry T. is a 49-year-old married woman. Her husband, Mr. Pha Phal, is 45 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985, and they have six children (one son and five daughters). Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one child is a garment factory worker, and the other three children are in school.

To earn a living, Mrs. Ry T. and her husband (pictured at their home) work in the agriculture sector. Specifically, they grow lotus on their farm land in the village where they live. Ry is asking for her first loan, in the amount of $400, to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her lotus farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Maria Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 34 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en la comunidad rural de Guaraguaos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Desde hace 4 años, Liliana se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de Jora que acompaña con pequeños platos de comida. Ella cuenta con un espacio óptimo para su negocio y tiene una gran demanda, lo que genera los deseos de Liliana de  ampliar su negocio.

Su esposo es técnico agrícola especialista en uva y actualmente trabaja en Ica – Lima, llega a su hogar cada fin de mes, pero no descuida los gastos de su hogar.

Liliana solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa para ampliar y mejorar la calidad de su negocio. El crédito solicitado es de 700 nuevos soles y con esto comprará sillas, mesas, jarras y cubiertos para su local.

Liliana goza de bunas referencias laborales, pues sus clientes están muy contentos con sus potajes y ella tiene muchos deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
Liliana is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the rural community of Guaraguaos, in Tambogrande district – Piura.

For four years, Liliana has been preparing and selling 'chicha de jora' (a traditional drink made from fermented corn) which she accompanies with small dishes of food.  She has an ideal space for her business and a lot of demand.  For this reason, Liliana would like to expand her business.

Liliana's husband is an agricultural technician who is a specialist in grapes.  He currently works in Ica –  Lima.  He arrives home at the end of every month but doesn't neglect their household expenses.

Liliana is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to expand and improve the quality of her business.  She is requesting 700 Peruvian soles to buy tables, chairs, pitchers and place settings for her business premises.

Liliana has good work references as her customers are very happy with her stews.  She has a great desire to improve herself.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, pitchers and place settings for her business

loans.name: Elí

texts.es: Elí, tiene la edad de 26 años, está  casado y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El lo que pretende es realizar la compra de los insumos para su posterior fertilización. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación en buenas condiciones de este cultivo por lo cual intentara asistiéndolo en buenas condiciones y así obtener mejores  resultados de producción esta próxima cosecha.  Tiene como una de sus metas generar los recursos necesarios para seguir invirtiendo en el producto y generar las ganancias para un mejor bienestar  propio y de su esposa. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Elí is 26 years old, is married and lives with his wife who is his main priority. He wants to buy supplies for his bean crops. He has the land suitable for this production and will use it to have a better harvest. One of Elí’s goals is to have the resources necessary to keep investing in his products and earn enough to improve his and his wife’s wellbeing. This is Elí’s first loan and was received through FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t had any other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan more easily and the interest rates are much lower.

loans.use: harvest bean crops.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mr. Lang, 23, is a fisherman in the province of Siem Reap. He started this job in 2000 and is getting a daily income of approximately $4. Lang’s wife’s name is Khem; she is 21 and also helps him in the same business. They are good parents who try their utmost to earn money to feed their child and use for the other expense of the family. 

Mr. Lang will use his loan to repair his house which is broken because of heavy rain. For the future, they wish to have a suitable house for their family to live in and sustain their fishing business and support their child in higher education.

loans.use: to repair his house which is broken because of heavy rain.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph, aged 24, is married to Pamela. He owns a beauty shop and a barber shop which have been in operation for 2 years, earning him a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy a hair dryer and hair chemicals. Asaph intends to use the anticipated profits to stock his salon and barber shop and hopes to operate a modern beauty parlor in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment, hair dryer, and hair chemicals

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia, 45, was born in Chinchero and currently lives in Urquilloz. She is in the agriculture business and sells flowers and vegetables that she grows on her farm. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells from her home. Florencia is asking for a $500 loan in order to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm. She wishes to grow a larger amount of vegetables on her farm to sell. Florencia is happy about the loan and is committed to making all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, 37, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with four children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and snacks, a business she has had for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Felicitas is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Yareni

texts.es:
Yareni es soltera y vive en un ribera que esta a media  hora del pueblo, es un lugar muy bonito donde su gente es muy trabajadora que busca la manera de sacra delatante a su  familia.
    Ella invertido el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos  de la marca Avon, Fuller, Blanda y Jafra, en donde lleva trabajando tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello se apoya para tener su propios ingresos  aun así también trabaja en la casa de una tía cuidando a una niña y dice que le va bien.
     Lo que  lo inspiro a esta  actividad fue ella sola para mejorar sus ingresos económicos para así  no tener que depender de nadie  y Salir adelante por si sol.
    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña activa pueda tener un mejor ahorro a y así mejorar  algunas cosas que desea comprar para su casa.
texts.en:
Yareni is single and lives at the beach which is a half hour from town. It is a very lovely place where the people are very hard-working and look for ways to help their families get ahead.

     She will invest her loan in the purchase of Avon, Fuller, Blanca and Jafra cosmetics, which she has been selling for three years.  She comments that she has been doing well since she is able to have her own income. At the same time she is also working in an aunt's house caring for a little girl and she says that is going well.

    What inspires her to do this business is her own self motivation to increase her income and not be dependent on anyone so that she can get ahead on her own.

    What she most wishes is that with this small business she can increase her savings and thereby make some improvements that she wants to make in her home.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of Jafra brand and Fuller cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
63-year-old Anecito is a married man with seven children. He is a farmer who tills a piece of land in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn and sells his harvest at the market. Anecito works hard to support his family. He also wants to be able to support his grandchildren through his business.

Anecito plans to use his loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, two quarts of insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, two quarts of insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortas mexicanas y tacos, es un negocio de familia, de esta actividad han logrado cubrir sus gastos y estar atento a todas las necesidades.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio como: pan, tomates, cebollas, condimentos, carnes, aceite y demás cosas que se necesitan para mantener el negocio estable y dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es buscar alternativas para invertir en el negocio, y darle un giro, invirtiendo en materiales que le ayuden para aumentar su negocio, generando más ganancias para el hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been selling Mexican tortas and tacos for two years. It is a family business, and from it, he has managed to cover his expenses, and be attentive to all his customers' needs. 

He is applying for the loan to buy products he needs for the business, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, condiments, meats, cooking oil, and other things that are needed to keep the business running, and give good service to his customers.  

His goal is to look for ideas for investing in his business, and try them out; buying materials that will help him increase his business, and generate more earnings for his household.

loans.use: To buy bread, tomatoes, onions, condiments, meats, and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыкул 51 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей – 2 старшие дочери замужем и живут отдельно, одна дочь – студентка педагогического колледжа и младший сын учится в 8 классе местной школы. После распада Советского Союза, семья Бактыкул получила земельный надел, послуживший первым вложением в собственный бизнес.  Проработав в сфере полеводства до недавнего времени, Бактыкул решила продать участок и начать бизнес в животноводстве. Закупив бычков для откорма, она прилагает все усилия для развития собственного бизнеса.  Именно поэтому, Бактыгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетели. В будущем, женщина планирует дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul is 51 years old, married and has four children.  Two of her older daughters are married and live separately, one daughter is a student at a pedagogical college, and the youngest son attends eighth grade at a local school.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, Baktygul's family received a plot of land, which served as the first investment into their own business.  After working in the farming business until a recent time, Baktygul decided to sell the land and start an animal husbandry business.  She bought calves for fattening up and uses all her efforts to develop her business.  This is why Baktygul went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two heifers.  In the future, she plans to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers

loans.name: Abadahemukirana / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic fait partie du groupe Abadahemukirana / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « les fideles ». Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Fréderic est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir les champs à cultives. Dans les prochaines années, Fréderic voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et récolter la grande quantité du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Frederic is a member of the Abadahemukirana/RSZ group. The name of the group means “the faithful ones.” He is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 8 years, two of whom attend school.  He has had 8 years of primary school education. 

Frederic is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice growing operation.  

His strategy to grow his business is to increase the size of the fields he cultivates.  In the coming years, Frederic would like to be among the best rice growers in his region and to produce a large quantity of rice.  With his profits, he plans to pay for his children’s schooling and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers to use in his rice growing operation.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 37 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural industry, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elvira requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been farming vegetables for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Nogaye est âgée de 51 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants ; elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus, de pagnes et autres articles; elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou marron-noir et couverte d'un châle rose.
Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et revend au marché central.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aiD. son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille pour la scolarité, la santé et la nourriture; aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was created August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

The group manager is Ms. Nogaye who is 51 years old, married and a mother of five children. Her business activity is trading in fabrics, pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and other items. She has an accumulated 10 years of experience in her area. She is standing on the right in the picture, dressed in a brown-black robe and covered with a pink shawl. She gets her supplies from the capital and resells them in the central market.

She wants to use her ​​loan to buy large quantities of goods to strengthen her business and increase her income. Her profits will be used to assist her husband in dealing with the family's education, health and food expenditures. She also intends to increase her savings level.

loans.use: Buy goods for resale

loans.name: Cayetana Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Cayetana Dominga es viuda, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica al tejido de servilletas, inició este trabajo ya que alguien le enseñó y lleva 22 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilo de diferentes colores para producir servilleta, espera en el futuro ver que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Cayetana, 54, is a widow with 2 children.  She didn’t have the chance to go to school but one of her children is still studying.  She weaves napkins, work that she first started 22 years ago when someone taught her how.

She is requesting a loan to buy different colored thread to make the napkins.  She hopes that her business will continue prospering in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave napkins

loans.name: Saadabu

texts.ru: Саадабу 48 лет, вдова. Воспитывает  3 дочерей и 2 сыновей, младший из которых школьник. На протяжении уже 20 лет Саадабу занимается  животноводством и перепродажей скота, начав этот бизнес с суммы 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве  Саадабу имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 10 коз, а также кормовая база в 50 снопов клевера, 80 снопов кукурузы и 150 кг. кукурузы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Саадабу обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку молодняка – телят и овец. Доходы от  кредита Саадабу планирует направить на покупку участка под строительство еще одного сарая для скота.
texts.en: Saadabu is 48 years old, she is is a widow. She is raising three daughters and two sons, the youngest one goes to school. During the last twenty years Saadabu has been doing animal husbandry and reselling cattle by starting the business with an amount of 25,000 KGS. Thanks to her persistence and hard work right now Saadabu has two cows, ten sheep and ten goats as well as a fodder supply in 50 bundles of clover, 80 sheaves of corn and 150 kg of corn. Saadabu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS with the purpose of further growing her business and to buy young calves and sheep. Saadabu plans to use the profit from the loan to buy part of the land to build another shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La sra. Reyna tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y niños, Reyna es una mujer emprendora  y con muchos deseos de superacion,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tambien sale a vender a empresas privadas y publicas de la ciudad de choluteca, Reyna se levanta a las  6 de la mañana todos los dias, primero atiende a sus hijos y luego se prepara para atender a sus clientes, que por cierto son muchos. Reyna es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, mismos que los tiene estudiando en la  escuela publica del barrio.
Su tiempo libre lo dedica  a visitar la iglesia.
Reyna utilizara el credito para la compra de ropa, desea estar preparada para la epoca de navidad, muchos de sus clientes ya le estan haciendo pedidos y no quiere quedarles mal.
texts.en: Reyna, 41, lives in the city of Choluteca’s San Luis neighborhood and she sells women’s and children’s clothing.  Reyna is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her business is home-based and she also goes out to sell to private and public firms in the city of Choluteca.  Reyna rises at 6am every day.  First she tends to her children and then gets ready to take care of customers, which by the way, are quite a few.  Reyna is a single mother of two children who attend the local public school.  In her free time she goes to church.  Reyna will use the loan to buy clothes.  She wants to be prepared for the Christmas season.  Many of her customers are already placing orders and she doesn’t want to disappoint them.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district, Sok is 46 years old and has 10 children. Six of them are workers at a rubber plantation factory while the other four are still in school. To feed her big family, she has been farming on her farm for nearly 30 years. Her husband is a homebuilder. Sometimes, Sok works for others to gain additional income and make a living. 

Sok leads a group of two female members. This will be her second loan. The first loan from VisionFund helped her establish a regular income and earn a better living. Now Sok is requesting another loan, which she will use to fix her farming machine and harvest her rice crops. 

Sok hopes to make more rice and earn more income to better feed her family as well as to keep her four children in school.

loans.use: To fix her farming machine and harvest her rice crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan Jesus es hombre muy trabajador y dedicado, hace 15 años por situaciones ajenas a el, perdió algunos dientes y desde ese tiempo se ha cuidado de no abrir tanto la boca cuando habla y hasta para reir por la pena de que alguien se burle de su estado. Para Juan José ha sido un trauma y un problema al comer ya que para masticar algún alimento se le dificulta y teme que por no moler correctamente la comida pueda ahogarse. En este momento el ve la oportunidad de arreglarse la dentadura lo cual le permitirá realizar actividades que por pena no ha hecho. Para esto necesita el dinero para ir con el dentista y le coloque lo que serán sus nuevos dientes.
texts.en: Juan Jesus is a hard working and dedicated man. Fifteen years ago, due to circumstances beyond his control, he lost some teeth. Since then he has been careful not to open his mouth when he talks and even when he laughs for fear someone will laugh at him. This has been traumatic for Juan Jose as well as a problem for eating because it is difficult for him to chew some food, and he is afraid he will choke because he can't chew properly. At this time, he sees the opportunity to fix his teeth, which will allow him to do activities that he hasn't been able to do. For that, he needs the money to go to the dentist so he can put in some new teeth.

loans.use: Ponerse la dentadura

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy several sacks of cashew seeds.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora Luz, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio de un poblado  del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 21 años, es Casada con 3 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Luz atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Hierro 3/8, Cemento, Ladrillos, Tabla, Piedrín y Mano de Obra, para realizar las mejora en la casa en, para mayor seguridad de su vivienda. Por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: In the municipal of Telica in the department of León, the lady Luz arduously dedicates herself to her work as an elementary school teacher in a small municipal school, working in this career for the past 21 years.  She is married with 3 children, whom she has to provide the necessary living conditions for their development.  One of the necessities that Luz comes across now is that of home improvement, since it has been in poor condition.  For this reason, she has made the decision to respond to Ceprodel in order to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials like 3/8 iron, cement, bricks, boards, gravel, and manual labor to carry out the improvements to her house for greater home security.  Through this project, she will provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 3/8 iron, cement, bricks, boards, gravel and manual labor.

loans.name: Milalyn

texts.en:
Milalyn is 24 years old and married. She is from Prenza, Tangub City. Milalyn has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of the bananas. They have been raising bananas for five years and earn 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2011, Milalyn joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married mother of 4 and a farmer and salesperson, who has access to many sellers in the food chain. On her one and a half acre farm, she keeps dairy cows, poultry and a garden full of crops and trees. To make better income, Susan makes commission on sale from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for 10 years. She understands her strength is the strong relationship she has with sellers and buyers. Given that Susan can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Kindly lend to her during this festive season and make her dream come to reality.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
An energetic and honest woman, Ms. Marguerite A. is a married mother of three children. Despite running a business of cosmetic product sales, she has great difficulty in meeting the daily needs of her family. Her husband, a farmer, earns less and less due to recent climate irregularities. This poor and degrading financial situation required Ms. Marguerite A. to request her first loan in order to increase her stock of products. She repaid this loan without incident. Her capability has today earned her a good reputation in her town, and her customers have become demanding and large in number. In order to effectively meet this ever-growing demand, Ms. Marguerite A. is requesting a credit of $800 to buy a supply of cosmetic products in order to better satisfy her customers and to contribute what is needed to her family’s income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme dynamique et honnête, Madame A. Marguerite est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Malgré son commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle rencontre beaucoup de difficultés au quotidien dans la gestion des charges de sa famille. Son mari, cultivateur a des rendements de plus en plus maigres dus aux anomalies climatiques de ces derniers temps. Cette situation financière faible et dégradante obligea Madame A. Marguerite à demander un premier crédit pour agrandir son étalage. Un crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Son habileté lui confère aujourd’hui une bonne réputation dans la localité et sa clientèle est devenue abondante et exigeante. Afin de pouvoir répondre efficacement à cette demande sans cesse croissante, Madame A. Marguerite sollicite un crédit de $800 pour s’approvisionner en produits cosmétiques afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et parvenir à contribuer convenablement aux charges de son ménage.

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Agusto Cesar

texts.en: My work is transporting people from one side of the city to the other. It is for that reason that I need to keep my vehicle in good conditions, in order to offer a better service. I also have a child in school, and with this business I pay for his education.

loans.use: Purchase of tires and car parts.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 49 years old. She is married and has one son. Her husband works as an independent carpenter. She buys clothing and sells it to the people in her community. She also makes tamales in her home and sells them door-to-door in nearby communities. She is part of the “María del Carmen Group 2”, along with Laura de la Cruz Vasquez, who has a small grocery store in her house. With the loan, Teresa wants to buy more clothes to sell in the surrounding communities. Laura wants to buy merchandise like cooking oil, conserves, and non-perishable foods in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

TERESA DE JESUS, TIENE 49 AÑOS , CASADA UN HIJO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CARPINTERO EN FORMA INDEPENDIENTE. ELLA COMPRA ROPA Y LA VENDE ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD ADEMAS HACE TAMALES EN SU CASA Y LA VENDE PUERTA A PUERTA ENTRE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS .PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 , JUNTO CON LA SEÑORA LAURA DE LA CRUZ VASQUEZ QUIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO TERESA COMPRAR MAS ROPA PARA SALIR A VENDER A LAS COMUNIDADES Y LAURA COMPRAR MERCADERIA COMO ACEITE , CONSERVAS Y ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise for resale; To buy merchandise for a small grocery store

loans.name: Ndeh Joseph

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Ndeh Joseph is married and is the father of three children. All of his children are currently in school. He has spent a lot of money on medication in an attempt to cure his child of an illness that made him mute. In addition to this, he was unable to provide three square meals for his family and pay his children's school fees. This motivated him to become a member of GHAPE where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has taken out and repaid loans which enabled him to earn money to pay for school fees and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to sell groceries in the residential areas. This will reduce the need for people to travel to the main market for groceries. He plans to earn money to feed his family and to pay for school fees. He also wants to use the money to get medical help for his sick child.

He plans to repay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase meat, wine and groceries

loans.name: Judith Emilia

texts.es:
Judith is a talented young woman who has tried to give the best of herself throughout her life. Her desire to excel brought her to study cosmetology in an occupational training center, a profession to which she currently devotes herself and which has brought her much satisfaction. She is also a mother of a little girl that she cares for with all her heart and who has become the reason for living each day with optimism in spite of being a single mother. Her husband left and abandoned them, never to return. She is eager to formally open a beauty shop in a local shopping plaza in the city, hoping to give her only daughter a more proper life. She is asking for a loan of $200 with the promise of returning it in six months. We support Judith in her goals, and with your help, she can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Judith es una joven mujer talentosa que a lo largo de su vida se ha esforzado por dar siempre lo mejor de si. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a estudiar cosmetología en un centro de formación ocupacional, profesión a la que se dedica actualmente y la ha llenado de muchas satisfacciones. Es también madre de una niña a la que cuida con todo su amor y se ha convertido en el motivo por el cual vive cada día con optimismo a pesar de que su esposo no vive con ella; ya que se marchó y las abandonó para jamás volver.Ella anhela abrir formalmente su centro de belleza en un local céntrico de su ciudad con el propósito de poder brindarle una vida más decorosa a su única hija, solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en seis meses.Apoyemos a Judith a cumplir su anhelo, con tu colaboración podrá hacerlo.

loans.use: Setting up a beauty salon in local shopping plaza

loans.name: Livia

texts.en:
Livia is the owner of a small grocery store in a quiet neighborhood just outside of the downtown bustle of Ayacucho, Perú. For three years she has been running the business, chatting with customers, and buying supplies. When one steps inside the store, it’s hard to believe Livia began so humbly. Before her grocery store, Livia was selling fruits from a small cart just outside a busy Ayacuchan market. It is an exceptionally difficult way to make a living and lacks the permanence and consistency necessary to support a family. This is why, when Livia’s second daughter was born, she decided to leave fruits behind and open a grocery store from her home. She began with only 300 Nuevo Soles in her pocket (about $100 USD), and with this she was able to buy 15 lbs. each of rice, oil, flour and a few other staple food items. It certainly wasn’t much, but little by little, Livia was able to save up her money, accumulate capital, and today she has an entire grocery store filled with large varieties of foods, beverages, and household items.

A principal element in the success of Livia’s grocery store has been her village bank. When she began with 300 Nuevo Soles, it was without any economic help. However, as soon as she joined her bank and began to take out loans, she was allowed incredible economic opportunities on which she capitalized with efficiency. Her village bank also taught her how to save her money formally in an account, instead of in her home where it is very difficult to save. Due to such lessons and opportunities, Livia is able to look forward to greater aspirations for her business and family. Professionally, Livia says she would love to renovate her store and maybe one day open in a new location in the city. As far as her family of 2 daughters and a husband is concerned, she plans to renovate their home from clay and straw thatching to sturdier and more comfortable materials.

Livia is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she will be able to buy and sell more of everything she stocks in her store, thus attracting more clients and earning greater profits.

loans.use: Increase the amount and variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sophal, 43, and her husband have been married since 1983. They have eight children, six sons and two daughters. Two of their children are working, three are studying in a local school, and the other three are still young and stay at home. Sophal and her family live along National Road number five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of growing rice and running a grocery store. She started growing rice when she married and started her grocery store in 2006.

Sophal is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $100. She will use this loan to purchase grocery items for reselling in her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Kireku C Group

texts.en: This group has been together for six months. Rose is 43 years old and married with six children. She is a poultry farmer and wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land. Regina and Aisha have canteens and intend to use the loan to re-invest and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Edil

texts.es:
Mr. Edil is 37 years old and is an active man. He is a primary school teacher and father to two beautiful little girls, Nicolle and Shesira, that are the lights of his life. With the intention of improving their quality of life, as an additional source of income he drives a taxi. With this side job he has greatly improved his family’s economic situation and is very content. However, the past couple of months he hasn’t been able to drive his taxi due to mechanical problems with his mode of transportation. For this reason, this humble family man wishes to fix his taxi in order to return to his usual work routine. With your help, this young father will be able to realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Edil de 37 años de edad es un hombre activo, de profesión maestro de educación primaria, él es padre de dos hermosas nenas Nicolle y Shesira, quienes son la luz de su progreso. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida de manera adicional se dedica a prestar sus servicios de movilidad en su mototaxi, con este oficio adicional ha mejorado mucho la situación económica de su familia y está muy contento; sin embargo hace un para de meses no puede ejercer esta labor como de costumbre porque ha tenido serios desperfectos en su herramienta de trabajo.Por esa razón este humilde padre de familia desea mejorar las condiciones de su mototaxi para que pronto vuelva a su rutina de trabajo habitual. Con vuestra ayuda este joven padre podrá concretar sus deseos.

loans.use: To buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Antonia D., who is married with four children, aged between 12 and 16.

In 2005, Antonia established a grocery store, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish, oil, and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish, oil, and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Bianey

texts.en:
Bianey is the owner and operator of a small restaurant in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo.  Each day, thousands of people visit her business to enjoy the tasty Dominican plates she prepares with care. Bianey explains that people love to eat in her restaurant because she always does her best to offer a top quality service and a clean space.
The excellent chef explains that her business helps her support her two sons (six and two years old). With her loan, she’ll buy new goods in order to diversify the menu she offers to her clientele. Bianey hopes that her investment will continue her business growth and that, eventually, perhaps she can even buy some nicer furniture for her home.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other goods for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Agne Lisseth

texts.es:
Mrs. Agne is 28 years old, lives in the neighborhood of 19th of July, is single and has a daughter in school. She is currently working in a restaurant in the kitchen area. With this loan she would like to change the roof on her house and purchase wooden posts since the ones that are there are infested with termites. Her plans for the future are to provide financially for her family and be able to educate her daughter and give her a decent home

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Agne tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el barrio 19 de julio, es soltera y tiene una hija que esta estudiando. Actualmente ella trabaja en un restaurante en el área de producción, y con este préstamo que está solicitando lo desea para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y comprar también pilares de madera ya que los que tienen están ya con polillas. Los planes que tiene a futuro es ayudar en la economía de su familia y poder darle una educación a su hija y una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Change the pillars and roof of her place of residence.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi V., 26 years old, together with her husband, Mr. Nguyen Cong Tuyen, joined the TYM Fund since it first came to the area to borrow money to improve family economy. Since they have been artificially incubating eggs for 3 years, and because of good networking, their business is going very well. Besides, Mr. Tuyen also does taxi. They have stable income. Their two children are sent to school. This time, Mrs. V. wants to borrow 325 USD to buy more eggs. The average income of the whole family is about 425 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Vân 26 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Công Tuyến, ngay từ những ngày đầu Quỹ về hoạt động trên địa bàn, vợ chồng anh chị đã bàn bạc tham gia vào Quỹ để vay vốn làm ăn phát triển kinh tế gia đình, gia đình anh chị đã làm nghề ấp trứng tại nhà đuợc 3 năm, với kinh nghiện làm ăn cùng với mối quan hệ tốt nên công việc làm ăn của gia đình anh chị rất thuận lợi, ngoài việc thu nhập từ dự án trên chồng chị làm ngề lái xe nên thu nhập gia đình chị rất đều đặn, 2 con anh chị vẫn đang còn nhỏ các cháu được anh chị đầu tư ăn học đầy đủ, vòng vốn này gia đình chị muốn vay 5.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vào hàng trứng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: business in artificial egg incubation

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice K. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Beatrice and her 6 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Beatrice is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel, presently single, lives in Baalbek, a town located in the Bekaa valley. Kamel is the owner of a shop that sells air conditioning split units. 

Kamel decided to get married a couple of months ago. He would like to borrow USD 1,000 to cover the wedding expenses. This is the first time Kamel has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B., 50 years old, is a widow with four children. They are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells yams, plantains and bags of maize. She has been selling these products for the past ten years and has since been very resourceful to her family.

Afua wants to use the loan to buy in bulk a supply of plantains, bags of maize, and yams, etc. to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country.She believes this will also enable her to decrease her cost very significantly so as to increase savings to pay for her children's schooling. She is a member of the trust group called Isaiah. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy in bulk a supply of plantains, bags of maize, and yams

loans.name: Yaya

texts.en:
This is Yaya J.. He was born in Kabala about 38 years ago. Yaya is married to a business woman and the two have four children, all of whom are in primary schools. Yaya deals in cattle and has been in this business for the past 15 years now. He buys the cattle in villages surrounding Kabala, including Dogulia and Bindi. He sells in Kabala and sometimes in Bo and Kenema, both larger cities in southern and eastern Sierra Leone. Prices for cattle in the villages vary depending on the size of the cattle (between Le 70,000 and Le 90,000). He then sells the cattle at prices between Le 80,000.00 and 110,000.00.

Sometimes in his business, Yaya encounters some challenges. Challenges include slow sales, sick or dead cattle and theft. In certain cases, however, Yaya can overcome the challenge of a sick animal by taking it to the veterinarian. Previous loans have helped Yaya a great deal. Yaya was able to buy a motorbike that he uses as transportation to villages where he purchases the cattle. He can also now pay for school fees, food and clothes for his children. He is thankful for SMT, as SMT loans have improved his living condition tremendously.

Furthermore, Kiva loans to Yaya are making him and his family happy because of the financial benefit he receives from such loans. With the increased profits gained through these loans, Yaya says the burden of taking care of his family is reduced.

loans.use: Yaya would like to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Seldina Esperanza

texts.es:
Seldina es socia de Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Seldina es conviviente, tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos de 28, 21 y 17 años. El mayor de sus hijos trabaja en una farmacia, el segundo hijo está en el instituto y el ultimo esta en el colegio. 
Seldina tiene su negocio de venta de gas en su casa, empezó hace 3 años con este negocio. También tiene negocio de Internet, Seldina antes vendía dulces en la calle como ambulante, ahora se siente alegre porque puede trabajar en su casa, es mas tranquilo y ya no tiene que caminar de acá para allá todo el día. 
Seldina necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas. 
Seldina sueña con seguir creciendo en  su negocio que ahora tiene y poner mas adelante otro negocio  una librería.
texts.en:
Seldina is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. She is 51 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages 28, 21 and 17. The eldest works at a pharmacy, the middle child studies at an institute and the youngest is in high school. Seldina sells gas at her home, a business she started three years ago. She also has an Internet service business. Previously she sold candy on the streets, and now she feels happy because she can work at home, is more relaxed and doesn't have to walk this way and that all day. Seldina is requesting a $150 loan to invest in the purchase of gasoline. Her dream is to keep growing her business and later open a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gasoline

loans.name: Lina Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. LINA T., es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, se dedica a la D. venta D. ropa, principalmente deportiva, en uno D. los mercados D. ropa más grandes del país, en el cual es propietaria D. un pequeño puesto D. venta. Quedo viuda hace algunos años por lo que su trabajo es su único medio D. vida y con este esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta a sus hijos, quienes tambien colaboran en la venta D. ropa en su tiempo libre. La señora es una persona emprendedora que afronta los retos con entereza. Trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el 22 D. julio D. 2008 y actualmente paga al día sus cuotas, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mrs Lina T. is a hard worker who sells clothing - primarily sport clothes, in one of the largest clothing markets in the country where she has her own small stand. She was widowed a few years ago, and since then her job has been her only means of support. Her children also work helping her to sell clothing in their free time. Lina is an enterprising woman who faces challenges with fortituD.. She has worked with our institution since July 22, 2008, and as a responsible and hard working woman, she always makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for sale

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio inicio  el negocio ya que  requería  de una actividad económica redituable para asegurar que su hijos pudieran tener una educación universitaria como el deseo que el tenia. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1995  era ayudante en su juventud de un taller de vidriería y   cuando se caso se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y tener su propio taller gracias a su empleo anterior el ya tenia muchos clientes potenciales que conocían de la calidad de su trabajo y esto le a facilitado las cosas para tener un negocio de éxito. 

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía para atender un mayor numero de clientes y ampliar su mercado.
texts.en:
Ignacio started his business in order make enough money to ensure that his children would have the opportunity to get a college education, which he wishes he had had. He started his business in March of 1995. In his youth he was an assistant at a glass workshop and when he got married he saw the need to be independent and have his own workshop. Thanks to his previous work he had many potential clients who knew the quality of his work. This has helped him to build a very successful business.

Ignacio needs a loan for $5,000 MXN, which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he will purchase a larger quantity of supplies so that he can work with more customers and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is fifty-five years old. She is married and gave birth to seven children. Unfortunately, almost all Afia’s children are no more. She is left with one girl who has completed junior high school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and foodstuffs such as cassava and also vegetables.

Afia sells fried fish to make some income. She says she buys fresh fish and fries it herself. She supplies the fried fish mostly to food vendors in her community. According to her, the food vendors find it more convenient and affordable buying fried fish rather than frying it themselves.

Afia owns a fridge in which she stores the fresh fish she procures. She buys from big cold storage places in the nearby cities like Kumasi. She has been in business for four years. Afia wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk so she can distribute to more customers. She hopes to make enough savings to pay the costs for her daughter to climb the academic ladder.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Las Rosadas 3 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Marie and Angeline are group coordinators for the Las Rosadas bank. Angeline is an entrepreneur who sells clothing, bedding supplies, and miscellaneous beauty products. She has been running her own business for the last four years. As a immigrant from Haiti, she has few other economic opportunities available to her. Angeline works to support four children, and puts her profits towards food for the family, school fees, and maintaining her home.

Marie is an entrepreneur also involved in clothing and bedding sales, and other miscellaneous items. She has been involved in her micro-business for 2 years. She uses her profits to send her children to school. Regarding how she makes ends meet, Marie says "you can't just sit around and do nothing! Come up with something to do!"

These women describe their neighborhood as "forgotten." Their community, they say feels an economic "crisis" at hand. As Haitian immigrants, these women say they are very aware of the limited opportunities available to them. For many in their situation, university education will remain out of reach. Marie reflects that through microlending, she has achieved some important gains in her life. In particular, she was able to save money to visit her family in Haiti for the first time in nine years. This, she says, is very important to her.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan R. is 40 years old. He is married with 4 children. Jonathan has 8 years'  experience in the textile business. He is using the loan to purchase more fabric. His dream is to  run a wholesale textile enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of  fabrics for re-sale

loans.name: Rosa Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. tiene 44 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio enfermería Técnica, carrera que ejerció durante 3 años y que abandono debido a que salió embarazada, tiene 2 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella. 
Rosa se dedica a la venta de aves (pollo).  Hace 13 años, empezó vendiendo unos cuantos kilos ahora se ha hecho conocida y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido comprar el puesto donde vende. También se dedica al alquiler de taxis, empezó con uno y ahora tiene 5 que le dan  muchas ganancias. Su negocio se desarrolla en el mercado El Cortijo. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en aumentar su capital para la venta de pollo.
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pollo para la venta y la compra de repuestos para sus taxis.
Rosa tiene el gran sueño de conocer el cuzco y tener una empresa de taxis.
texts.en:
Rosa Gloria Rodrígues C. is 44 years old. She lives in El Cortijo, in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied technical nursing, a career that she practiced for three years but had to abandon when she became pregnant. She has two children that depend entirely on her.

Rosa sells poultry (chicken) and has done so for 13 years. She started selling a few kilos and now has become well-known and has many customers. With her earnings, she has been able to buy a stall to sell from. Also, she rents taxis. She began with one and now has five that bring her good income. Her business takes place in the El Cortijo market.

With her first loan of 300 soles ($100 USD) that she received from the community bank “Nuevo Perú,” she invested to increase her capital in poultry sales.

With this loan of 1700 soles ($550 USD), which will be paid off in six months, she will invest in the purchase of chicken for sale and spare parts for her taxis.

Rosa has a dream of going to Cuzco and having a taxi business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken in bulk. Purchase of spare parts for taxis.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah O. is a trader who sells corn and cassava dough in Kotokraba near Cape Coast. She is married with 4 children and her husband works as a steel bender. Hannah is an experienced business woman and has been in her trade for four years. She is responsible for helping to pay household expenses, such as utilities. Her loan will be used to increase the capital for her corn and cassava dough trading business. She hopes to use the new profits to buy land for a building.

loans.use: Loan will be used to increase capital for corn and cassava dough business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Since she was a small girl, Saodat has been entirely dedicated to her work. She buys and sells cattle. Until now this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising beef cattle and, after fattening them, she sells at the best price and makes a profit. In the future, she wants to start another business. In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to cattle-raising.

Right now she wishes to expand her business and purchase more cattle. This is the reason that Saodat has asked for a loan of $600.

By helping in this loan, you could become an important part in Saodat's family's life: she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.
