More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the site of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad L. buys and sells sound systems.  She has four children.

She asks for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy sound systems for sale. She is also considering other business opportunities. In this way, she thinks she could sell more and earn enough for the family.

Through tghe help of CEVI, Mrs. L. was able to sustain her business for a long time already. She is provided with loans but also with training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy sound systems for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of charcoal

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí a group of women started gathering with a strong desire to start productive entrepreneurial activities and to increase the capital for their businesses. From there they put themselves in contact with the Fundación Paraguaya in order to enroll themselves in the program of Committees for Women Entrepreneurs.  
The committee is named Kuña Katupyry, which is now in its tenth cycle with the Fundación. It is made up of 18 selfless women who fight daily to give the best they can to their families.  All of the participants are hard-working women, and they invest their loans in their respective businesses. 

1	Carmen Miranda-	General sales 
2	Catalina V.-  	Cosmetics products 
3	Celisa G.-    	General sales 
4	Rosa R.-      	Lottery ticket sales 
5	Sandra V.-  	Domestic employee 
6	Gladys S.-      	Food sales 
7	Salustia B.-	Handicrafts 
8	Mirtha V.-     	Food sales 
9	Luisa C.-      	Grocery store 
10	Nancy F.-	Dressmaker 
11	Barbara V.- 	Undergarment sales 
12	Edelmira Giménez-	Undergarment sales 
13	Regina L.-      	Grocery store 
14	Ramona I.-    	Domestic employee 
15	Felicia F.-      	Fruit and vegetable sales 
16	Raimunda M.- Milk sales 
17	Juana S.-        	Traveling sales 
18	Lilian F.- 	Handicrafts

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials or of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 50 años, es madre de 3 hijos; 2 de ellos mayores de edad, trabajan y la apoyan en lo posible, y el menor que es estudiante. Su esposo es agricultor y todos habitan en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a brindar servicios de costura de ropa, y está al pendiente de quedar bien con sus clientes para que se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Gladis considera que su negocio es rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes regulares que aprecian su trabajo y la recomiendan con otras personas; además, por encontrarse cerca de una institución educativa aprovecha de vender jugos de fruta en la parte de afuera de su casa y le va muy bien. Para más adelante, Gladis quisiera tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y existe mucho compañerismo entre ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales textiles para confeccionar diferentes prendas, calcula que gastará 500 soles, con la diferencia adquirirá materiales de construcción para mandar a reparar algunas estructuras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50, and she has three children. Two of her children are grown, and they work and support her as much as possible. Her younger child goes to school. Her husband is a farmer and they all live together in their own house. For ten years she has been working as a seamstress. She makes sure to take good care of her customers so that they are satisfied with her good work. Gladis considers the business to be profitable because she has a good range of regular customers who appreciate her work and recommend her to other people. Also, she takes advantage of being close to an educational institution by selling fruit juice in front of her house. This is going very well. In the future Gladis would like to have a business selling groceries. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members are responsible and there is much camaraderie among them. With the money she is asking for she will buy textile materials to make different articles of clothing, which she calculates will cost 500 PEN. With the rest of the money she will buy construction materials to make some repairs on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textile materials and fix her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a member of Tujikomboe Group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of one child. Her child is four years old.

Mary started her own clothing business selling clothes five years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mary's second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 250,000 in order to buy more clothes for selling. With the additional profit she gains from this loan, Mary hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Cebatakolo Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Cebatakolo group. They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time to enable them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting schools expenses. 

Santigie J. (left) is the leader of this group. Santigie was born in Magburaka town and he is twenty-five years old. He is single. Santigie is an Okada (motorbike) driver. He has been an Okada driver for five years now. Santigie will add some money to this loan to buy himself a new motorbike.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. has been a CEVI client for seven years now. She has a rice farm that secures all her family's needs, including food and other costs in their home. Her 2-hectare farm produces an average of 180 sacks per harvest. She has seven children who are not living with her anymore. Her eldest is 35. She has grandchildren, who she also supports. 

She needs additional capital to finance her farm. She would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farming supplies. She will also use some of the loans to start another business, to supplement the family income.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and she is married to Severino, a utility worker. They were blessed with six children. Her eldest is already in third year college, followed by her two children who were both elementary graduates, next to them is a farmer, her fourth child is also an elementary graduate and their youngest is now a first year high school student. Her family is residing at Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan Isabela, it is a rural area and it is located one kilometer from the provincial highway.
	
She is engaged in selling second hand or used clothing in their village at very low prices. Sometimes she also retails vegetables in their village for almost a year. She is earning the amount of PHP1, 500 weekly from both of her business. She decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP9, 000 that will be helpful in making her business become progressive for the welfare of her family. Luzviminda is also praying for the success of her business and it was being accompanied with action for she believes, actions can speaks louder than words.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Angua

texts.en:
Angua L. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell.  Angua is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Jaylen

texts.en:
“SUCCESS is always at the end of every sacrifice”, a word of encouragement shared by Jaylen A. of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old, married to Gilbert and blessed with three children. As parents, they want to send their children to school and have them finish their studies.  

The main source of their income is through farming. Her husband cultivates their farm lot by planting a variety of vegetables and rice. Since income from farming is seasonal, she is engaged in selling frozen foods in their village for additional income. She is now borrowing a loan of PHP5,000.00 from KIVA lenders to be used to purchase more frozen foods that she will sell in their village.  She is thankful for this financial assistance because she has the opportunity to improve her small business.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Chilhaa

texts.en:
N. is 50 years old and lives by herself in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. N. operates a business in her town sewing clothes. She started her business in 2005, out of a rented booth, and now her working capital exceeds 700,000 tugrugs (~492 USD). In the past, she has gotten a loan from Xac bank, one of the largest banks in Mongolia, and has paid back the loan in full and on time. She would like to own a workshop in the future where she can sew her clothes. N. is requesting a loan of 700,000 tugrug  (~492 USD) in order to purchase fabric and finishing materials for her business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and finishing materials for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita G. is from the village of West Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business venture operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut wine freshly made from coconut sap. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly O., (pictured with his wife and daughter), 38 and his wife, Mrs. Ngoun Eng  Choek, 34, have been married for fourteen years, and have just one daughter who is attending school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number 2 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Ly has been a motor taxi driver for one year, while his wife has been a silk weaver since she was young. He is asking for his first loan of US$250 to help his wife to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina U. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yessica Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Yessica tiene 37  años de edad es casada  tiene 3 hijos de 11,9 y 5 años de edad ,su conyugue es maestro de construccion civil. Cuenta con  casa propia   de material noble semi construida en barrio Los escates, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en local alquilado en el centro comercial  Grau ubicado en la primera cuadra de la calle cajamarca, se inicio en este negocio hace 3 años, se inicio como ayudante, ahora cuenta con negocio propio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mas mercaderia. La Sra. Yessica tiene muchos sueños y esperanzas una de ellas es poder crecer  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yessica is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children; ages 11, 9, and 5. Her husband is a master of civil engineering. She has her own house, made of sturdy materials, in the neighborhood Los Escates. She makes a living by selling clothing in a rented space in a mall named Grau, located on the first block of Cajamarca Street. Three years ago, she started in this business as an assistant, and now she has her own business. With the money that she is requesting, she will invest in more merchandise. Yessica has many hopes and dreams, one of them being to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, merchandise

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El sr. Jose Manuel Bermúdez trabaja en la alcaldía su cargo es operario trabaja en los viveros tiene dos años de trabajar para esta institución el crédito lo solicita para remodelación de su casa compra de piedra y cemento ya es el segundo crédito con nosotros él dice que el primer crédito le ayudo mucho ya que pudo comprar parte de los materiales que utilizo en la construcción de su humilde casa, le tiene dos bebe
texts.en:
Senor Jose Manuel Bermúdez works in the municipal fish hatchery. He has worked at this institution for 2 years. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase stone and cement to remodel his house. This is the second loan with us. He says that the first loan helped him a lot, enabling him to purchase the materials to build his modest home. He is the father of two babies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and stones

loans.name: Khudoidod

texts.en: K. Khudoidod is married and has seven children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Khudoidod has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $100 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise four years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today this business has become domestic as his children and wife are also engaged in it. Today Khudoidod needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his selling goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1,250 USD. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe Khudoidod’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. has six children to nurture and look after until they are fully grown and independent from her. At their current ages, which range from 2 to 18 years old, everything they need depends on Grace and her husband’s income. Because of the very poor condition of Grace and her husband’s economy, their two eldest children have stopped schooling. Grace, however, is sad about this and is scared that the rest of their children would end up in high school and not in college. She is worried that her children will walk through the same pattern of life as hers. To keep her children away from the kind of life she had and is still having now, she joined ASHI and is requesting for a loan to start a hog-fattening business. The hogs/pigs she will fatten in four months will be sold either alive or slaughtered thereafter. The profit on this kind of business is much bigger once the volume of hogs fattened and sold is added together.

loans.use: To purchase hogs/pigs for fattening and selling

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima A. is from the village of Manano, Mallig, Isabela. She is 37 years old and is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fatima A.'s Group.

Fatima is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Fatima owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fatima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Fatima has now requested a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Fatima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor SANTIAGO S. R., Labora como  vigilante  en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua y padre de familia de tres niños a los que tiene en el colegio, el junto con su esposa han sacado a delante la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como pintura y 2 hojas de zinc, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago S. R. works as a guard in the Iván Montenegro of Managua market. He is the father of three children who are in school, and together with his wife, they have given the children a better future. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials such as paint, and 2 sheets of zinc. These materials are for the remodeling of their home, with the goal of giving the children safer and better living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita P. is from the village of Talakag  Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Amelita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Amelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Uvbi

texts.en:
Uvbi sells cola nuts (an African nut containing caffeine) at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to be a major cola nut distributor in her city in the future.

Cola nuts are highly cherished in Nigeria and the demand for them is high. In some arrears in Nigeria cola nuts are eaten, while some people worship the cola nut and others just plant the cola nuts to make money. In Nigeria, the cola nut is presented at all traditional ceremonies and Nigerians believe that the cola nut does not understand the English language but only the local languages.

Uvbi is 47 years old and is married with seven children. Her husband is a commercial farmer and he also supports their home.

Uvbi is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cola nuts to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cola nuts to sell

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang N. is a local teacher who lives in a fallow village in Kampong Thom Province. Besides her teaching job, she also takes time to grow rice twice a year, during the rainy and dry seasons.

Heang N. has been farming since 1999, while her husband, Mr. Vorn, is an internal staff member in a non-government organization. Heang N. has given birth to three children who are now teenagers and are going to school.

This rainy season, which is the season for farming a rice crop, Heang N. is lacking some materials for her farming business. Thus, she requests a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for cultivating.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta M. is from the village of Ceboneg, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children.

Gualberta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruit like bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gualberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Gualberta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jerimina

texts.en:
58-year-old K. Jerimina is a happy-go-lucky and down-to-earth married mother of four kids. She is widowed but she has ably carried on her shoulders the responsibility and burden of being the family’s breadwinner with enough courage and conviction, ever since her husband passed on.

This is all down to the hard work Jerimina has brought to bear in her banana plantation farming business. This banana farming and selling business has been her family’s recourse for the last fifteen years and, with it, she has given her children a worthwhile education.

Jerimina’s profits per month are in the range of 180,000 to 200,000 shillings, depending on the season. She was at first a retailer but quit. With this loan, she is hoping to revamp her banana plantation with purchased fertilizer and manure that she hopes will improve her yield and, in the course of time, her income.

loans.use: To purchase high-grade fertilizer and manure for her banana gardens

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace D. is from the village of San Isidro, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Mary Grace is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling flowers in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: as working capital

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa  propia. Tiene 9 años D. experiencia en la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en un puesto D. mercado cerca D. su casa, atienD. todas las mañanas hasta la tarD.. La atención que le da al publico es muy cálido y amable, procurando siempre dar un peso exacto y justo a los productos que venD., es así que ha logrado que sus clientes siempre acudan a su establecimiento. En ocasiones su hija mayor y su esposo la ayudan en el trabajo, pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio. Afirma que le agrada atender a sus clientes, ya que es muy comunicativa. Esta actividad  le ha resultado  beneficiosa en las rentas, por lo que desea continuar por muchos años más, con miras a crecer y tener una tienda mayorista D. productos D. primera necesidad en su misma casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, menestras y fideos que le servirá para  aumentar la mercadería disponible en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayela is 55 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own house. She has 9 years of experience in the sale of basic products in a market stall near their home. She tends to her shop every day from morning until afternoon. The attention which she gives to the public is very warm and kind, always trying to give an exact and fair weight to all the products that she sells. In this way, she has succeeded in having customers who always come to her shop. Occasionally her oldest daughter and her husband help her in her work, but generally she is the only one responsible for the business. She confirms that it pleases her to assist her customers, since she is very communicative. This business has been beneficial to her income, and for this reason she wants to continue for many more years, with a view to growing and having a wholesale store for basic products in her own home. This is Mayela's fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, she is happy to be part of her community bank because all the members are very responsible and united people. She is also thankful to those people who will be grantors of the loan she is applying for, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, dried beans, and pasta, which will increase the merchandise available in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products to stock her store

loans.name: Elvish

texts.es:
Elvish tiene 27 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa Gladis y su hija Luana. Gladis y Elvish distribuyen sandalias y sombreros por mayor en el mercado el molino, ellos dejan sus productos al crédito a sus clientes y al final del mes le pagan una cantidad de dinero. Elvish también tiene un puesto de venta, en la calle trinitarias en el centro del Cusco, donde vende sandalias y sombreros. Le pueden encontrar en su puesto, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Elvish espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su puesto de venta. Le gustaría  con el dinero del préstamo traer sandalias  y sombreros de la ciudad de Lima para que siga distribuyendo a sus caseras del mercado “El Molino”. El anhelo de Elvish es convertirse en un exitoso empresario después desea comprarse un carro.  

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Elvish hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Elvish, 27, lives in the city of Cusco with his wife, Gladis, and their daughter, Luana. Gladis and Elvish sell sandals and hats at wholesale in the El Molino Market. They sell to their customers on credit and collect at the end of the month. Elvish also has a small sales stand on Trinitarias Street in downtown Cusco where he sells hats and sandals. He can be found tending his stand seven days a week from 8:30am until 9pm. Elvish expects to get $400 USD in his next loan. He currently has enough stock items for his sales stand but would like to use the funds to get more sandals and hats from the city of Lima to supply his vendors in El Molino Market. Elvish’s dream is to become a successful businessman and then wants to buy a car. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (San Jerónimo Lionesses) communal bank has been in operation for 10 years. Elvish has participated in it for several years and does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and hats.

loans.name: Mrs. Met Mai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fourteen people who live I. the village of Prey Slaeng, I. Takeo province. Mrs. Met M. is the village bank president. She was selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for various goals. 

Mrs. Met M. was born I. 1969. She is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress I. garment factory, two attend school, and the youngest is three years old. Her husband, Mr. Sok S., is a farmer who owns a one and half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to help support their family. He also works as a construction worker.

Mrs. Met M. is a pig breeder and she also owns a general store I. a local village. She is able to earn a large profit to help support her family. Since her breeding is going well, Mrs. Met M. wants to expand. She is applying for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy more groceries for resale.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Kiira Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
A. Stella belongs to Kiira Women’s Group-Jinja. 

38-year-old A. Stella has brought hard work to bear the last seven years operating her retail shop which was gotten off its feet with the modest savings she had accumulated from her hawker business. The support of her husband was also instrumental in getting her business off its feet. Since then she has been steadfastly dedicated to the goals and set objectives that were laid down at the beginning of this business. 

She supplements her profits with a poultry business.  In a week this widowed mother of four made a profit of about $36. With this loan she is looking at buying more bags of sugar for resale.

loans.use: The buy more bags of sugar for resale

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida D. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Adelaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty H. is currently in the business of selling food stuffs at the hotel and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell.  Betty is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 7 children and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to move her business forward

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some important things for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some essential materials

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es:
Juan Pedro tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el anexo Los Mestas del caserío Sialupe Huamantanga, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situado a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo caracterizada por que sus pobladores son personas humildes y trabajadoras.

El cuenta con animales menores, como ovejas, los cuales cría en su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando sus animales se desarrollan completamente los ofrece en venta en su domicilio al publico en general y a los diferentes negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta es la principal fuente de ingreso con la que sustenta la economía de su familia.

Juan desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio por temporada navideña. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan Pedro is 46 years old.  He is married and lives with his family in Los Mestas annex of the village of Sialupe Huamantanga.  This is a rural area of Lambayeque district which is more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo and is noted for the fact that most of its residents are modest and hard-working people.

Juan owns young animals such as sheep which he raises at home, feeding them grain and natural fodder  When his animals have developed completely he offers them for sale from his home to the general public and the traders who always visit his district.  This is his main source of income through which he supports his family financially.

Juan would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed to expand his business over the Christmas period.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa as this will help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed to expand his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena G. D. O. D. 43 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo en Lourdes Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee un chalet en el cual comercializa golosinas, bebidas, alimentos, frutas, agua embotellada y otros productos más, su negocio se encuentra dentro D. un colegio, por lo que sus ventas son muy estables, así mismo no tiene ningún tipo D. competencia por lo que es un negocio bastante rentable, durante los tiempos D. vacaciones escolares, sus ventas se mantienen gracias a los cursos D. verano que algunos alumnos realizan. Rosa solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. comprar mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios así como también diferentes tipos D. bebidas, D. esta manera ella podrá brindar diferentes precios lo cual le permita contar con más clientes, lo cual será D. mucho beneficio para ella y su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa Elena G. D. O.  is 43, and lives with her husband in Lourdes Colón in La Libertad Department.  She has a stand where she sells candies, drinks, food, fruit, bottled water and other products.  The business is located insiD. a school which make her sales stable.  She has no competition so her business is very solid.  During school vacations she continues to do well because of summer courses that some students take.  Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more food products and also different kinds of drinks.  This way she can offer better prices and thus have more customers so that she better benefits herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy candies, drinks and other food products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes M., 60, is a widowed mother of eight children who are all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya where she has been farming for more than 40 years. She employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, potatoes, bananas and milk which she sells locally. She solely depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in the education of her children and grandchildren. Her major challenges have been poor weather conditions, and pests and diseases which affect her production. She plans to acquire two more dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 
Hermelinda, tiene 50 años y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en el departamento de Cusco provincia de la Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, el socio Hermelinda vive en el distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Hermelinda trabaja en el gobierno regional del Cusco en el área de gerencia regional.  La socia en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta productos de belleza. Desde el año 2004 se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Hermelinda con el microcrédito desea comprar más productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Hermelinda belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.

Hermelinda is 50 years old and has three children. She was born in the Cusco department, province of Cusco, Perú. At present, Hermelinda lives in the district of Wanchaq in the city of Cusco.

Hermelinda works for the regional government of Cusco in the regional management area. The member in her free time works selling beauty products. Since 2004 she has been in her business and has done very well thanks to the hard work she puts into it. Hermelinda with the microloan will buy more beauty products.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Azamat's Group

texts.en:
Azamat J. U., 19, is the youngest member of this group. He’s a resident of Karabalta and lives with his seventeen-year-old sister, who is financially dependent on him. Azamat is a part-time student at a local university, and when he’s free from studies, he works in a local market selling vegetables. He has done this for two years and says that it gets frustrating sometimes as he faces challenges such as perishable products, weather conditions and inflation. He believes that the secret of success in retail is high quality, so he tries to deliver wholesale goods on time and at a more affordable price than his competitors. 

The idea for the business came from Azamat’s mother, who helped him start it by buying three sacks of potatoes. Since then Azamat has achieved good results. He’s earned enough to pay his university tuition and has applied for a loan from Kiva, because he would like to purchase a small shop. Working in an open air market makes it more difficult for him to deliver his services, especially in cold winter conditions. Teenage labor has increased recently in Kyrgyzstan. The causes are few opportunities to get a college education and the availability of low-paid jobs.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society); Planet (keeping environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team — Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a small kiosk

loans.name: Emtethal

texts.en:
Emtethal is a Palestinian woman from Tulkarem town. Emtethal lives with her parents and works in a school in Tulkarem, Emtethal shares with her father the responsibility for covering household expenses.

She took a loan from FATEN to pay for needed home expenses and buy a bed for her room. Emtethal appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: pay for needed home expenses and furniture

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is married to a businessman. They have two children. She has completed a junior high school education. For four years now, Grace has been selling condiments, oil and other items in Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. 

Grace uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Grace will use the loan to purchase additional goods to expand her business. She would want to use the new profit to further the growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to expand her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 34 años; se separó hace 9 meses de su esposo. A pesar de su tristeza, ella continúa trabajando por sus 2 hijos: Fernando y Sandra; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La actividad a la que se dedica es la siembra de café y plátanos; en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos propios, situados en la zona alta de su comunidad. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo pudo obtener ganancias seguras, pues vende sus granos en la cooperativa de Sanchirio Palomar, asimismo cuenta que en temporadas de gran cosecha los mismos intermediarios llegan a su chacra para comercializar sus cultivos íntegros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo, “odio el bullicio de la ciudad”, afirma. Por el futuro de sus hijos, pues en ellos invierte la mayor cantidad de su ganancia, está pensando incrementar la expansión de sus terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brindan. Patricia, se está preparando para la cosecha de café. Por ello cuenta que con el crédito, está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico para que no realice el proceso de paleo (extracción de la planta de café por sobreproducción de granos de café, evitando que la próxima cosecha sea de baja calidad); asimismo en la compra de canastas y costales para la cosecha.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 34, separated from her husband nine months ago. Despite her sadness she continues work on behalf of her two children, Fernando and Sandra, and take care of them from her home in Unión Palomar, which is located in the central Peruvian jungle. Patricia grows coffee and bananas on three hectares of farmland that she owns in the upper district of her community. She already has eight years of experience and has been able to generate steady income throughout that time. Patricia sells her coffee beans at the Sanchirio Palomar Cooperative, but whenever she has a large harvest, she will also sell to brokers who come to her farm so that they can buy coffee directly from her. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to spend the bulk of her time in the field. “I hate the bustle of the city,” says Patricia. She plans to invest a large portion of her earnings in the acquisition of more farmland so that she can provide for her children’s future.

Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollnado Para El Futuro de Prisma” (Developing for the Future of Prisma). This is her first loan with MFP. She is pleased to be given the opportunity to develop. Patricia is preparing for the coffee harvest, so she will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to prevent her coffee plants from overproducing, which can result in low quality beans during the next harvest. In addition, she will purchase baskets and sacks for collecting the coffee beans during the harvest.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, baskets, and sacks for collecting coffee beans.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz.Doña Veronica tiene la edad de 27 años estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor german el cual trabaja de herrero y albañil. ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y uno es hombre. 

Doña veronica nos platica que ella desea iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella desea inicia a a vender abarrotes desde su hogar con sus amigos y vecionos.

ella tiene pensado invertir su credito en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para surtir su negocio. 

ella nos dice que en su casa tiene un pequeño local en el cual piensa poner su negocio, tambien nos comenta que ella espera que su negocio le deje buenas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo y que su negocio cresca ya que desea darle estudios a sus pequeños y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Veronica is 27 years old and has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. German, who works as a blacksmith and mason. They have four children, three daughters and one son.

Doña Veronica says she wanted to start her own business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s studies. She began selling groceries out of her home to friends and neighbors.

Veronica plans to invest her loan in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned peppers to restock her business. She says that she has a small space in her home where she operates her business. Veronica says that she hopes to generate good earnings so that she can continue investing in her business to make it grow, provide for her children’s education, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan is 48 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest daughter is married and lives separately with her family.

Jargalsaikhan is a driver and runs a transportation business. He owns a minivan and transports people on one of the remote bus routes of Ulaanbaatar which lacks buses. He has special permission from city council to carry people on specific routes. Jargalsaikhan is a hardworking, sociable person.

In 2010, he bought a plot of land and is planning to build a house on it. He lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) at the moment. He has a building project on hand and is planning to start the project now.

The loan Mr. Jargalsaikhan is requesting will be used to buy necessary building materials such as cement, bricks, wooden planks, sand and so on to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, wooden planks, sand, etc. to build a family house.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Ouynchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her elder daughter is a student. 

Ouynchimeg manages a grocery trading store with the help of her husband. She started her business in 1997. Previously, she operated a small grocery booth. Through years of business operation she managed to stabilize her business and build a grocery store near to her home. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I am planning to make my store building much bigger in the future." She is requesting a 3,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Salinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes tienen nueve ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido dos préstamos Kiva. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Raquel del Socorro de 33 años desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Ella inicio vendiendo leche en Managua y ahora además de la leche vende queso, crema, cuajada etc. y ropa usada.

Las otras integrantes son Reyna de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa en su casa y en Tisma desde hace 3 años y Andrea Asunción de 24 años tiene un puesto de verduras.
texts.en:
This group is composed by three hard working, enterprising women who have been working with Admin for nine cycles and have had two Kiva loans.  The group Coordinator is Raquel del Socorro, 33.  She’s been selling dairy products for about 10 years.  She started out selling milk in Managua and now, besides milk, she also sells cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc. and used clothes.

The other members are Reyna, 30, who has been selling clothes at home and in Tisma for the last three years and Andrea Asunción, 24, who has a vegetable stand.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo es un padre de familia de 65 años  de edad, vive con su espos e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, la cual está ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Mateo se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, lo que le permite poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para realizar el deshierbo de la misma, para que puedan tener un creciemiento óptimo de sus plantaciones, con la finalidad que una vez que lo comercialice puedan darle un buen precio lo que le permitirá brindar en su casa algunas comodidades para sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Mateo es un padre de familia de 65 años  de edad, vive con su espos e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, la cual está ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Mateo se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, lo que le permite poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para realizar el deshierbo de la misma, para que puedan tener un creciemiento óptimo de sus plantaciones, con la finalidad que una vez que lo comercialice puedan darle un buen precio lo que le permitirá brindar en su casa algunas comodidades para sus hijos y esposa.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Matea  works hard to support her family. She has a fruit & vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Matea  is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

Matea  has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Danniel

texts.en: Danniel is 29 years old, married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past five years and is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm supplies, including seeds and fertilizer, and additional livestock. He has been a good client and paid back his first loan completely and on-time. He hopes to use his profits to educate his children and expand his farm. He dreams of being a prosperous farmer and providing his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela is 19 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is single and lives on her own with her four-year-old daughter. Daniela is a sociable and friendly person. She recently began her own small business selling Yanbal, a brand of cosmetics products that are sold by individual women entrepreneurs across the country. She wants to expand the amount of products she is able to offer though Yanbal and is seeking this microloan to purchase more cosmetics for resale. This is her first loan and she hopes it will increase the products she sells and add to her well-being and the well-being of her family. In the future, she hopes to own a Yanbal store.

loans.use: to purchase more Yanbal brand cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, 43, is married with four school-aged children. His wife served as a health worker in their village. He has been engaged in growing rice for 21 years. Farming is the primary source of income that his family relies on. 

He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of rice fields. Someday, Felipe dreams that his children will finish their education and eventually be employed with stable jobs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of rice fields.

loans.name: Maria Rogelia

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. Túcume, que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (cuenta con sitios arqueológicos muy bonitos para visitar).

María desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción D. leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores D. la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado D. Lambayeque, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad D. leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones D. su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla D. 1500 nuevos soles para compra D. animales D. otras especies (aves D. corral) y su respectivo alimento para que se incremente la producción D. la leche D. vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que tenga más comodidades en su casa pera su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. They receive services, such as running water and electricity. María resides in the rural section of the District of Túcume, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area has developed businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism (there are several beautiful archaeological sites that people can visit).

María has been raising and selling cattle for a few years. She has a corral that is located in an area outsiD. of her house. The animals are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses so that they will produce a good amount of milk, which is offered to the local residents or taken to the market in Lambayeque to sell. María has an established customer base that is of good quality because of the milk she offers. With the income, she is able to meet her household obligations.

María is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN through its Seed Capital Program. The money will be used to buy animals of other species (specifically chickens) and the respective feed for her cows in order to increase milk production. This will allow María to obtain the best price for her products so that she can repay the loan and improve her standard of living.

María is a hardworking and responsible person. The only thing she wants is to see her business grow so that she can acquire more household comforts for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cattle feed.

loans.name: 74 Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên has a business selling mobile phones. She is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones to resell.

Liên is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Liên is the group leader of the 74 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of transportation. With her business profit, Liên hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Marirose

texts.en:
Due to financial burdens, Marirose did not pursue her college education. She is married to a farmer and is raising their family in a village while planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is now 28 years old and has two infant-age children. With her husband, they are striving hard to cultivate their rice field to earn income and support their family needs.

They aim to increase their yields and income to renovate their house to have a comfortable shelter and also to save for the future of their children. But due to inadequate capital, Marirose needs to ask for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to sustain their rice production. They are hoping that this loan will help them to increase their yields and income as they work hard for it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: The picture above depicts Ekua selling food items such as fresh tomatoes, onions, spices, garden eggs and other things at Abura. She is married and has 5 children. As part of her responsibilities, she makes sure the children are fed every day. The loan will be used to obtain more tomatoes, onions spices, garden eggs and other items to sell.

loans.use: to obtain more tomatoes, onions spices, garden eggs and other items to sell.

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Juana Del Rosario tiene 27 años, su actividad es una pequeña pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, pues como toda madre responsable siempre está brindándoles la mejor atención a sus hijos. Ella compra sus productos en el mercado en donde los obtiene mucho más favorables. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Del Rosario is 27 years old and she has been running a small corner shop for more than 8 years. She has 2 children who are minor and she is responsible for them like every good mother, always providing them with the best care. She buys her products in the market, obtaining them at very fair prices. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweets, basic grains, detergents, soups and canned food among other items.

loans.use: To buy sweets, basic grains, detergents and soups.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Jargalsaikhan is 35 years old and a mother of three teenage children. She lives with her husband and children in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. Her children all attend a secondary school. Jargalsaikhan runs a baggage keeping business in the “Narantuul” International bazaar, the biggest Mongolian outdoor market. Her husband helps her with the business when he has a day off. 

She said their living condition is quite bad and she has been trying hard to get education to her three children and pay its or other expenses for a long time. Due to this, she made a plan which is aimed at increasing her earnings in phases. First, her business needs a vehicle to deliver the baggage to the customers from the other bazaars around the city. This is very important to her ongoing business and in order to expand successfully.  Jargalsaikhan is requesting a loan to purchase a vehicle in order to deliver the baggage to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle in order to deliver the baggage to her customers.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo de 41 años de edad, convive con Inés 54 años, con quien tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Leonardo es un hombre  que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener una personalidad honorable, él nos comenta, que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar constantemente para obtener todo lo que hasta ahora ha logrado. La encargada en su bodega es su querida esposa, quien administra y dirige todo el movimiento, mientras que Leonardo es el encargado del bar, atendiendo a la clientela. Él está feliz con el negocio que tiene por que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su familia. En un futuro próximo desea abrir una tienda de venta de vestidos ya que en su localidad hace falta uno pero enfocado para los más pequeños. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar su bar.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 41, lives with Inés, 54, with whom he has three children.  They live together in their own house located in Sivia District.  Leonardo is a man who has always been noted for having an honorable personality.  He tells us that ever since he was very young he’s had to work constantly to obtain everything he’s accomplished to date.  His beloved wife looks after the store and directs all transactions while Leonardo runs the bar tending to customers.  He is happy with the business he has because thanks to it he’s able to cover family expenses. In the near future he’d like to open a dress shop because his location lacks one especially one specializing in children’s clothes.

This is his first MFP loan and he pledges to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles he’s requesting to buy more stock merchandise for his bar.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for his bar.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 55-year-old retired man who is married and has seven sons and daughters. Two of his sons have gotten married already.

After retirement, Khaled opened a car repair shop for repairing and selling some car parts. At first, it was a little bit challenging since he had no experience in that field. However, to be able to support his family and make his business work, he learned all that he needed in a short time until he is now one of the best-known car repair shops in the area.

Khaled has applied today for a loan in order to add some decoration to the shop and buy products that are missing from his store.

loans.use: to add decoration to his car repair shop and buy more products

loans.name: Zobeida

texts.es:
Zobeida tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo menor a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pedregal Bajo del Distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Zobeida vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y aún no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Zobeida se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, teniendo actualmente 25 gallinas y 10 patos, los cuales engorda para venderlos en mercado local y además se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un colegio cercano a su domicilio, atendiendo todos los días de la semana, lo cual le genera ingresos diarios para cubrir sus gastos. Asimismo su padre la apoya en las actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar con sus padres, quienes también apoyan para el crecimiento de su negocio. 

Zobeida desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus aves de corral y compra de mercadería, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa, para con ello lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Zobeida is 32 years old and a single mother of one child.  She lives in her parent's house, which is located in the village of Pedregal Bajo in the district of Tambogrande, about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.  Zobeida lives in the rural part of the district that does not have utilities.  

Zobeida works raising poultry.  She currently has 25 hens and 10 ducks, which she is fattening to sell in the local market.  She also sells sweets at the school near her home every day, which generates daily income to meet her expenses.  Additionally, her father supports the activities she does.  She has a good family relationship with her parents, who also support the growth of her business.

Zobeida wants to purchase balanced feed to fatten her poultry and purchase merchandise.  This investment will allow her to continue growing and improve her quality of life.  In order to achieve this goal, she has requested a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Deborah is a widow with three children, two of whom are old enough to attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past 11 years, she has earned a living by selling food to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the seasonal nature of her business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 100,000 to open a handcart business by buying 10 handcarts and bundles of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat. She joined Yehu as a way to expand her business.

loans.use: to establish a hand cart business by buying 10 handcarts and bundles of ingredients.

loans.name: Rokel Social Club Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present the members of the 'Rokel Social Club' group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Rugiatu is the leader of this group. Rugiatu is thirty-six years old and married. She has three children. Two are in primary school while the youngest isn't old enough to go to school yet. Rugiatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), and uncooked rice. With the help of this loan, Rugiatu will invest in her business by buying gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity.  His greatest monthly expense is food for himself.  

Joshua has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years.  His clients are local residents.  He faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities. He dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase more potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages for resale.  He decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock like pants, shirts, underwear, blouses and jackets to sell

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicio, agricultura, producción, comercio de cultivos.
