La señora Verónica indica que es la primera vez que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de un promotor que llego a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior al cultivo lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE PAPA” community bank are starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors.  The bank's secretary is Verónica.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include services, farming, production and selling crops.

Verónica tells us that this is the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer who came to her house.  She currently has a farming business which she has been working in for years.  She learned the business from her parents.

The loan that Verónica is taking out will be used to grow her business.  She will buy seeds in La Ceja and, when they have grown, she will sell her crops to order.  This work allows her to make the income she needs to support her family.  She lives together with her partner and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Verónica replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Phean

texts.en:
Phean is 47 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

Phean and her husband are construction workers.  All of her children are employed: two are garment workers and one is a construction worker.  Due to the difficulty of traveling to work, Phean is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.  By doing so, she will more easily get to work and save some money from her transportation expenses to better support the family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to be a construction foreman and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Rajina

texts.en:
Rajina is a resident of the town of Jeypore, in Odisha. She is 29 years old and staying with her parents and children. She has been supporting her family through the income earned from a small vegetable and grocery store. She sells food items like potatoes, onions, wafers, green vegetables, detergents, rice, wheat flour, snacks, spices, electric bulbs and other household items in her village. She has had it for the last three years. She needs a loan of 36,000 INR in order to buy more stock of snacks, spices and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for her shop. 

She says there is good demand for mosquito repellents and sanitize-r as mosquito borne diseases are very widely prevalent in her village. She wants to increase her income and save some money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, spices and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for his shop

loans.name: Boane Agriculture Students Ii Group

texts.en: In Mozambique, less than 20% of people have a secondary education. This amazing group of students, however, is passionate about agriculture and have achieved a placement in higher education at the Agricultural Institute of Boane in rural, southern Mozambique. Their education also includes acting as extension workers, so they can earn some income to provide for their families as well. They visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and they provide advice on how to improve their crops. The more farmers they can visit each week, the more they earn. With a bicycle, they can each visit two times the farmers and double their weekly incomes.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle to visit farmers and earn wages for agricultural assistance and delivery of fertilizers.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 41-year-old; married woman lives in Wihdat which is a very old area. She lives with her family in a small, old ‎house. Her husband depends on her for support him and helps him in the household expenses. Wafaa is selling clothes, ‎blankets, and cosmetics in her home. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic ‎situation became bad recently.  
‎ 
Wafaa is applying a loan to help her to buy a new collection of clothes, cosmetics and winter blankets to sell. She hopes ‎that this new products will enable her to increase her sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand ‎her business.‎

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes, cosmetics and winter blankets to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a small business selling sportswear for men and women. She is married with one son. A Technical school graduate, Marina had previously worked in a factory. However, her salary was too small to provide for the needs of the family and she was forced to seek other opportunities to earn a living. Marina has been in the clothing business for over 4 years and has repaid 19 loans to “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal clientele. Marina would like to receive a loan for $800 to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of T-shirts, jackets, vests, and knitted wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable sportswear will sell really well and will help Marina’s business grow – especially in this cold winter season.

Марина Костянтинівна займається продажем чоловічого та жіночого спортивного одягу. Вона одружена, має сина. Після закінчення технікуму, Марина Костянтинівна працювала на заводі. Однак її зарплатні не вистачало для того, щоб забезпечити родину, тому вона була змушена шукати інших можливостей заробити. Марина Костянтинівна займається бізнесом з продажу одягу вже більше 4 років. Вона сплатила 19 позик в „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Наполеглива, важка праця допомогла їй досягти успіху в бізнесі та зберегти відданих клієнтів. Марина Костянтинівна хотіла б отримати позику розміром в 800 доларів для того, щоб мати додаткові кошти на розвиток бізнесу. Фінансова підтримка допоможе їй купити різноманітні футболки, куртки, жилети та трикотажні вироби. Високоякісний, практичний та зручний одяг обов’язково матиме попит, а це, в свою чергу, сприятиме зростанню бізнесу Марини Костянтинівни – особливо під час зимових холодів.

loans.use: To increase on stock for winter season

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en: I have been selling women’s beauty products (cosmetics, shampoo and conditioner) for 2 years. I also sell candy in my home. My clients are neighbors and women who work in offices. With the income I earn, I support my family and provide for my children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics (creams, eye shadows, shampoo, conditioner, etc.)

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Mr. Felix has a store from which he sells articles of necessity as well as school supplies. The store was originally owned by his father, and Felix worked helping in the store, and when his father retired, he gave it to Felix.

At the beginning he only sold vegetables and then began to sell groceries up until today when he now sells school supplies. With this loan, Angel wishes to purchase more merchandise, because his current stocks often do not meet his customers needs, and because he gives his customers excellent service and very good prices, his merchandise is very sought after.

He is sure that with the injection of stationary items on his shelves, he will be able to increase his number of customers as well as his profits. Felix is 28 years old, has two children who are not school aged yet, and his home is made of cement. He is confident that with the progress of his business he will be able to give a better life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Felix tiene una despensa donde vende articulos de primera necesidad y articulos escolares. Esta despenda en primera instancia era del papa y Felix trabajaba ayudando en el negocio luego el papa le regalo la tienda cuando el se hizo de compromiso.

Al principio solo vendia legumbres y luego empezo a vender abarrotes hasta que en la actualidad vende articulos escolares. Con este credito Angel quire comprar mas mercaderia pues con la que compra actualmente deja a muchos clientes sin atender y como les da una excelente atencio y un buen precio sus productos son muy solicitados.

El tiene la seguridad que con la inyeccionde articulos de papeleria que haga a su negocio positivamente podra tener mayor cantidad de clientes y asi mejores ganancias. Felix tiene 28 años, dos hijos que aun no estudia y su casa es de cemento, El confia que con el progreso de su negocio dara a su familia una vida en mejores condiciones de las que tiene ahora.

loans.use: To adquire more merchandise.

loans.name: Nyalwanda

texts.en: Nyalwanda is not a Rwandese, as her name may sound, but she is a 30-year-old mother of three, a resident of the Vituka area Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. She has been doing business for the past five years and she runs two businesses, charcoal and clothes.  She buys her clothes from from the wholesalers in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s biggest trading area,  and sells in the Lumo area as a retailer. Sometimes she supplies the clothes upcountry when she goes searching for charcoal.  She owns a shop and has got a charcoal store at her home, where she employs one person. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand both her businesses.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 50, is a disciplined, assiduous and persistent single mother. Her husband died fifteen years ago and left her with nine children to support. She says that she could hardly make ends meet. Shortly after her husband’s death, she opened a very small grocery store and had to close it two years later. In 1997, she started over the business which still exists in spite of everything.

Her grocery store offers various types of products such as rice, beans, flour, milk, rum and sugar. She says she makes a weekly profit of USD 120.00.

The entrepreneur has applied for a loan (her second one with our organization) to purchase more goods to supply her business. She will also remodel her locale in order to improve the hygienic conditions of the space where she runs the business.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will spend the funds in the buy or more products to supply her business and to remodel the local where she runs her grocery store.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en: Mr. B. Sophoin (age 29) lives in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sophoin and his sister live with their mother. Sophoin attended school only through the sixth grade. Sophoin and his sister are requesting this, their third loan from Maxima, to buy a third horse and a cart. The two siblings have been operating their dirt hauling business for two years. Currently they have two horses and carts but would like to buy two more. A horse costs about (US) $700 and a cart from $200-$300. Their house is backed by the Mekong River and it’s from there they get soil which is used as fill on construction sites. Each year during the monsoon, the river swells and deposits tons of silt along its banks. As the water recedes, entrepreneurs like Sophoin load the soil into carts and transport it into neighboring villages. Depending on how far they have to drive the cart, Sophoin charges between $3.50 and $4.00 per cartload.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart

loans.name: Kiganda A Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for five months. Betty, Jane, Aisha and Mwajuma all sell raw foods in the market and want to use the loan to purchase more food to sell. Yudaya sells fruits and vegetables.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
This is Mariano, a hard-working and enterprising father. His efforts, dedication, and broad knowledge of agriculture and cattle raising are leading him through the road of progress. Thanks to his work, he and his family have been able to overcome many difficult situations. Mariano and his wife, Silveria, have three children. The entire family cultivates their land. Thanks to the love and dedication with which they work the gifts that Mother Nature bestows upon them, they have yielded a large amount of fruits. With the sale of these fruits, Mariano can provide his children with health and an education. This responsible and diligent father is planning to increase the productivity of his fields because he believes that investing in his business will further increase his earnings and, consequently, his family’s quality of life. We can help this industrious family to keep blossoming.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Él es Mariano, padre muy laborioso y emprendedor, su empeño, dedicación y amplio conocimiento de agricultura y ganadería le están llevando por el camino del progreso con estas actividades, gracias a estas labores pudo sobrellevar muchas circunstancias difíciles por las que atravesó su familia.Mariano y su esposa Silveria son padres de tres hijos, todos juntos se dedican a labrar sus tierras, gracias al cariño y dedicación con el que trabajan las bondades que les otorga la madre naturaleza obtienen una amplia producción de frutos y con la venta brinda bienestar y educación a sus hijos.Este responsable y trabajador padre tiene pensado aumentar la productividad de sus tierras, considera que invirtiendo en sus productos mejorarán aún más sus ingresos económicos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su amada familia.Vosotros podemos apoyar a que esta laboriosa familia siga floreciendo

loans.use: Increase capital to raise production

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a taxi driver in the city of La Paz. The public transport business is his main source of income. He uses the money to take care of his parents, who are of retirement age. He lives in the Bajo Llojeta zone in La Paz.

Mario is asking for a loan because he wants to buy a small truck which will serve as a brick transport for construction jobs. He hopes to increase his income with this additional business.

This is Mario's third loan with Impro. He has a solid credit history and thus is able to take out a loan. He has been an Impro customer since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Mario es transportista de servicio público en la ciudad de La Paz, es su fuente de ingreso con la que ayuda con la manutención de sus padres que son de la tercera edad; vive en la Zona Bajo Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para comprar un pequeño camión de carga que le servirá para comercializar ladrillos de construcción y así incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of a truck to start a business transporting bricks

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and is single woman with one child, age two. Asha is a vegetable and fruits seller. Every day, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Talaave

texts.en:
Talaave T., 28, is married with one child. She has many years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. Her husband earns about $150 per week but he sometimes helps with her business. Talaave will use this loan to purchase timber, a sink set, and two-inch pipe for home repairs and chemicals and fertilizer to improve her taro plantation.

Talaave has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Talaave’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: For farm and home improvements

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Having participated in the Fund since 2004, Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 50 years old, has gone through four rounds of funding. Her family’s finances have improved markedly, resulting from the bold move to invest in raising livestock and expanding the livestock operations. In the first round of funding, not yet familiar with the weekly repayment structure, the family borrowed a very conservative amount of 2,000,000 VND. After seeing that the method of weekly repayment fit their needs well, in subsequent rounds of funding Mrs. Nguyen consistently borrowed higher amounts. Her experience in the keeping of livestock also improved with time, so the family did not encounter many difficulties in this business. Mrs. Nguyen and her husband has 3 children, one of which is grown and 2 still live at home. The grown child has found work that pays 2,000,000 VND a month. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to invest in pigs and fixing up the pens. Their total income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, Chị Nguyễn Thị Liễu 50 tuổi, trải qua 4 vòng vốn vay của Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi rõ rệt, từ suy nghĩ mạnh giạn vay vốn về đầu tư chăn nuôi và mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi, vòng vốn đầu tiên do chưa quen với phương thức trả tuần nên gia đình chị vay mức rất khiêm tốn là 2.000.000đ. Sau khi nhận thấy rằng việc trả vốn theo tuần là phù hợp với điều kiện của gia đình, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay vốn với mức cao, kinh nghiện chăn nuôi của chị cũng được tích lũy theo thời gian, từ việc có kịnh nghiệm chăn nuôi nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị không gặp khó khăn, vợ chồng anh chị có với nhau 3 con, 1 người con của anh chị đã trưởng thành, 2 người con đang sống cùng anh chị, cháu lớn cũng đã có việc làm thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị muốn vay mức vốn 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và sửa chuồng trại. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in pigs and renovate pens

loans.name: Djiguiseme 2 (Soutien Group

texts.fr:
The women in the Djiguiseme group are mostly married with an average age of 30 and four children each. They live in traditional families with their husbands, co-wives and children in the village of Konobougou in the Baroueli prefecture (in Mali’s Ségou region). They run a business mainly selling food spices and traditional beauty products (incense, etc.). Brought together through neighborhood ties and friendship, they have been working with Soro Yiriwaso for one year and are on their third group loan. All previous loans were repaid without problem. They stock up on raw materials in Konobougou on market days, buying spices from wholesalers from Ségou and incense primarily from wholesalers from Bamako. They sell at the same market in Konobougou, either at stalls or by walking around, and do this throughout the year. Their customers are women who sell to neighboring villages or women from Konobougou. The group plans to buy 15 kg of spices (pepper, abutilon, laurel, etc.) at CFA 2,000/kg to sell at CFA 2,500/kg, hence a weekly profit of CFA 7,500, and incense ingredients (2 kg of magnonkisèni, 5 kg of gueni, and 4 bottles of perfume) at a cost of CFA 25,000, which would yield a profit of CFA 30,000 per month. Each member of the group hopes to make a monthly profit of CFA 30,000 with which they will pay the loan interest and increase their capital.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Les femmes du groupe Djiguiseme sont à majorité mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 30 ans et 4 enfants .Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, coépouses et enfants dans le village de Konobougou préfecture de Baroueli (Région de Ségou République du Mali) Elles font essentiellement le commerce de : condiments alimentaires et des produits de beauté traditionnelles (encenses etc.) Unies par des liens de voisinage et d’amitié elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis une année et sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. Tous les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Elles se ravitaillent en matières premières les jours de foire sur place à Konobougou auprès des grossistes venant de Ségou pour les condiments alimentaires et pour l’encense c’est essentiellement avec les Bamakois. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans le marché (de la même localité Konobougou) sur des étales, de façon ambulante et cela durant toute l’année. La clientèle est constituée de femmes revendeuses des villages environnants et de certaines femmes de Konobougou Le groupe compte acheter 15kilogrammes d’épices (poivre, fièfiè, laurier etc.)à 2000FCFA le kg et vendus à 2500FCFA soit un bénéfice hebdomadaire de 7500fca et pour l’encense (2 kg de magnonkisèni, 5 kg de gueni, 4 bouteilles de parfums soit) une dépense de 25000FCFA vous permet de réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000FCFA par mois. Chaque membre du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000CFAavec lequel elles vont payer les intérêts du prêt et augmenter leurs capitaux.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Mr Ismael T. has a spare part business for. This business is the source of income for his family; he has 3 kids who are studying.

His business is lacking some spare parts and some more modern parts which he needs to give a better service to his clients, so they won't have to go elsewhere to repair their cars.

He has already had 2 loans with FVP which he has repaid punctually. Mr Ishmael T. would like a loan from Kiva to buy spare car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ismael T. tiene un negocio de reparación de automóviles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Al negocio le está haciendo falta refacciones y partes más modernos para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así sus clientes no tendrán que ir a otro lugar para que les reparen sus carros.

El ya ha tenido dos préstamos con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente. El Sr. Ismael T. está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de refacciones y partes de automóviles.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business/Compra de refacciones y partes para el negocio

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Lita tiene un taller de mecánica, lugar donde reparan todo tipo de vehículos menores. El taller está ubicado en su propio domicilio en Jr  Bolognesi Nº 1638. Los clientes son mayormente los motocarristas de la ciudad.
 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará aceite, repuestos y accesorios diversos para vehículos motorizados por docenas. Dado la buena acogida que tiene, quiere implementar un taller con la venta de algunos repuestos, sobre todo lo que más requieren los clientes, quienes a diario llegan al taller con motos para ser reparadas, además encuentran en este establecimiento lo necesario para seguir operando con una buena máquina.   

La señora Lita tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Es una persona perseverante, luchadora y anhela más adelante tener un negocio de venta de repuestos y lubricantes.
texts.en:
Lita, a member of the communal bank Las Orquídeas, lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto. Lita has a mechanic's shop where she offers repairs on all sorts of small vehicles. The shop is located in her home at 1638 Jr. Bolognesi. Her clients are primarily the motorcycle owners who work as motorcycle taxis in the city. With this loan for 1200 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will buy large quantities of oil, replacement parts and a variety of accessories for motorized vehicles. Given the good reception her business has received from the local people, she wants to open a shop selling replacement parts, especially those parts her clients most frequently need. Every day clients come to her shop with motorcycles in need of repair. What's more, they find in her shop everything they need to keep their vehicle running well. Lita is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is a person who perserveres and who fights to get ahead. She dreams of one day having a business selling vehicle lubricants and replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil, replacement parts and a variety of accessories for motorized vehicles.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: A. Kodjo est né le 05/09/1955 à Atakpamé et vit actuellement avec sa femme ménagère et leurs sept 07 enfants dans le quartier Gbadago à Lomé. C'est un commercant de matériaux de construction qui ne dispose plus de moyens financiers pour continuer ses activités. Dans le souci de relancer son commerce et satisfaire un grand nombre de clients, il sollicite ce crédit pour faire des commandes importantes et réaliser de bénéfices importants qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. Kodjo was born on September 5, 1955 in Atakpamé and currently lives with his wife and their seven children in the Gbadago neighborhood of Lomé. He is a building material tradesman but no longer has the financial means to continue his business. In the hope of relaunching his business and satisfying a large number of customers, he is requesting this loan so he can place some large orders and make a good profit. This will enable him to provide for his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell building materials

loans.name: Hilda Victoria

texts.es: Hilda Victoria C. García: Casada, guatemalteca, de 34 Años con residencia  Final de la Zona 1, Totonicapán. Esta señora labora en el comercio (venta de ropa) lo cual inicia su negocio comprando ropa de segunda (usadas) que luego los pone a la venta  y así obtener pequeñas ganancias, con la ayuda de su esposo decidieron agrandar el negocio comprando ropa nueva para obtener un poquito más de ganancias. Con el crédito que solicita en ASDIR pretende aumentar el capital de trabajo, ya que se acerca las fiesta de fin de año y como la apertura del nuevo ciclo escolar dos mil nueve es la  epoca de mejor venta.
texts.en:
Hilda Victoria C. G.: married, Guatemalan, 34 years old with residence at the end of Zone 1, Totonicapan. This hard working woman in commerce (clothing sales) which she established her business buying used clothes whih she lader put up for sale and so obtained small earnings, with the help of her husband they decided to grow the business buying new clothes to obtain a little bit more earnings. With the credit which she is asking for in ASDIR she intends to increase the working capital, now that New Years is getting closer and the beginning of the new school cycle 2009 is the largest season for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Anabel Gregoria

texts.es:
Anabel trabaja en una microempresa como auxiliar contable y es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto en la carrera de Contaduría Publica; con el ingreso de su sueldo ayuda a su familia para la alimentación de sus hermanos menores. Vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio  de la Ciudad de El Alto.


Actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres, pero por la distancia a su fuente de trabajo está buscando un cuarto en anticrético más cerca de su trabajo, lo cual le ayudará a generar un ahorro en tiempo y económicamente.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para pagar el anticrético de la habitación donde pretende vivir. (Anticrético es una forma legal de contrato por dos años, donde el dueño de casa permite vivir a una persona o familia en una habitación o un departamento completo por una cantidad de dinero que se paga por adelantado, la cual deberá ser devuelta al inquilino al cabo del contrato).
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Anabel works at a small company as an accounts assistant, and is studying Public Accountancy at the Universidad Publica El Alto (El Alto Public University). She uses her income to help her family to feed her younger siblings. She lives in the Villa Ingenio area of El Alto city.

She is currently living with her parents but is looking for an "anticrético" room (see below for a definition of "anticrético") nearer her work, as this is some distance from her parents' house, to help her save both time and money.

She will use the requested loan to pay the rent on the room where she hopes to live. ("Anticrético" is a legally binding contract of two years' duration, in which the landlord allows an individual or family to live in a room or whole apartment for a sum of money paid in advance, which will be returned to the tenant at the end of the contract.)

This is the first loan she has requested from Impro, which has been assessed favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: RENT PAYMENT

loans.name: Ivan Andres

texts.es:
El señor Ivan vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa en la calle San Cristóbal de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de botas para damas, con esta actividad mantiene su hogar, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de material (cuero, goma, etc.) ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y tiene muchos pedidos.

El historial crediticio de Ivan es bueno y por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ivan lives in his inlaw's home on San Cristóbal Street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz with his wife. He earns his living handcrafting boots for women. He supports his household with this work. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials (leather, rubber for soles, etc.) since the end of year holidays bring him lots of orders.

Ivan's credit history is good, and qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Asunción, comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  34 años de edad, tiene cuatro  hijos, es conviviente y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de artesanía tejido a apunto, con S/. 500.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar materiales como lana de distintos colores.
Ahora desea adquirir S/. 1000 nuevos soles para poder ampliar su negocio, invirtiendo en  la compra de lana por mayor, (lana de alpaca, lana sintética, y entre otros.), de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo" located in the Asuncion sector in the community of Sacuyo, district of Acora, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 34 years old and has four children. She lives with her partner and she completed grammar school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and was able to start her business of handcrafted knitting with a loan of $150. She is happy because this allowed her to purchase materials such as wool in different colors. Maria now hopes to receive a loan in the amount of $325 to expand her business. She will invest in the wholesale purchase of wool (alpaca wool and synthetic wool among others). She hopes this will allow her to contribute to her children's quality of education. She commits to punctually paying her loan in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of wool (alpaca wool and synthetic wool among others) so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 40 años, vive hace 25 años con su pareja y es madre de sus cinco hijos. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a sembrar varias hectáreas de cultivos frutales, y en menor cantidad de café, de enero a marzo es la época de bonanza, donde trata de acumular todas las ganancias para que le sirvan de capital para sus próximos cultivos. Margarita inicia sus labores a las 6.00am, cumpliendo sus funciones de ama de casa, después, eso de las 10.00am alista sus viandas y lleva el almuerzo de su esposo y ella. En esta época los cítricos tienen mucha demanda, por ser verano en la capital, y en tiempos de inviernos dejan de lado los cítricos y  comienza con la cosecha de plátanos y paltas. A Margarita le gusta su actividad agrícola por ser muy rentable en ciertas épocas, que les ha permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos y demás gastos de adicionales de la familia. Margarita es muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo de fiscal, se encargaba de ver los procedimientos y manejos  de los demás integrantes en el grupo. Este es su 5to préstamo con  MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas responsablemente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para la buena producción de sus frutas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40; she has been living with her life partner for 25 years and she has 5 children. With her partner, she tends several hectares of fruit trees and a smaller area under coffee; January to March is the harvest season, and they try to earn as much as possible as capital for their next crop.

Margarita gets up at 6.00 a.m. to attend to the house. Then, around 10.00, she prepares lunch for her partner and herself. This is the time of the citrus harvest and there is a lot of demand since it is summertime in the capital city; winter is the time of the banana and avocado harvests.

Margarita likes farming as it is very profitable at certain times of year, enabling them to pay for their children's education and cover other household expenses. Margarita is very active in her community bank; in the last period she acted as controller, overseeing the procedures and management by the other group members.

This is her fifth loan from MFP; she has always repaid her loans promptly. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide to enhance the fruit crop.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Conscience Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Conscience, avec  en moyenne 23 ans et 3 enfants, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou  préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
Ces femmes exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments, de bijoux et de tissus.
Ce groupe est partenaire de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Il est à son cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le présent prêt va servir à acheter, 100 kg d’oignons frais, 800 kg de gombo, 60 kg de pâte alimentaire, des bijoux (colliers pour le poignet et le cou) et des tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments avec les commerçantes venant de Sikasso, en bijoux et tissus  auprès  des commerçants au grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune  en moyenne 40.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à rembourser l’échéance du prêt et satisfaire des dépenses de la famille (éducation, nourriture, habillement, santé…etc.)
texts.en:
The women of the group Conscience average 23 years of age and 3 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, in Bougouni prefecture (third region of Mali). These women essentially do commerce in condiments, jewelry, and cloth.

The group members have been partners with Soro Yiriwaso for three years and are on their fifth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will serve to buy: 100 kg of fresh onions, 800 kg of okra, 60 kg of pasta, some jewelry (bracelets and necklaces), and some cloth. Supplies of condiments are gotten from merchants from Sikasso. The jewelry and cloth are gotten from merchants at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali).

The women each envision realizing 40,000 francs CFA on average per month that will serve to repay the loan and to meet family expenses (education, food, clothing, health...etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
In the town of Aloran, in Misamis Occidental, lives a certain Mrs. Teresa M.. She is 38 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman. Day abnd night, her husband works very hard to catch fish. Sometimes she helps her husband to dispose of the fish.

She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in April 2006. She was interested in the loans, savings, and insurance that the coop offered. Being a member, she's thankful that, with the help of her husband, she was able to meet the needs of her family.

Now a problem has come up. Their pump boat was damaged and it will need a major repair. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000. She's hopeful that someday, with the help of the Almighty God, she will be able to install electricity in their house and buy a fishing net.

loans.use: To repair and repaint a pumpboat that is used for fishing

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. is fifty-six years old. She is a married woman and has three children. Currently, two of them have graduated from school and the last is pursuing education in junior-high school. Ama’s husband is a welder by profession. He farms as well. Ama and the family live at a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business.

Ama trades in secondhand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of secondhand clothes including bedspreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc. from Accra, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. She has been in this business for three years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is a tailor who also sells tailoring materials. Sheis requesting a loan of 60,000 Nigerian naira (or about $425 US) to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Titilayo is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi B. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhashipati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery shop two years ago. Her main aim in opening her shop was to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize and various snacks in her shop. Due to the lack of money she cannot further expand her business. So Mrs. B. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to add other kinds of grocery goods to her shop.

Mrs. B. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a farmer and both her sons are working in small offices.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group 4

texts.en:
Ana is an outstanding example of the opportunity that microloans provide to people all over the world. Ana is 38 years old and is part of a group called La Fortaleza, or The Strength, that takes out loans as a group and supports each other in business ventures. 

Ana has been running a retail store for 8 years and she sells goods such as purses, perfumes, clothes and shoes. However, she her dream is to work in the capital, Santo Domingo, as a nurse. She is now on her third loan cycle, trying to increase her profits so that she can work her way through college to earn her nursing degree. She already has one child, aged 18, in college and she hopes that with a career in nursing she can afford to provide her other three children (aged 13, 11, and 9) with college education as well.

With this loan she will buy more sneakers and high heeled shoes as those products sell the most. 

Ana and the entire La Fortaleza group are excited to receive another loan and come one step closer to achieving their dreams.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her retail store

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante, Group 5

texts.en:
Progreso Hacia Adelante is a brand new Esperanza Bank of Hope from Consuelo, a town just outside of San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. The group lives in a 'batey' community, a rural sugarcane plantation with very harsh living and working conditions. Fighting to overcome such challenges, these new entrepreneurs are seeking to take out their first microloan to develop their exciting business ideas and improve their lives and their families' lives.

Miguelina B. is the coordinator of one group within Progreso Hacia Adelante. She is 21 years old and is a single mother with three kids, ages six, five, and five months. She lives in a small house with her mother and her children. Until now she has had unsteady work substituting at the local school that two of her children attend.

Despite her difficult circumstances, she is enthusiastic and optimistic about the future. With the money from her loan she will start a new business selling food supplies. The first items she plans to carry include rice, beans, cooking oil, and snack items like crackers and candy. More than anything, she wants to provide for her children so they can continue their education and fulfill their dreams. She also wishes to finish her own education, and talks excitedly about someday learning to use a computer, opening her own bank account, and using an ATM.

Please support Miguelina and the rest of her group as they work to support their families and better their lives!

loans.use: buying rice, cooking oils, beans, snack items for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the Omega borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 39-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of five children. Her children are aged 22, 18, 12, 4 and 1 years.

Seven years ago, Beatrice started her own café business selling food. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 400,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Beatrice’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 400,000 Tsh in order to buy rice, wheat and sugar. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Beatrice hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat and sugar

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is married and has two children. He has been through senior high school. John sells wood at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2001.  John uses his income to pay his dependents' school fees and utility bills. John will use the loan to purchase more wood, especially plywood for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood especially plywood for sale

loans.name: Pabling

texts.en:
Pabling T. is a rice grower from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. He is 56 years old and has only one child that is 13 years now. He is tilling a 2 hectare farm that he already owned for quite along time already to be able to provide his family an adequate food to live. 

 Now, he would like to request a loan of Php 14,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to finance his farm like buying the seeds and payment for the laborer who prepares the land before it was planted with rice seedlings.

He is now on his 5th loan in CEVI. The reason why she keeps joining the program is because of insurance coverage and small interest rate.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca R. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 36 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized fruit retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruit in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther R. is from the village of Mitan-ag Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Esther is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a "sari-sari", a specialized general store, where she sells daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Esther has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en: Nelita is 50 years old and has been a widow for 15 years.  She has six children, three of them are working at a private company and three are still studying. Their income from their farm is not enough to provide for the needs of the family. Nelita is now requesting a loan of PHP3,000 to invest in the improvement of her hog raising business.

loans.use: Capital to invest in her hog raising business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia M. manages a variety store and she raises hogs. She is married to Alberto. The couple is blessed with five children: Alvin, 26 years old, is an elementary school graduate; Lizelle, 24 years old, is a high school graduate; Irene, 22 years old, is a high school graduate; Alberto, 18 years old, is an elementary school graduate; and Abegail, 16 years old, is currently enrolled in high school. 

Virgilia would like to buy additional groceries but her income is not enough due to the expenses of her hog raising business. So, for this reason, she would like to borrow PHP5,000 for the improvement of her store and maintenance of her hog raising business. She will be very thankful if the KIVA lenders will grant this loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
Retchie R. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Retchie owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Retchie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Vazir

texts.en:
Vazir A. is applying for his second loan from Kiva. The first time he applied for a loan he sold the spare parts and his son, who helped his father, was shown in the photo. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the five calves to improve his cattle-breeding business.

"I improved my spare parts sales business and now I have a cattle-breeding business. Thank you very much, Kiva Lenders! "

loans.use: To buy five calves

loans.name: Felilia

texts.en:
Felilia A. is from the village of Ampilican, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 69 years old. Felilia is widowed and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Felilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felilia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felilia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Joel lives with his common-law wife and 3 year old child in Patria.  Though he is only in his early 20s, his communal bank has chosen him as their president.

Joel works as a woodcutter in the forests around Patria.  The area where he finds the best quality wood is located some distance from town so Joel often spends several days in the forest with his two business partners: his brother and his friend.  Joel is requesting a loan to pay for gas, a truck and day laborers to help bring wood he has chopped to market, where it will be sold largely to furniture-makers.

Joel appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Day laborers and transport to bring wood to market

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen T. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Carmen is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle repair shop services to local community members. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Разокова Махфират проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 26 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Махфират живет вместе с родителями. Она более 5 лет занимаентся торговлей на рынке. Махфират в основном продает обувь. Этот бизней ей приносит доход. Она одна содержит семью. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahfirat R. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, a widow and has 2 children. Mahfirat lives with her parents. She has been involved in retail sales at the market for over 5 years. Mahfirat mainly sells shoes. This business brings her profit. She is the sole provider for her family. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat flour and maize flour .

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda B. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old and is married. Rhoda owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of goods like thread, blades, knives and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rhoda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Rhoda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rommel Arturo

texts.es:
El Sr. Rommel Céspedes trabaja como asalariado en el Pali que está ubicado en el municipio del Viejo. 

El va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de algunos artículos que necesita comprar para el hogar ya que hay ciertos electrodomésticos que son de gran utilidad para la familia y el no los tiene.

Este es el segundo crédito que el Sr. Céspedes tiene con la Institución y espera seguir trabajando Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Rommel Céspedes is a salaried worker for Pali (a supermarket), which is located in the Viejo municipality. He will use the loan to buy some items he needs to purchase for his house. There are some domestic appliances that are very useful for the family, and he does not have them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic appliances for his house

loans.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en: Erdene-Oyun is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband Chinbaatar works in a brick factory, and Erdene-Oyun makes a living by selling ice-cream and beverages at a local market. She is careful to keep her products in a freezer before selling them to her customers. She has been planning to buy a new freezer for her business, which has been in operation since 2008. Her profits are high, especially during the warm months. Erdene-Oyun is a very hard working woman who is skilled at what she does and has big plans for the future. She says, “I would like to expand my production line next autumn to sell more food products.”  She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~  $220) to buy a second freezer.

loans.use: To buy a second freezer for her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking businesswoman, 33 years old, who sells bananas and she has been in this business for a long time. As she is not married, she always works hard so that, in the future, she will be able to help her future family with everything.

With the goal of being financially stable, Christine would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which hopefully will allow her to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase a large quantity of bananas to keep reinvesting in her future.

With the use of this loan, Christine hopes that her sales will increase as well as her profits. By accessing this loan, she has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas to sell

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Mrs. Elnora D. is from the barangay of P8 Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old. Elnora is a widow with no dependents. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating an internet café. She has been engaged in this kind business for 3 years already and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from this business activity. 

 In 2009, Elnora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elnora is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her third loan, which will be used to purchase additional computers for her existing internet café business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, and also for savings for future use, loan repayments, and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer units for her existing internet cafe business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice and corn for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 28 years now.

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. Since 2008, he has been working as a bus driver.

Moustafa is requesting, for the first time, a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy a car for an extra job and extra income as a taxi driver. This will be in addition to his present bus driver job which is based on transporting students and tourists.

What differs Moustafa’s work from others is his personality and special services that he provides to his clients, especially that he can bring in an extra bus in case of emergency if anything happens to his own.

Some obstacles face Moustafa during his work such as the market and the competition. He took this job from his brother who provided him with his first financial support to start this work.

Moustafa plans to be the owner of a travel agency running tourist buses.

loans.use: To buy a car to operate as a taxi

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 39 años, vive con sus padres y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y comercialización de productos, de esta manera distribuye su tiempo, es una mujer muy activa, todos los días por las tardes atiende a sus animales, y por las mañanas atiende a sus clientes, por ellos procura tener mercadería en su establecimiento, asimismo cuida de sus hijos. En ocasiones sus padres la apoyan en estas actividades, es así que se esfuerza en su trabajo. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo porque tiene ingresos, es por eso que tiene grandes deseos de seguir mejorando. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será destinado en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, así como la compra de una res.
texts.en:
Martina is 39 years old. She lives with her parents and three children in their own house. For the past twelve years she has worked in ranching, farming and selling products. This is how she spends her time. She is a very active woman. Every evening she takes care of her animals and in the morning she attends to her customers. Her customers buy merchandise from a store in her home. At the same time she cares for her children. At times her parents help her with her activities. In this manner she is able to do her jobs. She enjoys her work as she makes a profit. It is because of this that she wants to continue improving her business. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She is glad to have the financial support and she has always paid her payments responsibly. She is grateful for the community group, as all the members are responsible and supportive. She is also thankful for the people that manage the money for the loan that she is requesting. They are very useful with helping her grow her business. With this loan that she is requesting she will buy merchandise for her store such as buying beef.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos vive en el barrio el Carmen de la zona del plan  3000, el se dedica al transporte publico con su propio vehículo y tiene su banda de musical ,su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa americana la  que trae de Oruro y vende en la feria de la Cumavi y ferias como Alto San Pedro, San Isidro y otras ferias en las distintas Zonas de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales uno trabaja con el vehículo de taxista, el préstamo es para comprar instrumentos musicales el señor Marcos es una persona responsable, que demuestra muchas aspiraciones de superación para su familia en especial para sus hijos que están estudiando, uno en colegio y otro en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos lives in the Carmen zone of plan 3000. He works in public transportation with his own vehicle. He plays music with a band. His wife works selling American clothes that she brings from Oruro and sells at the market in Cumavi and in markets such as Alto San Pedro, San Isidro and others in the different zones in the city of Santa Cruz. They have 3 children of whom one works with the taxi service. The loan is to buy musical instruments. Mr. Marco is a responsible person who shows a lot of motivation to improve, for his family and especially for his children that are studying, one in high school and the other at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy musical instruments

loans.name: Pirm's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rirm M., age 61, is a villager who lives in Boeng Krum Leu village, Kandal province. She is the village bank president, having been select by its fourteen members. The members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.
Mrs. Rirm M. and her husband, Mr. Lenh Yee, are farmers who own 1.20-hectares of land that they use to cultivate rice, corn and peanuts for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Rirm M. will use the loan that she has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm. This couple has a child who is a Chinese translator.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Hilario; el tiene 58 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; El socio es comerciante, él realiza el negocio de llamadas a celulares en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere tener un locutorio de llamadas. El socio solicita el préstamo comprar celulares para su negocio.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilario belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' Community Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, in the province and department of Cusco. Hilario is 58, lives with his partner and has 7 children. He is a merchant. He has a cell phone call business in a street market. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. He wants to have a phone booth. He is requesting this loan to purchase cell phones for his business. He thanks those who will become part of this dream through this loan, and promises to repay his quotas on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cell phones for his business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A. is from the village of Mibantang, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Nenita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
H. A. is in his mid-twenties and single.  He owns a food shop where he sells rice, beans, wheat and sugar.  H. has been running his shop for the past four years, which is open daily between 7:30 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. The business earns H. a good monthly profit.

H. is requesting a Motisha loan as his second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  His main loan was used to increase the stock needed for his business, a loan which he has been paying on time.  H. aims to use the Motisha loan to buy more inventory for his shop as it runs out.  

H. will share this loan with his loan group Waukae, eleven members of which have also requested a Motisha loan.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, H. is seen wearing black at the back row.

loans.use: To increase food inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a retired primary school teacher who has been farming for 35 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. She has a mixed farm that produces milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. She has employed one farmhand from her community.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This dairy cow will enable her to provide her family with enough milk for their own consumption and she will be able to get manure for her farm. She says that it has been hard to get a quality breed of cow and this has been a challenge. She also faces the challenge of lack of artificial insemination services. She plans to buy more dairy cows in future that will increase her milk production. She also wants to expand her poultry farming.

Mary is 56 years old. She is married and has 7 children, all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school.

She comments that the loans they are given are small for much improvement, otherwise there is hope for future improvement.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adela's Group

texts.en:
Adela D., is from the village of San Francisco Aglipay Quirino. Adela is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adela, 40, is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adela owns & operates a general retail store. The income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adela is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Adela's 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristomie

texts.en:
Cristomie C. is from the village of Victoria. He is 43 years old. Cristomie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristomie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Cristomie has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristomie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristomie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cristomie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en:
Vanh C. A. is 28 years old and a married womA. with one lovely young child. She lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. Vanh C. A. currently owns a small fish selling business. She buys dried and smoked fish in bulk from her neighbors and then sells retail fish in her community. Her husband is a staff member in a private company. 

Vanh C. A. is a hard-working womA. who never wastes time while engaging in her business. As a result of the increasing demands of her customers, Vanh C. A. is applying for a loA. so she cA. purchase more dried and smoked fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Edwin Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin Humberto V. F. vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la empresa Beta hace 3 años. El Sr. Edwin cuenta con buena acumulación de bienes y requiere el crédito para realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es tener una vivienda digna para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Edwin está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Edwin Humberto V. F. lives with his wife and son in the district of Santiago. He has worked as a field laborer for the Beta company for three years. He has been getting ahead, and now requires a loan to make improvements to his home.

Edwin says that his dream is to have a quality house to give his family a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support that is offered by this loan.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 29-year-old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and three children. Diab has owned a laundry since 2007,  and he has 12 years of experience. 

Diab is a hard worker. His family is his main concern, and he struggles for their happiness and security. 

Diab is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy new machines for his business. Diab would like to expand his business and improve it to a more updated style. Most of his clients are single, students and employees. His prices are affordable.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aída, D. 52 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su hija D. los dos que son en total.
