DesD. hace 5 años Aída, se dedica L. venta D. periódicos, en su kiosco situado en las periferias del mercado y D. una avenida muy concurrida D. su distrito.  En este lugar desD. muy temprano por L. mañana contabiliza acuciosamente  todos los periódicos con sus respectivos  suplementos. D. esa manera venD.  tranquilamente sus ejemplares durante el día; pero al cerrar L. noche cuenta lo que no vendió y suma los vendidos para contabilizar sus ganancias, asimismo deposita los pagares por los ejemplares vendidos. D. esta manera está trabajadora madre D. familia forja L. educación superior D. su hija, que los fines D. semana L. apoya en sus ventas, ya que su mayor anhelo es que su hija sea una buena profesional. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será D. mucha utilidad para implementar su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. D. obtener el crédito que solicita Aída, lo invertirá en L. compra D. revistas del espectáculo, así como también folletos  D. manualidades en bisutería, tejidos y bordados.
texts.en:
52 year-old Aída lives with her husband and daughter in her own home. For 5 years she has been selling newspapers from her kiosk which is located on the outskirts of the market, in a very busy avenue in her district.

Very early in the mornings, Aída can be found here diligently checking all the newspapers and their respective supplements.  She sells her newspapers calmly throughout the day.  When she closes at night, she counts what she hasn't managed to sell and adds up what she has sold in order to work out her profits.  She also deposits the money for the papers she has sold.  This is how this hard-working mother covers her daughter's higher education expenses.  Her daughter helps her out with her sales at weekends.  Aída's biggest wish is for her daughter to become a good professional.

This is Aída's 11th loan with MFP and she knows that this loan will be very useful to her in keeping her business running.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Aída will invest the money she receives in buying entertainment magazines as well as craft booklets about jewelry making, knitting and embroidery.

loans.use: To buy magazines and booklets for her newspaper kiosk

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 62 year old married woman living in Chtoura with her husband and two kids. Samira has worked, since 2002, in making and selling Saj bread. Saj bread is a flat, round bread baked on an upside-down iron wok hot surface. It is traditional Lebanese bread. 

Samira works hard to help her husband earn their family's income. In addition to her work in Saj, she works as a tailor. When we asked her why she does this, her answer was that a good woman must stand next to her husband and help in every way she can,"we have children to raise and we have to provide them with the best we can."  

Samira is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy necessary raw materials for her business. Most of her clients are neighbors, friends and passers by. She hopes to open a big bakery in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn Y., 32, lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. Y. and her husband sell corn and earn a daily income of 3 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 49 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Sourn is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a trailer and to buy more corn to sell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Sourn would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a trailer and corn to sell

loans.name: Saadatu

texts.en:
Saadatu L. is a widow and has six children. For the past five years, Saadatu has been selling wakye (rice cooked with beans) at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.

With her family relying solely on her, Saadatu needs to increase her income by growing her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients: rice, beans, and oil. She will save the extra profits she earns to build a better wooden structure for her business. In the picture, she is standing by the wooden structure from which she sells her wakye.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients: rice, beans, oil

loans.name: Zoila Ysabel

texts.es: Zoila tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de edad escolar. Viven en la ciudad de Picsi, una pequeña comunidad urbana-marginal en vías de crecimiento. Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y zapatos. Dirige el negocio desde su hogar donde cuenta con una vitrina para colocar y guardar sus productos. Sus clientes le hacen pedidos y ella sale a recorrer y concretar sus ventas para luego realizar sus compras. Cuenta con una base de clientes establecida y fiel. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para ampliar su mercadería con la compra de zapatos de varón y dama para vender durante esta temporada escolar. Gracias a este préstamo, Zoila pretende elevar el volumen de sus ventas como el número de clientes a los cuales no solo se les ofrecerá zapatos sino la variedad de productos que ella vende. El mercado de Picsi es muy apropiado para este tipo de negocio porque Zoila beneficia no solo de los clientes en su propia comunidad sino de los de los pueblos aledaños. Es muy conocida en la zona y goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Zoila is 31 years old, married and has two school age children.  They live in the city of Picsi, a small, growing community on the urban border.  For the last 5 years she has been making a living buying and reselling clothing and shoes.  She runs her business from her home where she has a display cabinet to show and keep her products.  Her customers place orders and she goes around and affirms her sales to then be able to do her purchasing.  She has an established and faithful client base.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles to increase her merchandise with the purchase of shoes for women and men to be sold during the school season.  Thanks to this loan, Zoila can increase the number of sales and customers to whom she will offer not only shoes but also the variety of other products that she sells.  The market in Picsi is very good for this type of business because it not only benefits from customers from the community but also from the nearby towns.  She is well know in the area and enjoys good personal and work related references.

loans.use: to purchase school shoes for resale.

loans.name: Otgontuul

texts.en: Otgontuul, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2008. They used to live in the countryside and moved to Ulaanbaatar in 2008. They have an average standard of living. In 2005 Otgontuul began sewing dels, Mongolian traditional long coats. She makes the dels at home and sells them out of a rented stall at the local market. She has built a good reputation, and she gets regular custom orders. During special occasions or holidays, she generally gets more custom orders. Her business is growing, as the number of people who prefer to wear traditional clothing is increasing. She is a hardworking person who says, " I try to make much better traditional clothes and attract my customers while advertising the traditional clothing." She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more materials to make clothing.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make Mongolian traditional coats

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael A. S. is a 29-year-old hard working man who is married to Nariman and has four children. 
In order to support his family, he started his own business five years ago by opening a metal works (blacksmith) shop in a very active area in his city, a place everyone can easily reach and a place that has a good reputation. That’s what helped him gain a lot of customers.
To be able to serve as many customers as he can, he applied for this loan to buy more machines and tools to help him accelerate his productivity.

loans.use: To buy more machines and tools to help him accelerate his productivity

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara H. is the leader of this group. She is 22 and married to a builder. Her husband works in Russia. In order to meet the family needs, Gulnara grows cotton. She has a baby so her parents-in-law help her in farming. The family started cultivating cotton three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. When they sell some part of the harvest, the family earns 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for farming. In the future, she plans to start repairing her house and purchasing some livestock for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a single mother. She is raising a teenage daughter. 

Tatyana runs a children's clothing sales business in the central market of her home town of Novomoskovsk. Her vending facility is located in a busy part of the market that is always active with customers. Tatyana is very energetic. She likes to find an individual approach to each of her clients. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Her gross income amounts to 32,000 UAH a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase summer tunics and pinafore dresses for children, as well as uniforms for the next school year. She believes a diversified assortment of clothing for different age groups of children will help her improve her sales and increase her income as a result. 

One of Tatyana’s plans is to help her daughter through college. She will enter college this summer and Tatyana is willing to help her financially.

loans.use: to purchase summer tunics and pinafore dresses.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la reparación de carros. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo más moderno como, una compresora para pintar carros. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta inversión en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su taller de mecánica automotriz, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Don Juan Pablo ya ha tenido créditos con Kiva y FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo has been repairing cars for more than ten years.  He is asking for a loan to buy more modern equipment, like a compressor to paint cars, because at the moment he does not have the necessary funds available to make this investment in his business.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the profits he earns at his car repair shop since this is his family’s source of income.

Juan Pablo has had previous loans with Kiva and FVP and has repaid them back punctually.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his repair shop.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en:
Manuelita is 58 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Manuelita own a motorcycle cab and earns approximately $116 each month doing this type of business. She lets her motorcycle be rented for her daily income. The spare parts of the motorcycle are damaged and she needs to repair it. At this time Manuelita is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She dreams that someday she will have additional motor cabs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Zakya

texts.en:
Zakya, a 43-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon, is married and has four children. The operator of a shoe store since 2007, she has developed a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, and professional contacts. Zakya is extremely proud of her work and believes that it is her experience that has helped her succeed.

She learned about Al Majmoua through the local loan officer and has proven to be a good standing borrower and a smart businesswoman. Now requesting her second loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Zakya is planning to purchase a collection of new shoes and in the future hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales y venta de animales, ella cría pollos y los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Marina, 40, is married and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising chickens which she sells at market in the district of Urubamba.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.   With this small business she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her business by using the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back in time.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Mr. Nhoek is a 45-year-old man who has been residing in Kompong Chhnang Province. The main income source of Mr. Nhoek comes from agriculture sector as a farmer since he was single. He is a widower man and currently lives with his five single children. Mr. Nhoek also relies on his child who work overseas. 

Although the rainy season is coming, Mr. Nhoek can't do anything on his farmland because one of his old cows cannot support him in the farm field. Therefore, Mr. Nhoek has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Magdai

texts.es:
La señora Magdai  vive en una ribera muy bonita ya que en el centro de la ribera esta la virgen de Guadalupe quien en es la patrona del pueblo y el doce de diciembre se hace la celebracion mas grande. Ella es viuda y tiene a su responsabilidad dos hijos.

    Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, galletas, entre otros, para que así sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan comprar, en esta actividad lleva  siete años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante a su familia. 
    
      Lo que la inspiro a realizar esta actividad fue su propia familia quienes decidieron apoyarla con ingreso y así mejoras su estado económico, y salir adelante  por sí misma.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir incrementado  su negocio para ahorra y seguir apoyando a su hijos que están creciendo y desea darle una educación.
texts.en:
Magdai lives in a very pretty river basin because Our Lady of Guadalupe is in the middle of it and she’s the patron saint and on the December 12th she is celebrated in a large way.  She is a widow and is responsible for two children.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store; such things as: sugar, beans, oil, cookies, among others, so that her customers will find what they are looking to buy.  She’s been in this activity for seven years and she comments that she does well since she’s been able to raise her family through it.

What inspired her was her own family who wanted to help her with income thus improving her economic situation and to get ahead on her own.

What she most wants from this activity is to continue growing in her business to save up and continue supporting her children who are growing and that she wants to provide a good education to.

loans.use: to pay for stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Solichon

texts.ru:
Соличон трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 12 лет Соличон занимается купля продажей скота и мясо. Он покупает скота и продает, откармливая их в течение 20-30 дней. Он продаёт мясо на центральном рынке города и имеет свою собственную торговую точку. Соличон старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обучит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота. Соличон заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и поощрение.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Solichon is a hard-working and conscientious person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  Solichon has been involved in buying and selling livestock and meat for over twelve years.  He buys livestock and sells it, after fattening it up for 20-30 days.  He sells meat at the central city market and has his own retail outlet.  Solichon tries hard to provide good living conditions for this family and wants his children to attend good schools and universities.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock.  Solichon thanks everyone in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline and her husband are blessed with seven children. She is 53 years of age and her husband is a farmer. 

Evangeline is engaged in the hog fattening business while her husband runs a rice farming business. Evangeline and her husband try hard to fulfill their children’s need. They do everything just to feed their children. Evangeline has one child in school, som of the other children already have their own families and the rest are working. Her income in her business is not enough to sustain her family's needs and her children who are working help her in times of financial shortage.

Evangeline is getting old. She wants to grow her business and earn enough profits for her family to save for future emergencies. Evangeline doesn’t want to have to rely on her children for income because someday they will all be having their own families. She is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy feed for her piglets to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets to grow.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 32 years old and a father of one.  To earn a living, he uses his bicycle for transport business.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more business oriented.  Now, he sees himself owning more than five motorbikes for transport business in the future.  

Benjamin needs a loan of 50, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport business

loans.name: Assata

texts.fr:
Madame ASSATA a 49 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et ses enfants  au quartier administratif  de Ségou.
 Elle commença   le commerce  auprès de sa tante  qui vendait des habits et  chaussures. Après  plusieurs années d’apprentissage  à ses côtés, elle finit par évoluer seule  pour   mener la même activité à savoir le commerce  de chaussures et d’habits. Elle l’exerce depuis 10 ans  et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est  à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une balle  de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne  au Burkina Faso. 
Madame ASSATA   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 175 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de participer à des événements sociaux.
texts.en:
Madame Assata is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She lives in a nuclear family with her children in the administrative region of Ségou. 

She began working alongside her aunt who sold clothing and shoes.  After several years of apprenticeship by her side, she left to pursue the same work of selling shoes and clothing on her own.  She has been doing this for 10 years and has benefitted from a good deal of experience and enjoys a large clientele. 

In the interest of meeting the demands of her customers, she has become involved with Soro Yiriwaso.  She is on her first individual loan.
She plans to use this loan to buy one bail of shoes.  She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso.

Madame Assata sells for cash and on credit to a clientele of women and men.

She foresees earning a monthly profit of 175,000 FCFA.  This will allow her to repay her loan and to participate in social events.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı is married with a seven-year-old son and a three-year old daughter. When she was in high school, she took an embroidery course and bought an embroidery machine. She first made embroidered things for her own trousseau and then started making items for other family members. Others around her liked her work and started giving her orders. From that, she says she expanded her customer base. After working for two years, she married, started a family and had to stop working.  Now that her children are getting older, her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. In order to find a way contribute to her family’s economy, she applied to Kiva partner Maya for a loan to start working again. 
With this loan, she wants to buy more supplies so she is able offer her customers a wider variety of products. In the future, she would like to provide other women with the opportunity to do this kind of work. She wants to provide her children with a good life and education so they will have a good future. Aslı is confident that she will be successful because once she decides to something, she does it.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Aslı evli ve 7 yaşında bir oğlu ve 3 yaşında bir kızı var.  Aslı lisedeyken,nakış kursuna gitti ve kendine nakış makinası aldı.  İlk önce nakış işlerini kendi çeyizi için yaptı ve daha sonra nakış işlerini kendi aile bireyleri için yapmaya başladı.  Bundan sonra Aslı'nın müşteri potansiyeli genişledi.  İki yıl çalıştıktan sonra,evlendi ve çocuk olduğu için çalışmaya ara verdi.  Şimdi çocuklar büyüdü,masraflar çoğaldı ve eşinin maaşı yetmemeye başladı.  Aile ekonomisine katkıda bulunmak için, tekrar iş yapmak için Maya kredisine başvurdu.  Bu aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini genişletmek istiyor.  İleride aynı işi yapacak kadınlara iş sağlamak istiyor.  İleride çocukları için iyi bir yaşam ve eğitim sağlamak istiyor.  Aslı Hanım  başarılı olacağına inanıyor çünkü kendine güvenen bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Jireh Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Jireh”, lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, arriendo de juegos inflables para niños, maestros de construcción, centro de depilación, artesanía, arriendo de artículos de banquetería, y servicio de arreglos florales, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. 
Domenica integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un sweater color morado, pantalón de buzo y usa anteojos. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a vender ropa usada para niños.
Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa los días de semana en cualquier horario y los fines de semana se instala en una feria libre con sus prendas. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras ubicadas en la ciudad de Santiago. La ropa la compra por fardo y ahí contiene alrededor de 250 prendas. 
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa y sacos de juguetes usados, ya que se acerca la temporada de navidad y es una buena temporada para vender este tipo de productos. 
Sus metas son expandir su negocio y contar con una mayor variedad de productos, además le gustaría tener un local establecido en alguna feria libre, que le brinde flexibilidad con sus horarios y cierta independencia. 
Domenica vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad. Ella recibe el apoyo de su marido cuando trabaja, ya que él se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos. Su marido también es comerciante y uno de sus sueños a nivel familiar son independizarse, para obtener mejores ganancias con sus respectivos negocios. 
Domenica está muy contenta del crédito y los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, ya que el préstamo le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender sobre contabilidad, administración y estrategias de cómo manejar su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal comenta que han tenido algunas diferencias que enfrentar, sin embargo han solucionado todo sin ningún problema, lo que ha afiatado el grupo. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Jireh", and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs, who work in different trades, among which are found: clothing sales, lease of inflatable toys for children, construction teachers, center of depilation, artesans, lease of banquet articles, and service of floral arrangements, among others.  All of them belong to the city of Talca.  

Domenica is the member of the communal Bank who in the photo is found in the first row, occupying the fourth place from right to left, shown in a purple sweater, gray pants and glasses.  She works in commerce, specifically selling used children's clothing.  Her sales are made from home during the week at any time of day, and on the weekends, she sets up a stall in an open market with her wares. She purchases her merchandise from distributors located in the city of Santiago.  She purchases the clothes by the bale which contain around 250 articles of clothing.  With the loan, she will buy bales of clothes and bags of used toys, since the Christmas season is approaching and it is a good season to sell these types of products.  Her goals are to expand her business and to include a greater variety of products.  Moreover, she would like to have a place established in some open market, that would offer her flexibility with her schedule and a certain amount of independence.  

Domenica lives with her husband and their two children, ages 6 and 4.  She receives the support of her husband when he works, since he is primarily responsible for caring for the children.  Her husband is also a merchant and one of their dreams as a family is to become independent, to obtain better profits with their respective business.  Domenica is very happy for the loan and the services offered by Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund), since the loan has allowed her to invest in her business and the trainings have served to help her learn about accounting, administration and strategies for how to manage her business.  

With respect to the group of the communal bank, she comments that they have had some differences to face; nevertheless, they have solved all without any problem, and that is what has brought the group together.  

Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the central part of the country.  It constitutes the cultural, economic, and administrative center of the region, being the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley.  In Chile, a curious reference about Talca exists; the phrase "Talca, Paris, and London".  Among the myths on the matter, some they say that this is a derivation of the originally saying by an Englishman "Talca seems like London", due to the abundant fog that covers often the city in the winter season, resembling the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and sacks of used toys, since the Christmas season is approaching and it is a good time of year to sell these types of products.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en:
Mayada is a 37-year-old Lebanese single woman living with one parent and two siblings. She has been working as a beauty specialist for the past four years. In parallel, she also works as a hairdresser. She works from her home and she also serves clients at their domiciles. She has a good business reputation and has a good number of customers asking for her services.

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a car for her business. She states that this car will help with her transportation, especially since her customers are located in different areas and villages. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her business.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en: Ghanem is 32-year-old young man. He is married, but does not yet have any children. He is a worker with a decent salary. Ghanem wants to make some repairs to his house, such as installing tiles and changing windows and doors, but he doesn't have the money for it. He would like to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ghanem gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the necessary repairs to his house. This will improve his house and enable him to live with his family in better living conditions. Ghanem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Rassel

texts.en:
Rassel is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rassel is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rassel has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Rassel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fabric and sewing materials.

Rassel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rassel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Orencia

texts.es: Orencia, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y amable, además de ser alegre y jovial, es viuda. Vive en la actualidad en compañía de sus tres mayores hijos que la acompañan y sus 4 nietos, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Orencia es el sembrío de maíz, para eso cuenta con un terreno propio de 40 hectáreas de extensión, pero no llega a utilizar todo su terreno por la falta de capital. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido los conocimientos de cultivo. Es así que su día empieza desde muy temprano cuando salen al campo a limpiar y cuidar el terreno con la ayuda de sus hijos y 4 peones a los que paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el estar en contacto con la naturaleza ya que le gusta el campo, así como el ingreso económico que le genera cada producción que logra sacar a la venta. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta mucho cuando hace demasiado calor pues le provoca dolores de cabeza y rápido cansancio físico, por eso ahora tiene planes de variar de negocio y en el espacio que le queda disponible siembra pasto y cria ganado vacuno. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además manifiesta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a todos sus miembros y considera que son buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la contratación de peones para la cosecha de maíz y del que tiene planeado venderlo.
texts.en:
Orencia, aged 57, is a hard-working, friendly woman who is also happy and jovial.  She is a widow, and currently lives with her three grown children and her four grandchildren.  They live comfortably in their own home.  

The activity that Orencia does is growing corn.  She has 40 acres of her own land to use for this, but she hasn't been able to use her whole land because of lack of capital.  She has been working in this activity for 10 years, during which time she has learned all about farming.  Her day starts very early, when she goes out to the fields to tidy up and look after the land, with the help of her children and four workers whom she pays for each week they work.  

What she likes about her work is being in contact with nature as she likes the land.  She also likes the financial income that is generated by every crop that she is able to bring to sale.  On the flip-side, she comments that she doesn't much like when the weather's too hot, as she gets headaches and gets fatigued easily.  For this reason, she now has plans to mix up her business, and in her remaining space grow pasture and raise dairy cattle.  

This will be her third loan with the MPF institution, which is why she his hoping for your collaboration so that she can turn her plans into reality.  She also states that she feels good about her communal bank, as she knows all the members and thinks they are good people.  

With the requested amount of 2,000 new soles, she will invest in hiring workers for her corn harvest, which she has plans to sell.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.  Rehema dreams of purchasing an over-lock sewing machine in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Rehema wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is married and has one child. She is a hard-working woman who has been in the cultivation of crops for more than ten years and has invested her strength and knowledge. She grows rice and sells it in the market after crop season and earned P8,000 last crop. This is very low income so she patiently works in the field to maintain their business.


Together with her husband, she is working for the family's welfare. They want to earn abundant crops to secure their future. For this reason, she is asking a loan of P10,000 to buy corn seed, fertilizers and pesticides to use in developing their farming business. Hopefully it will produce good income in the next crop season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in developing their farming business.

loans.name: Renzo Edemir

texts.es: Renzo, de nuevo solicita otro préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y porque quiere seguir trabando en la crianza de cerdos y con este nuevo financiamiento quiere comprar otros cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos a buen precio. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a mejorar la vivienda y las condiciones de vida mejoraron mucho puesto que su familia vive mejor que antes.
texts.en: Renzo is requesting another loan due to our institutions good service and because he wants to continue his job of raising pigs. With the new financing he wants to buy more pigs to fatten and then sell them on for a good price. The previous loans helped him greatly in improving his home and his living conditions improved since his family live a better life than they did before.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old and single. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks in the local community. Michelle has been in her business for 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 12,575 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: 3.14.156.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Nga is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. Nga is the group leader of the 3.14.156.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main harship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Nga hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath is from the Ponhea krek district of Kampong Cham province. He is 42 years old and he is married and has three children who are dependents. 

His businesses are cassava and rice growing as the main sources of his family’s income. He has been working in this agribusiness for 22 years. This is the first loan for him from VisionFund.Now he is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay plowing fees for his cassava plantation. He hopes that he can expand his business and gain more yields.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dembagnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DEMBAGNOUMA 1sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’TENKONI un des villages de DOGO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4éme prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  FATOUMATA, 4ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  N’TENKONI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  10.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative mother and asked her son to take her place in the photo. She is 42 years old lives in Al Hashmeye ‎with her husband and her three children.‎
Amani and her husband are working hard to ensure good educate and comfortable life for their children, she was always ‎has a dream which is to complete her education but she could not because of the financial situation for her family. ‎
Her son who appears in the photo called Esam and he is studying in university majoring mechanic engineering in his ‎second year, Amani wants to see her son graduate from the university to be able to find good work to help his family in the ‎household expenses. ‎
Lately Amani and her husband is facing financial crises that prevent them from paying for Esam his university fees, ‎therefore she applied for an educational loan to help Esam paying for his university fees and achieve his and her dreams.‎

loans.use: To pay the university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farming

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando cultivates rice, watermelons, corn and soy beans on his land. He has been living in this area for about forty years. He lives with his wife and three of his sons who help him with the farming. He also lives with 4 grandchildren in his small home. He hopes to invest the loan in the preparation of his land for production and to purchase fertilizer. He is trying to save money in order to increase the size of his home for his family.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive land that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The land in Baba is very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm, they first must prepare the land by removing weed, plowing and leveling it. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the land for rice production. After appropriately preparing the land, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial support, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers), there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Prepare fields for rice cultivation

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Z. Tofiq is 53  and married with 7 children. His small store of women’s clothes brings him good profit but for a big family, the store's earnings are only enough to sustain a hand-to-mouth existence. To improve his family's situation and help provide better conditions for them, Tofiq has borrowed 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To enlarge his clothes store and buy more stock for it.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Mrs. Perez has been in sales for 15 years; she got started in business selling used clothing and cosmetics door to door and by visiting places of employment, where she offered convenient payment plans. She is currently married and has two school-age children.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the acquisition of second hand electronics and small appliances which she plans to repair, refurbish and resell. She hopes this increased inventory will help her expand her sales and result in improved living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, dio sus primeros pasos en los negocios vendiendo ropa usada y productos cosméticos en diferentes instituciones a las que visitaba y ofrecía sus productos al crédito, en la actualidad está casada y es madre de 2 niños en edad escolar.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos usados para repararlos o darles mantenimiento y posteriormente venderlos, espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus inventario y por ende se incrementen sus ventas para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase, repair and refurbish used small appliances and electronics for resale

loans.name: Taufusi

texts.en: Mrs T. is married with four children. As as member of her village women’s committee, she chose to open a bingo business so that all members of the committee can play. She believes that this is one of the most profitable businesses if the prices and supplies are good. Her first loan of US $300 was used to buy the supplies and materials. She hopes that her next loan will be used to improve her existing business, as well as start up a barbecue store as her back up business, which will operate during the bingo. She says that she’s comfortable in raising her family and she helps with her kids' school fees by providing financial help.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bingo business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 29 year-old mother of two who sells fruit in a beautiful park in downtown Ayacucho, Peru. As an “ambulante,” Sabina’s stand is mobile and she spends the majority of the day traveling throughout the park, stopping to sell her products wherever she can find the greatest concentration of hungry people. The fruit is shipped fresh weekly from Lima in huge loads. This she has been doing for the past year. Before, she prepared and sold “chicha,” a popular Peruvian beverage made from maize and sugar. Sabina explains that this was a difficult way to turn over a significant profit, so like any smart businesswoman would do, she analyzed the market and decided to change gears and sell fruit. She is very happy with her decision, as she is currently making much more money and better able to support her young family. Additionally, Sabina has also found work as a nanny for two children in the area. This she alternates monthly with fruit sales.

In the past year with her village bank, Sabina has learned how to save her money formally in the bank where it is safe and accumulates interest. Through the economic help she receives, Sabina is always looking for ways to improve her business and working toward her dream of one day opening a small grocery store. Sabina is currently requesting a loan of $350, which will help her to buy larger supplies of fruit to sell to larger amounts of clients.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Efui Essénam

texts.fr:
Born in 1979, Mr. Essénam Efui T. is unmarried and lives in Kégué. An informational technology specialist, he was unable to obtain his diploma due to a lack of means, and began working in the second-hand clothing business. Not having a place to sell his wares, Mr. Efui is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to obtain a space in the market which he can arrange, and to buy stacks of second hand clothing. This will allow him to increase his capacity and improve his living conditions, eventually leading to his certificate in informational technology.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1979, Monsieur T. Efui Essénam est célibataire et réside à Kégué. Maintenancier en informatique, et par faute de moyens, il n’a pas pu avoir son diplôme et s’est lancé dans le commerce de friperies. N’ayant pas de place pour vendre ses articles, Monsieur Efui sollicite un prêt de $1000 afin d’acquérir une place dans le marché qu’il pourra bien aménager et acheter des balles de friperie. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité et améliorer ses conditions de vie et plus tard avoir son attestation en maintenance informatique.

loans.use: To rent a retail space and to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Maria Carlos

texts.pt:
Maria M. is not officially married, but lives with a man with whom she has nine children. Maria’s oldest children have already started their own families, but the youngest still live with the couple. Maria and her family live in the town of Chibuto, which is the government seat of Chibuto district, in Bairro 3. Maria’s business is experiencing the same growth as when it started. She has already begun the process of bringing electric power into her residence. This is one of the positive changes occurring in her life. The loan that she received was of much help to her. She was able to increase the number of goats that she has bought.

Sales went very well once the Christmas and New Years holidays began. She sold almost all of the goats that she bought. Maria M. travels two times a month to another district where she purchases goats from the breeders. She buys each goat for 250 MT and sells each for 600 or 700, depending on size. Thus, profit is approximately 350 MT per goat, not including transportation costs.

Maria’s husband unfortunately is unemployed. She does odd jobs and works on the family farm to support her family. Maria is very satisfied with the loan that she received previously. She had requested a 3-month loan, and now would like to request another. She was able to repay the first loan on time, and without problems.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Maria M. nao esta casada oficialmente, mas vive com um homem com quem tem 9 filhos. Os filhos mnais velhos de Maria ja constituiram suas prorpias familias. Mas os mais novos ainda vivem com o casal. Maria e sua famiia vivem na vila de Chibuto, Sede do distrito com o mesmo nome no Bairro 3.O negocio de Maria esta a crescer comparativamente com os primeiros tempos. Ela ja iniciou o processo de montagem de uma instalacao electrica na sua residencia. Portanto esta e uma das mudancas positivas que estao acontecendo em sua vida.O emprestimo que ela recebeu ajudou-a muito. Ela conseguiu aumentar a quantidade de cabritos que tem comprado. A venda correu-lhe muito bem uma vez que concidiu com o periodo das festa do natal e do fim do ano. Portanto ela vendeu quase todos os cabritos que comprara. Maria M. viaja 2 vezes por mes para um outro distrito onde compra os cabritos aos criadores para a revenda. cada cabrito ela tem comprado por 250,00 Mt e ela revend-/o por 600, 700 consoante o tamanho. Portanto o lucro e de aproximadamente 350 Mt por cabrito deduzindo-se o valor do transporte. O marido de Maria infelizmente nao esta empregado. Ela faz pequenos expedientes e trabalha na machamba familiar para o sustento de sua familia. Mqaria esta muito satisfeita com o emprestimo anterior recebido. Ela tinha pedido por 3 meses e agora ela quer pedir um novo . O primeiro ela consguiu fechar sem problemas nenhuns. Ela pagou pontualmente.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suci

texts.id:
In the beginning Ni Ketut Suci opened her goods stall on a small scale because she had limited means, but over time this business has expanded to its current state. The items sold include daily necessities as well as a variety of food and light refreshments and drinks that are sought after by kids. Her primary customers are residents of the surrounding area and schoolchildren.

Ni Ketut Suci has two children who are at this time in junior high. Because of them, Ni Ketut Suci is motivated to be even more enterprising in her business because she wishes for her two children can get educated to the highest level and then change the family fortune. In a day’s work at her stall Ni Ketut Suci earns as much as Rp. 50,000 up to Rp. 80,000 (USD equivalent $5 = $8) which she later uses for daily living expenses and, if there is any remainder, it gets saved up for future school fees. At this time she really needs additional funds because she wants to expand her business and improve and repair the condition of her stall so it is bigger, tidier and cleaner. With these changes Ni Ketut Suci hopes that her customers will feel more comfortable and her earnings will increase substantially.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Awalnya Ni Ketut Suci membuka usaha warung ini hanya kecil-kecilan karena tidak memiliki modal yang banyak, tetapi lama-lama usaha ini berkembang menjadi lebih besar lagi hinga menjadi seperti sekarang ini. Barang –barang yang dijualnya meliputi kebutuhan pokok setiap hari dan juga berbagai macam makanan dan juga minuman ringan yang sangat digemari oleh anak –anak.Yang menjadi pelanggan utamanya adalah warga yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya dan juga anak-anak sekolah. Ni Ketut Suci memiliki dua orang anak yang sat ini sedang duduk dibangku SMP. Tentu hal inilah yang memotivasi Ni Ketut Suci untuk lebih giat lagi dalam menjalankan usaha ini karena Ni Ketut Suci berharap nantinya kedua anaknya ini bisa sekolah sampai tingkat tinggi dan bisa mengubah ekonomi keluarga. Dalam sehari usaha warung ini Suci bisa mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 50.000.- sampai Rp. 80.000.- setiap hari dan dari keuntungan inilah nantinya di pakai oleh Ni Ketut Suci untuk memenuhi biaya hidupnya setiap hari dan jika ada sisanya akan ditabung untuk biaya sekolah anaknya kelak. Saat ini Ni Ketut Suci sangat membutuhkan tambahan modal karena Ni Ketut Suci ingin memperbesar usahanya dengan memperbaiki kondisi warungnya agar lebih besar, rapi dan bersih. Dengan perubahan itu Ni Ketut Suci berharap agar pelanggannya akan merasa nyaman dan keuntungan yang didapat pun bertambah banyak.

loans.use: Improvements to the store so it will be bigger, tidier and cleaner

loans.name: Siloe 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 62-year-old mother of 5 children, whom she cannot ask for financial help due to their lack of funds. For this reason, she decided to sell cut-up chicken, which is brought from the Venustiano Carranza municipality, in her home. Her profits help her to both support herself and continue buying chicken. With this loan, she would like to purchase a kitchen scale and a larger number of chickens, thus saving on transportation costs. The other members of the group are: Maria del Socorro G. G., who sells shoes by catalogue; and Gloria Pérez, who sells groceries from home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ELENA TIENE 62 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 5 HIJOS A LOS QUE NO LES PUEDE PEDIR AYUDA ECONOMICA, DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE INGRESOS EN LAS FAMILIAS DE ELLOS, POR LO CUAL DESDE HACE UN AÑO DECIDIO COLOCAR EN SU CASA LA VENTA DE POLLO TROZADO, EL CUAL ES TRAIDO DESDE EL MUNICIPIO DE VENUSTIANO CARRANZA, LAS GANANCIA LE AYUDA A MANTENERSE Y A SEGUIR COMPRANDO MAS POLLOS PARA SU VENTA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR UN MAYOR NUMERO DE POLLOS Y EVITAR EL GASTO DE TRASLADO, ASI COMO LA COMPRA DE UNA PESA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA DEL SOCORRO G. G., VENDE ZAPATOS POR PEDIDO Y GLORIA PÉREZ A. VENDE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: Purchase of more chicken and a kitchen scale

loans.name: Lawama

texts.en:
Lawama is 32 years old and married with three children, ages 13, 9 and 2. Lawama owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Djamshed M. is a 30 year old man, he is married and has 3 children. His wife sells fruits at the market. Djamshed works as a driver for the public transport firm – Gazel. After the cold winter he would like to make major repairs to his car. He needs 3000 somoni in order to do this. This is why he decided to turn to MicroInvest. Djamshed thinks that the loan makes good sense for him. In addition to his job Djamshed raises and fattens livestock which provides him with a good additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Муминов Джамшед мужчина в возросте 30 лет женат имеет 3 детей,жена занимается реализацией фруктов на рынке.Сам Джамшед работает водителем общественного транспорта Газель. После холодной зимы он хочет провести капитальный ремонт своей машины.Для этого ему необходимо 3000 сомони .Поэтому он решил обратится в Микроинвест. Джамшет считает что кредит отремонтировать ему выгодней.Паралельно со своей работой он занимается откормом и уходом за скотом, с чего имеет дополнительный хороший доход.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi M., 47 years old, has 2 children who are still going to school. Mrs. M. joined the TYM Fund since the beginning of 2006. At first, she used the borrowed money to invest in general store: buying more merchandises to meet local needs. To increase the income for her family, as well as being able to buy school supplies for her children, she wants to borrow more money to expand her business. Therefore, she would like to borrow 550 USD this time. Her family income is 225 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị M. năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chị M. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2006.Vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào của hàng tạp hóa. Chị đã sử dụng vốn để mua thêm nhiều loại hàng hóa phục vụ bà con trong xã. Để có thể tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và có điều kiện hơn trong việc cung cấp cho hai con đang đi học, chị đã quyết định vay thêm vốn để mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh, mua thêm hàng hóa về bán vì thế chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ từ nguồn vốn của Quỹ. Thu nhập của cả gia đình chị đạt 3.500.000/ tháng

loans.use: buy merchandises for general store

loans.name: Murorunkwere

texts.en:
Murorunkwere S. Emerthe was born in 1963 and lives in Kimisagara. Murorunkwere was married in 1993, but her husband was killed one year later. She has three children and is in charge of two orphans. She began her business in 1996 taking a small amount of money from Nyarugenge money lenders (20,000RWF). She started selling crops. At the end of 1997, she had saved 450,000RWF. She started a new business going to Kampala to buy clothes and selling them in a small shop. She has been able to build a house with value of five million RWF.

She is requesting a loan of 500,890 RWF to increase her capital and expects to go to Dar-es-Salaam to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Chanthoeun's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C. is the Village Bank President of a group of eight members who are all in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She is a cake seller in the local village. Since her business activity is going well, Mrs. Chea C. is requesting a loan to buy more cakes to resell them.

Her husband, Mr. Sin Saron, is a motorbike taxi driver who can only make a small income, not enough to support his family. Mrs. Chea C. is 29 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending primary school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more cakes to resell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja diariamente cuidando de ovejas,  para luego vender su carne, también cría cuyes, pero en menor proporción, lleva a pastear a sus ovejas a espacios abiertos durante casi todo el día, y cerca al anochecer los regresa a su establo. Cuando sus animales están listos, planifica la distribución de la carne en varios lugares, como carnicerías y bodegas cercanas a su casa.Es más rentable comprar los animales vivos y vender su carne, que sólo comprar la carne al por mayor para distribuirla.Lidia disfruta de esta actividad porque le gustan los animales y le permite vivir tranquila.
Solicita este préstamo porque desea comprar más animales para hacerlos engordar, además para invertir en sus tierras y mejorar sus cultivos de pasto.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children. She works every day taking care of sheep in order to later sell their meat. During the day, she takes these sheep out to the field so they can feed themselves. When her animals are ready, she sells their meat to butcher shops and warehouses close to home. It is more productive to buy the animals alive and then sell their meat, than just buy their meat in large amounts in order to distribute them. Lidia enjoys this activity because she likes animals and because it gives her tranquility. She requests this loan because she would like to invest in the purchase of more animals and make them fatter. She also wants to invest in the land and in improving the quality of the grass from which her animals feed themselves. She also raises cuyes in smaller proportions,

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of animals that she currently has and improve the quality of the grass from which these animals feed themselves

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA GEORGINA TRABAJA PARA UN BANCO COMO PROMOTORA, ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA DE 3 HIJOS Y LUCHA POR DARLES UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONOMICA, POR LO TANTO ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA AMPLIACION DE SU VIVIENDA Y ASI TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA ELLA Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Georgina works for a bank as a promoter. She is a single mother of three children and struggles to provide them with some economic stability. For this reason, Georgina is requesting a loan to expand her home and provide a more comforable space for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an additional room

loans.name: Betty Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Betty Soledad S. M. D. C. tiene 59 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la calle Prolongación La Marina  815 Mz F lote 3 del Asentamiento Humano Luis Alberto Sánchez en el Puerto D. Salaverry en la provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Betty Soledad es Técnica en Contabilidad, pero se casó a los 23 años y no continuó trabajando en su profesión. 
Tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 5 son casados y una hija que aun es estudiante y depenD. D. ella.
Betty tiene una bodega  que fue cedida por una hija, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. artículos D. belleza, actualmente tiene la ventaja que el negocio se ubica en su propia casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas implementó su negocio.
Con este crédito D. 300 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará gaseosas, golosinas y otros insumos.
Betty sueña con regresar a visitar Argentina y reunirse con su hija que aun se encuentra en la patria gaucha.
texts.en:
Betty Soledad S. Maria D. C., 59, belongs to the Las Empresarias al Exito II ("Women Entrepeneurs for Success II") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She's a bookkeeper but she hasn't worked in the profession since she married. She has 6 children, 5 of whom are married. One daughter is still in school and lives at home.

Betty operates a small shop that she took over from one of her daughters. Before that, she maD. a living selling beauty products. She has the good fortune now of working at home. She got started in the business with her first loan of 300 soles which she repaid in 4 installments. With this 300-soles loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy soft drinks, candy and other merchandise.

Betty would like to go to Argentina again to see her daughter who is living there in the land of the "gaucho".

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

location.town: AA.HH. Luis Alberto Sánchez, Salaverry, Trujilloo

loans.name: Rosa Analy

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Analy tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Génesis y vive en la calle Juan Velasco Alvarado Mz. 3 lote 20 El Milagro, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó y tiene 2 hijas de 4 y 2 años respectivamente.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de jugo, ensalada de fruta, desayuno con pescado frito, etc. Se podría llamar una pequeña fuente de soda. El negocio funciona en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró hielo, fruta y colorantes para raspadilla.
Con este crédito de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará yogur, fruta, pescado para los desayunos, golosinas.
Rosa sueña con estudiar Administración de Empresas y ser una gran empresaria de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Analy is 23 years old. She finished high school but did not continue her education because she got married. She has two daughters, a 2 year old and a 4 year old. She is a member of the Grupo Solidario Génesis and live on Juan Velasco Alvarado Mz. Street, Lot 20 'El Milagro', in the district of Huanchaco, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Perú. Rosa runs a business selling juice, fruit salad, breakfasts of fried fish etc. You could call it a little soda shop. She runs it out of her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, Rosa bought ice, fruit and food coloring for snow cones. With this next loan of 600 soles, which will also be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy yogurt, fruit, candy, and fish. Rosa's dream is to study Business Administration and to be in charge of her own successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy yogurt, fruit, candy and fish

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina B. Pérez  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso de la provincia de Yungay.

Rosalina tiene 31 años y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que su principal dificultad ha sido superar la muerte de sus padres hace 04 años, donde ha tenido que recuperarse por el bienestar de sus hijos, Rosalía comenta que con su trabajo ha podido construir su casa, así mismo comprar un carro de trabajo y también tiene muebles para el uso familiar; ella se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado central de la ciudad de Yungay en un puesto del segundo piso hace 8 años, menciona que cuando empezó invirtió s/1000.00 soles aproximadamente y ahora tiene invertido en todo su negocio mas de s/3000.00 , y no ha tenido muchos problemas en su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de s/.1000.00, que pagará en seis cuotas invertirá en la promoción de su hijo, porque comenta que su hijo ha terminado un nivel en el colegio

Rosalina piensa que es necesario capacitarse en cuestiones de negocio para mejorar su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosalina B. P. is part of the "Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso" Communal Bank in the province of Yungay. Rosalina is 31 years old and has two children with her partner. It has been hard for her to recover from the death of her parents 4 years ago, but she has had to make an effort for the good of her children. With her work she has been able to build her home as well as buy a small cart for her job and furniture for the family. For the past 8 years she has sold food from a stand on the second floor of the city of Yungay's central market. When she started out she invested around S/. 1,000 and now she has a total of more than S/. 3,000 invested and has had very few problems with the business. With this loan for S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in six installments, she will invest in her son's education: he has just finished a level in school. Rosalina thinks she needs business training so that she can improve in that activity.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use, education expenses for her son.

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline  es una persona emprendedora ya que tiene el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo instalando un punto de llamadas ya que con los ingresos que actualmente tiene solo le alcanza para sobre vivencia y su objetivo es tener un punto de llamadas,  e Internet mejorando sus ingresos, para mejorar sus calidad de vida.
Vive en la zona de Escobar Uria de La Paz en la casa de sus abuelos .
El crédito será destinado para la compra de un punto de llamadas (Mini cabina telefónica)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este
texts.en:
Jakeline is an enterprising person. Her goal is to help her husband install a telephone booth since their current income is only enough to survive on. Her goal is to have a telephone booth and Internet, improving their income to improve their quality of life.

She lives in the Escobar Uria area of La Paz in her grandparents' house.

The loan will be used to buy a telephone booth (mini telephone booth).

It's the first time she has applied for a loan at Impro and her desire to excel gave her this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephone booth

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo menor de 8 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas; gaseosas y cervezas desde hace 15 años en su misma casa, por eso separó un ambiente para su negocio, ella tiende todo el día y los fines de semana vende la cerveza en los eventos sociales y para evitar problemas vende solo a personas  conocidas de su barrio. Este negocio le permite obtener ganancias considerables por lo que está planeando a futuro tener mayor capital para abastecerse y ser distribuidora al por mayor. Otro de los negocios alternativos de Isabel es la venta de cintas para el cabello para escolares que reparte al por mayor pero esto solo se da a inicios del año escolar. Es la primera vez que Isabel tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos y a apoyar activamente por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de cajas de cerveza, y listones para el cabello.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50-years-old and lives in her own house with her youngest child, who is 8. For 15 years she has made her living selling drinks, including soft drinks and beer; she has a separate area in her house for her business. She spends all day and the weekends selling beer at social events; to avoid problems she sells only to people she knows from her neighborhood. The business provides Isabel with considerable income, so for the future she's planning to increase capital to stock up and become a wholesale distributor. She also has a side business selling hair ribbons wholesale for school children, but only at the beginning of the school year. This is the first loan Isabel is requesting from MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her payments and to actively support the well being of her village bank. She plans to use her loan to buy cases of beer, and hair ribbons.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Magdaline Mambo

texts.en:
Magdaline is a widow with six grown children. She and her son run a business in Douala, selling spare motor parts and cars. She plans use this loan to purchase parts from Japan in which she will sell in Cameroon for a profit.

This is Magdaline’s ninth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 1999. She has seen that her previous loans have realized good profits for her, so she intends to take this loan out in order to produce the same effect.

Magdaline has been a widow for 28 years; her husband died an early death, when the children were young. She has supported her family by farming cocoyams and now has the ability to share her entrepreneurial spirit with her son.

With the profits from this loan, Magdaline plans to support younger children in their education and try to start up another business. She enjoys taking out GHAPE loans because GHAPE has always shown her loyalty and interest in her development.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase cars and used Japanese motor parts.

loans.name: Shinoun

texts.en:
