Mrs. Shinoun N. is a villager in Kok Romeat village in Kandal province. She was employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Rum Kam Sean, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Shinoun N. is applying a loan to add to her savings to buy clothes to resell to earn income. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Yuri Yamileth

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Yuri O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de cosméticos el cual posee desde hace tres años habiéndolo desarrollado satisfactoriamente en su localidad.

Actualmente, como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de la inversión para su crecimiento y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos cosméticos y también para la compra de mochilas con el propósito de comercializarlas en su localidad y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
For three years now, Ms. Yuri O. has dedicated herself to the business of selling cosmetics in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo, which has developed successfully in this location. Now, as with all developing businesses, investment is required for its growth. This is why she has requested a loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics, as well as backpacks, which she intends to sell in her shop in order to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 48 years old and married with five children. She sells sarongs by hawking them within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Comfort is hoping for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Mary Gay Rose

texts.en:
Mary Gay Rose is 41 years-old. She manages a general store in her village. She is married to Merlito R. who is 38 years-old and works as a house carpenter. They are living happily in Barangay Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two children.  Anne Marie is 14 years-old and studying in the secondary school and John Gayle is in pre-school.

Mary Gay Rose has run a retailing business for seven years. She manages a typical community based store where she sells a variety of small items. She is requesting a second loan to be used in expanding her business. She believes that “time is gold” which is why as soon as she started the business she begun saving for the future of her children. Her priority is their studies, and hopefully with the help of God and with this lending program, her dreams will become reality. She hopes that she can provide education for her children someday by working hard and by having strong determination to succeed.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Paraizo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Paraizo” esta representado por la señora Marcia y conformado por 16 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades como la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, comida, ropa, pan, construcciones de viviendas, lavado de ropa a domicilio y distribuidores de productos. El nivel competitivo es alto pero los socios saben como salir adelante con la venta de sus productos, pero requieren de un apoyo económico para las épocas bajas en las cuales se requiere cambiar de productos o aumentar la mercadería es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento. A pesar que el grupo es nuevo cuenta con la experiencia de grupos solidarios debido a anteriores financiamientos en instituciones similares a al fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo para agrandar sus negocios y a mejora la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Paraizo" is represented by Mrs. Marcia and has 16 members who sell cosmetics from catalog, food, clothes, bread, build houses, do laundry at home and distribute products. The competition level is high but the partners know how to get ahead selling their products, but are in need of economic support for the low periods when they have to change the products or increase the merchandise, and for this reason they require financing. In spite of the group being new, it has experience from solidary groups due to prior loans from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital who offers them support to extend their businesses and improve the life quality of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work caapital

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Teodosia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como conejo, gallinas, cuy, actividad que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento para animales.
Los sueños de Teodosia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Power Community Bank. Teodosia is married, is 56 years old, and has 6 children. Teodosia raises small animals like rabbits, hens, and guinea pigs. She pursues this activity in her house with the help of her children. She makes her sales in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Teodosia needs a loan of 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of food for the animals. Teodosia’s dreams are to improve her business and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for the animals

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Marlene Cristina E. P.
Tomé L. iniciativa D. trabajar a fin D. apoyar a mi esposo. Al principio esta idea no le gustó, pero con el tiempo me apoyó, es así que empecé como ayudante en un kiosco D. un colegio, durante este tiempo puD. cubrir los gastos del hogar y me sirvió para ahorrar un pequeño capital que lo utilicé para trabajar D. manera independiente en L. venta D. cosméticos.  Al comienzo los ingresos eran bajos, pero después empecé a ganar clienteL. y los pedidos eran cada vez más, en ese momento me di cuenta que necesitaba contar con un capital mayor al que tenía; para cumplir con mis clientes. Por ello es que decido hacerme un préstamo D. EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, así logro formar parte D. L. alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto”, actualmente somos diez socias quienes participamos y nos dedicamos al comercio minorista. Definitivamente durante estos tres años y medio que he venido trabajando con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, he podido incrementar mis ganancias, además ahora mis dos hijos estudian en colegio particular, tenemos una mejor calidad D. vida a lo que era antes, siento que no ha sido en vano el atrevimiento que tuve, sino me decidía hacerlo, no tendría el progreso que hoy tengo.
texts.en:
Marlene Cristina E. P. decided to work so she could help her husband. He did not like the idea at first, but in time began to support her. This is how she got started as an assistant in a high school kiosk. Doing this allowed her to cover the household bills and save a bit of money that she used to start selling cosmetics on her own. At first, she was not earning much but then she began to get some customers and the orders kept coming in. This is when she realized that she needed more capital than she had in order to serve her customers, which is why she decided to take out a loan with “EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD” and become a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto.” Right now, there are ten members working on their small-businesses. During the three and a half years she has been working with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, she has been able to increase her income. In additiojn, both of her children are studying in a private school and they have a better overall quality of life than they used to have. She feels that daring to start her own business has been worthwhile because she would not have maD. the progress she has maD. without it.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Мунире - 40 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды и женского нижнего белья на рынке Атуш города Худжанда, контейнер № 30. Ей помогает дочь. Она закупает товар из города Бишкека Республики Киргизия. Ездит за товаром в не сезон 1 раз, в сезон 2 раза в месяц. Сейчас начался школьный сезон, и хотя у Муниры в ассортименте нет детской одежды, она хочет закупить школьную форму для девочек и мальчиков, чтобы увеличить ассортимент и прибыль. Для этого она запрашивает займ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Munira is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of three children. She sells women's clothing and undergarments on the Atush market in the town of Khujand, container number 30. Her daughter helps her. She buys the merchandise in the city of Bishkek, Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise once during the slow season and twice a month during season. Now it's a school season and although Munira does not have children's clothing in her inventory she wants to buy school uniforms for girls and boys to increase the assortment and profit. She is asking for a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school and autumn clothing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 42 years old and married with 4 children, he mould and sells blocks. He is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase one more moulding machine. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one more molding machine

loans.name: Yutema

texts.en: Mr. Yutema has been a construction contractor for three years. He is 44 years old and his wife, Mrs. Saroth Horn, is 25 years old. They were married in 2000 and have no children yet. His wife stays at home. They live along National Road No. 1, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Yutema is applying for his first loan of $350 to pay for worker fees.

loans.use: To pay for workers fees in his construction contractor business

loans.name: Mastula's Group

texts.en: S. Mastula is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 37 years old and married with 5 children aged between 16 – 5 years all in secondary school as she takes care of 1 orphan. She is a business lady with a produce buying business that she sells out to her customers for 11 years now. Although her business is doing well, it is mostly affected with the varying seasons hence enabling her to make 400,000/= as profits a month. Her husband is a farmer and they work hand in hand to ensure that the family needs are met. She wants to turn into a regional produce buyer being able to transport all her produce to the bigger markets in Nakawa and Owino markets. Mastula needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for business expansion.

loans.use: Buying more produce for business expansion.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en: Baasansuren M. is a recent widow who lives with  four of her five children, ages 7 to 19, in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. She and four of her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The oldest child lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia while the middle child attends university and the youngest two children attend a local secondary school. Baasansuren's husband died of liver cancer recently and this tragedy has depleted the family’s income and resources. She successfully operated a meat retail business in her town’s local market   until her husband fell ill. She started her business in 2000 and has learned a lot about business and the local market in the nine years since. Her business’ working capital has been depleted because of her late husband’s illness and she is working hard to increase her income for herself and her children. Baasansuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat to sell this winter.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat to sell this winter

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina L. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty and native delicacies such as suman, biko, puto (various types of rice cake) and others in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng H., 55, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who make a combined income of around US$1.60 each day. Three of her children work as well. Two of her children are garment factoriey workers and one is a construction worker. The agriculture industry has really suffered in Cambodia over the past year, as the climate has had unfavorable conditions and inflation has been high. Eng H. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction tools for her children. With this purchase the family believes that it can increase its income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Letecia is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling candles in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Munasib

texts.en:
Munasib is married and has two children. He was born in 1974. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region, now settled in the Fuzuli region, Zobjug village.

Munasib started his cattle breeding business fifteen years ago. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy four calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 52 years old, married, and has eight children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor, preparing and selling kenkey with fried fish. Mary buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells her prepared dish by the roadside. She has been in this business for over twenty years now, and currently needs a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of maize

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
el señor Margarito A. C. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en union libre y depende de el una niña de un mes de nacida,  su compañera de hogar le ayuda en la pulperia mientras el trabaja por las noches en una propiedad como vigilante.

Margarito esta solicitando el crédito para surtir un poco mas su negocio, ya que de este negocio y con lo que le pagan como vigilante logra cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y de su hija recien nacida.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante a su familia. 
Margarito es una persona honesta y con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, dice que quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito A. C. is 31 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and he has a one month old baby girl. His household partner helps in the grocery story while he works as a security guard for a property at night. Margarito is requesting the loan to stock up his business a little more. Since with this business and what he earns as a security guard, he manages to cover all of his household expenses and the expenses of his recently born daughter. He needs the loan so that he can make progress for his family. Margarito is an honest person and he is very eager to work and move ahead. He says he wants to give his daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, churros, candy, instant soups, condiments, corn flour, rice, sugar,  flour

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Mrs. Norm C. is 51 years old, and she lives in Tonle village in Takeo province.   She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sumbat Moung, is a palm juice collector. This family has a problem because her husband can obtain a lot of palm juice, so he must sell palm juice far from his village, but he does not have a motorbike to transport it to sell. Thus, Mrs. Norm C. decided to request a loan to buy a new motorbike for their palm juice business to increase income. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is enrolled in a local public school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for their palm juice business

loans.name: Buthayna

texts.en: Buthayna is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Gaza, Palestine. She is married with six children. Since 2009 she has owned a store that sells different kinds of goods, like clothes, stationary, and toys. She needs a loan of $3,000 to be able to increase the stock in her store. This loan will help her maintain good work and the ability to support her children. She is a very motivated, thoughtful woman who seeks help to continue her successful small business.

loans.use: To increase stock and profit

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Mrs. Evangeline D., 40 years of age, is married and is a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She is married to Ponciano D., employed by the government as a driver of a government vehicle in the city. With an income of only P4,000 from her husband, they felt some financial hardships in supporting the needs of their three children who are now of school age. To help her husband, Evangeline uses her skills in pedicure and manicure and is currently providing pedicure and manicure services. Through these skills, she is earning an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month which is so helpful to their family. Evangeline joined the cooperative this year, 2010. As a newly-recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, she was given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P3,000 to purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets for her business activities. Evangeline’s dreams in life are to provide a better future for her children and to improve their living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pedicure and manicure sets

loans.name: Lewulo

texts.en:
Lewulo F. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more milk packets. Forty-years-old and widowed, Lewulo has seven children, none of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more milk packets in the restaurant

loans.name: 03.01.06 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Ha L. T. (26) is a 45-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ha is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.01.06 Hoang Hoa Group. Ha is married and has four school-aged children. She operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month. In 2004, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ha is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Lap (63) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. C. T. Thang (5) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 3. L. T. Hoan (38) is a 26-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ha L. T. (26) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ha là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03,01,06 Hoang Hoa (03,01,06 Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Ha thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ha kiếm được khoảng 1,200,000 VND. Vào 2004, Ha đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ha đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Lap (63) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. C. T. Thang (5) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. L. T. Hoan (38) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland S. is from the village of Olango. He is 24 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roland plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $1080 during harvest season.

In 2008, Roland joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roland has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Roland is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be his fourth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Odette Meddiani

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de charbons de bois, elle exerce son commerce dans son quartier et elle a l’avantage d’être  la seule à faire ce commerce dan son quartier, une partie de son stock de charbons de bois a été détruite par la pluie, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite pour sa première fois un crédit de WAGES afin de s’acheter 46 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
In 2007 this lady set herself up selling charcoal. She carries out this business in her neighborhood and has the advantage of being the only person to do so. A part of her stock of charcoal was destroyed by rain, and as she wants to get fresh supplies she is requesting a first loan from WAGES, in order to buy 46 sacks of charcoal. She is married and mother to one child.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 27 years old, single, and struggles by selling a variety of goods in his shop. He has been in this business for about two years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Venuste, after realizing that his sales are not enough to earn more profits, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can purchase more rice, sugar, salt, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.

With these additional goods for sale, Venuste hopes that his profits will increase and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for his store

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita O. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 50 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP when she sells her raised pig every four months.
In 2006, Melita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Melita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old and is involved in farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest at her town's local market. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store located at her house. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vanchin-Erdene

texts.en:
Vanchin-Erdene B. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is the traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two children go to a local kindergarten while his wife works as a cook in their town.

Vanchin-Erdene currently operates a small bakery in his town. He started his bakery business in 2007 and makes a variety of breads and baked pastries. He is a hardworking, easygoing man who is focused on the future growth of his business. He says, “I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future.”

Vanchin-Erdene hopes to continue to grow his business in the future and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a small car in order to distribute his products throughout his province.

loans.use: To purchase a car to distribute his bakery products

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie T. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately $133 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jennie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies

loans.name: Arlen Nicolasa

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Arlen Nicolasa T. P. tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene tres hijos todos adultos. Esta microempresaria se dedica a administrar un comedor desde hace muchos años. Inicialmente solo vendía fritos (tajada de plátanos con carne de cerdo) y poco a poco fue ofertando más tipos de comidas.

Actualmente este comedor es uno de los mas visitados en la ciudad de Bluefields y con los ingresos de este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales dos han terminado sus estudios universitarios.

La señora T. es miembro activo de la iglesia Verbo en esta ciudad de Bluefields por lo que esta solicitando se le financie para comprar una freidora de pollo la cual le permitirá dar un mejor servicio en calidad y rapidez a sus clientes.

Esta freidora tiene un valor de US 1,000.00 dólares americanos.
texts.en:
Arlen Nicolasa T. P. is a 55 year old micro-business woman. She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are adults. This micro-business woman has operated a restaurant for many years. At first she only sold fried foods (sliced plantains with pork). Little by little she began to offer more types of food. Presently this restaurant is one of the more frequented ones in the city of Bluefields. With the income from this business she has been able to get her children ahead and two of them have finished college. Mrs. T. is an active member of the Verbo church in this city of Bluefields. She is asking to be financed to by a chicken fryer which will allow her to offer faster and higher quality service to her customers. The fryer costs US 1,000.00.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy: a chicken fryer

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (pictured here with her loom) and her husband Mr. Sam-oeun Soy live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2004 and have one young daughter.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. Her husband works on a chicken farm. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Dionisio Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dionisio Gabriel; el tiene 70  años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio es propietario de un restaurant en unas de las calles de la ciudad del Cusco llamado Avenida Garcilaso en Santiago, el trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m  juntamente con su esposa sacan adelante a sus hijos por medio de este pequeño restaurant, el socio quiere tener una tienda venta de muebles más adelante. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para su restaurant, el compra como arroz, carne y verduras al por mayor. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Dioniso Gabriel, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Dionisio Gabriel is 70 years old, he is married and has 4 children. He owns a restaurant in the town of Cusco: it is located in the Avenida Garcilaso en Santiago, and he works there form 9 am to 7 pm. Together with his wife, they provide for their children thanks to this small restaurant. In the future, he wishes to own a furniture sales shop. The loan he is requesting will be used for the wholesale purchase of cooking ingredients for his restaurant, such as rice, meat and vegetables. He is thankful to those who will help make his dream come true through this loan, and he commits to repaying his dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of products for his restaurant such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and is married with seven children. He runs Jako Motors and it’s thirteen years since he started the business which has ten employees.

Richard appreciates Faulu Kenya because he has managed to obtain financial support which he used to buy business assets. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a spraying machine.

Richard hopes to expand his business to other locations. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a spraying machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita’s greatest dream is to get away from the twist of poverty. In 2007 she embraced the idea of joining ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.), means “To Rise Up from Poverty”, and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As busy entrepreneur, Anita engaged in te multiple businesses of selling charcoal, kaing (small basket) making and fishing, which allows her to save for their future. They want to enjoy towards the retirement of their life in the future and to have a happy family as well.

Now, on her fifth loan, she applied for a new loan amounting to PHP 25,000.00 for the maintenance of her kaing making, to buy inventories of charcoal to sell and to purchase additional raw materials for her fishing business such as a fishing net, bamboo and other things. This raw materials will be used to make additional “skylab” (fish traps) to catch more fish and to have sound profits. 

The couple hopes and dreams that by God’s Will, he can give them long a life to provide a better future for her family, to sustain the profitability of her businesses, and giving the best education for her 2 children.  Through hard work and determination, Anita is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support her multiple businesses such as selling of charcoal, kaing making and fishing.

loans.name: Roger's Group

texts.en:
Roger A. is from the village of Casalatan, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 38 years old. Roger is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Roger is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP monthly for these activities.

In 2008, Roger joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Roger is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Roger from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa C. is from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Narissa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Narissa provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Narissa has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Narissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Narissa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business. This will be the ninth loan taken by Narissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of hers family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P. is 57 years old and her husband, Mr. Ben But, is 58 years old. They have been married since 1973 and have six sons. Three are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, one is a fisherman and another is a farmer. The family lives in a small village along National Road number five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Rom is a tailor, and her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to get to work. She will use part of the loan as capital for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son, and to use as capital for her husband's farming business

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, es una señora trabajadora se dedica a una panadería y a la crianza de cerdos, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposo don José Francisco con quien procrearon 6 hijos de los cuales solo cuatro viven con ellos ya que los otros dos están casados, sus hijos se llaman Nelson Antonio de 20 años, Digna de 18, Melvin Leonel de 12 años de edad. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la crianza de cerditos y hace 5 años aprendió a preparar pan dulce a través de capacitaciones que recibió, lo que le ha permitido dedicarse a dos negocios para generar ganancias para su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos para la panadería como harina, levadura y azúcar, también comprara 2 cerditos para engordarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar la inversión al negocio y podrá hacer pan para vender, al igual que los cerditos los engordara para luego comercializarlos.
Su misión es seguir creciendo y mejorando su producción de la panadería y aumentar el número de cerditos en su granja para ir desarrollándose en el comercio y generar ganancias para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old.  She is a hard-working lady who runs a bakery and raises pigs.  She lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, with her husband José Francisco, with whom she has six children.  Only four of their children still live with them as the other two are married.  Their children are 20 year-old Nelson Antonio, 18 year-old Digna and 12 year-old Melvin Leonel.

María has been raising pigs for 20 years and 5 years ago she learned to make 'pan dulce' (lightly-sweetened bread) through some training that she received.  This allowed her to carry out two businesses to make money for her family.

María is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her bakery such as flour, yeast and sugar.  She will also buy two piglets to fatten.  This loan will help her to invest in her business.  She will be able to make bread to sell and she will be able to fatten her piglets and then sell them.

María's mission is to continue growing and improving her production in her bakery and to increase the number of piglets on her farm so that she can make progress in the business and make profits to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bakery such as flour and sugar and to buy pigs

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old married man, living in Tayouneh with his wife and one child. Hasan has worked on his own as a barber since 2004, and has a totA. of thirteen years of experience in this field. Most of his clients are friends, relatives and neighbors. They like his work and are relaxed being his clients. 

Hasan is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to add decorations to his shop, buy necessary tools for his business and to increase his inventory of products, such as gel and creams. Hasan is planning to open a big beauty therapy center, which he claims will include everything a man needs to cheer up.

loans.use: To add decorations to his shop

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando U. is from the village of Masimag, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 49 years old. Armando is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Armando operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for his business comes from buying and selling broiler chickens. He is also selling eggs from his laying chickens. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 1997, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Armando is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional chickens to sell and chicken feeds. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Armando from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to sell and chicken feeds

loans.name: Mougne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MOUGNE est créé en 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées par affinité et par  voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KOBITENE.

Madame Christine D. debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 48 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Mais elle a la charge de 06 enfants qui lui sont confiés par sa sœur
 
Elle s'active depuis dans la vent de poissons séchés au marché central de Ziguinchor, Et sa collaboration avec CAURIE-MF lui permet de renouveler ses prêts et de continuer ses activités.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge les enfants de sa sœur qui lui sont confiés
texts.en:
The Mougne solidarity group has been created in 2008 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois to which it belongs. It is composed of 11 women living in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to create a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kobitene.

Mrs. Christine Diehiou, standing to the right with her arm raised in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 48 years old. She is single without children. But she has six children in her care, entrusted to her by her sister. She has been selling dry fish at the main market of Ziguinchor. Her collaboration with Caurie-MF allows her to take out loans and grown her business. Her goal is to support herself and to provide for her sister’s children in her care.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling dry fish

loans.name: Francisca Aurora

texts.es: La señora Francisca tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con el señor Antonio Insfran, tienen 2 hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aun viven con ellos, viven en un barrio muy concurrido de la ciudad de Itá. La misma posee un taller de confecciones en su domicilio en el cual actualmente confecciona uniformes para funcionarios de una conocida entidad educativa, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su marido, quien es macatero (vendedor ambulante de ropas) hace varios años, también el apoyo de su hijo que es comerciante y su hija que es abogada y profesora de una Universidad. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de dichas prendas ya que necesita capital, porque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza a crédito.
texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old and married to Antonio Insfran.  They have two grown-up children who still live with them, in a very busy neighborhood in the city of Itá.

Francisca owns a dressmaking workshop in her home where she makes uniforms for employees from a well-known educational institution.  She has financial support from her husband who has been working as a traveling salesman, selling clothes, for several years.  She also has the support of her son, who is a salesman, and her daughter who is a lawyer and university professor.

Francisca is requesting this loan to buy fabric and threads to make her clothes.  She needs capital because she sells most of her products on credit.

loans.use: To buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Dora, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposo, se dedica a una tienda, la cual se fundó por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo, hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días atendiendo de 5:00am a 7:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos domésticos como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, leche, entre otros productos, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a ser más eficiente con los clientes teniéndoles todo lo necesario para el hogar.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio por un largo tiempo, ayudar a los clientes con un buen servicio, pero sobretodo tener lo necesario para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Dora lives in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She’s 61 years old and lives with her husband.  She has a grocery store that she started with her own initiative together with her husband ten years ago.  She works every day from 5am until 7pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy domestic products like: oil, rice, beans and milk, among others.  The loan will help her strengthen the business and be more efficient with customers having everything on hand needed in the home.

Her hope is to stay in business for a long time, to help customers with good service but above all to have everything she and her husband need.

loans.use: To buy products: oil, rice, beans and milk.

loans.name: Liliana Penigna

texts.es: La srta Liliana Q. Gavilán es soltera sin hijos,vieve a quince minutos del centro de la ciudad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos iniciando el negocio en mayo del dos mil diez debido a la falta de trabajo que la aquejaba, anteriormente trabajaba con su tía en un negocio familiar de venta de comida, ella estudio Derecho y Ciencias Policticas en la universidad de su ciudad, actualmente esta haciendo sus practicas profesionales como abogada en un  estudio jurídico; su sueño a futuro es implementar su negocio mejorando la cantidad y calidad de su mercaderia para satisfacer a sus clientes para poderse comprar una casa que es su principal necesidad a la fecha,ella es muy conocida en su zona contando con muy buenas referencias personales es por ello que se propone el credito.
texts.en: Miss Liliana Q. Gavilán is single without children. She lives 15 minutes from the center of the city and works in cosmetic sales. She began the business in May 2010.  Previously, she worked with her aunt in a family business of food sales. She studied law and political science at the university in her city. She is currently practicing law.  Her dream for the future is to implement her business improving the quantity and quality of her merchandise to satisfy her clients. She would like to purchase a home. She is very well known in her area and has very good personal references, and this is why she is being offered the credit.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: 4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Tuyết  T. Thị (13) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 4 Đông Vệ (08.05.4 Đông Vệ ).


Tuyết  is married and has one school-aged child.  To making a living, Tuyết  owns & operates a general store selling  products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste.  Tuyết  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Tuyết  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuyết  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyết  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị K. Khánh (14) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Lê Thị N. Linh (15) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tuyết  T. Thị (13) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 Đông Vệ (08.05.4 Đông Vệ ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tuyết  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyết  kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Tuyết  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tuyết  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị K. Khánh (14) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  Lê Thị N. Linh (15) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan P., 49, a resident of Ascoville, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jose P., an overseas Filipino worker. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is already working while another is currently enrolled in college; one is in high school and two are enrolled in the local elementary school. 

By the grace of God, Susan has managed to support her older children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Susan, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.


Susan is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Susan dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business.


Susan prays for successful lives for all her children and hopefully they will able to send her children all the way through college.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items to replenishment inventory.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna S. lives in Yerevan together with her husband and son. Susanna’s son is a student. Susanna runs a bakery in the city and her husband helps her by delivering the bread to the shops. Susanna would like to develop her business and increase her working capital. She plans to make a bulk purchase of raw ingredients for the bakery. The loan will help Susanna increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, negocio que inicio para ayudarse económicamente en el hogar, ya que tiene sus tres hijos estudiando, anteriormente trabajaba en servicio domestico, logrando dedicar todo su tiempo  a las ventas, lo que ha captado la clientela, productos que vende al contado y al crédito por catálogos.
Isabel espera poder vender más productos es por eso con este préstamo comprara: ropa variada, pantalones, camisas, trajes de niñas, y sandalias ya que tiene cosmético y invertirá solo en ropa para mejorar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Isabel sells clothing and cosmetics for a living, a  business she started in order to help with the household expenses.  She used to work as a domestic employee. Since her three children are in school she is able to dedicate all her time to her sales. This has helped her to build her customer base.  She sells her products on a cash and credit basis through catalogs.  

Isabel hopes to sell more products and it is for this reason that with this loan she will buy: assorted clothing, pants, shirts, girl's dresses and sandals.   Since she already has cosmetics, she will invest only in clothing to improve her sales, increase her income and be able to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing for men and women as well as sandals.

loans.name: Regina Teodocia

texts.es:
Regina es socia del Banco Comunal “Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Tiene grado de instrucción secundaria (incompleta).
Regina y su pareja se dedican a la compra y venta de animales caseros como gallinas, chanchos y ovejas; paralelamente ella se dedica a los tejidos como chompas, chalecos y chalinas.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos hace tres ciclos.  Su primer  préstamo solicitado  que fue  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que aumentará al capital de su negocio y comprará 20 gallinas, tres corderitos y chanchos, dice que los compra y lo vende en la localidad de Ilave.
Su sueño es tener otro negocio de venta de carne en Arequipa y Tacana.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Regina, 27, is a member of the “Trenzas de Oro” (Golden Braids) communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She went to secondary school but did not complete it.

Regina and her spouse buy and sell domestic animals like chickens, pigs and sheep.  She also weaves sweaters, vests and shawls.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three cycles.   Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her business.

She will ask for a new, 500 new sol, loan to increase her business’ capital.  She will buy 20 chickens, three baby lambs and pigs.  She says that she buys and sells in Ilave.  Her dream is to have another business selling meat in Arequipa and Tacana.

What she likes about her communal bank is what she earns on savings and the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy twenty chickens, two lambs and pigs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jean has operated a vegetable garden for 5 years. She harvests vegetables such as eggplants and string beans to sell. Jean has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable plants. Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants

loans.name: Chehab

texts.en:
Chehab is a 46-year-old married man and has four children. He has been working in transportation for 25 years. Chehab transports several things, depending on the customer's destination; he might transport vegetables, furniture and many other things.

His customers include friends and other community members who have come to know him through his work over the past twenty-five years.  He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua (a Kiva partner) for the third time in order to fix his pickup and to pay for his mother's urgent medical surgery. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business.

He's known for his strict appointments and the quality of work provided. Chehab hopes to stay capable of helping his family members and providing a healthy living for his family. He also hopes to expand his business through buying an additional pickup to reply to all requested transports.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his pickup and pay for his mother's urgent medical surgery

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Veuve de 36ans, Abra a 02 enfants. Elle a commencé en 2009 par vendre des bijoux, sacs et chaussures à toutes personnes. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abra is a 36 year old widow with two children.  In 2009, she started selling jewelry, handbags and shoes to the public. This loan will help her to buy merchandise, the sale of which will help her to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and handbags.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Judith has run a shop where she sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She is a new member of HSPFI.

Judith is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 46-year-old married man who studied heating and cooling engineering. After getting his certificate, he worked in many places to gain experience in the field, until one day he opened his own store selling air conditioners and heaters plus providing the service of a heating and cooling technician.

After running his business for six years now in Al Mafraq, Majed has applied for a loan to buy more types and new models of air conditioners that are being requested by his customers.

loans.use: To buy more types and new models of air conditioners.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 21 year old hardworking man lives with his parents in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda.
This young man deals both in produce and transportation businesses and his current dream is to buy his own motorcyle for the businesses.  He has been riding someone else's motorcycle and this limits his daily income since 70% of the income has to be remitted to the owner of the motorcycle.  He needs the Kiva loan to buy a new motrcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: to buy a new motrcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 28 years old and single. He supports himself. For the past four years, Titus has owned a retail shop in the Chepterit trading center. He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Titus is requesting his third KADET loan to purchase two bags of brown sugar, one bale of wheat flour, and 10 kilograms of rice. He will use the profits from his loan to pay school fees for his younger brother and to repay his loan. In the future, he dreams of owning a supermarket and having a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase brown sugar, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Ramon Isidoro

texts.es:
Ramón Isidoro tiene 43 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con un hermano en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, está conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Ramón  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos e insumos para los cultivos y también invertir en la compra de cerdos para la cría y luego venderlos. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 

El sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir tranquilos sin preocuparse de los arriendos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
Ramón Isidoro is 43 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with a brother in the Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

The Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja communal bank is made up of fifteen members and is located 90 minutes from the cooperative. This bank is dedicated to agricultural activity, such as the planting of cacao, rice, corn, soy, plantains, oranges, etc.  

Ramón is a farmer. He plants cacao, rice, soy, and oranges. He does his buying and selling in San José del Tambo every weekend.
He is asking for the loan to be able to buy seed, fertilizer, and materials for his crops and also to invest in the purchase of pigs to raise and sell.  
This loan will help him to meet his financial needs and face frequent challenges such as competition and pests. 

His dream is to be able to live without having to worry about rent. In his free time, he likes to go on outings with his parents.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and materials for his crops and also to invest in the purchase of pigs to raise.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 58 years old, married, and has one child. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. Raymundo has been a a seaweed farmer for five years, and he also buys and sells fish to people in his community.

Raymundo plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy straw, wooden pegs, and more fish to sell. He hope that in future he will be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs, and more fish to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 28 años, trabajadora del MINED, como docente de Educación Primaria desde hace 4 años, está solicitando su 1er credito para utilizarlo en mejora de su vivienda el cual comparte con su familia, y asi darle otro ambiente a los mismos, esta joven es bien trabajadora y reconocida en su barrio, se ha ido superando día a día para darle un futuro mejor a los suyos, sus sueños es verse formada como una profesional y tener un hogar con condiciones donde ellos se sienta alegres y realizados como familia.
texts.en: Concepción, 28, has worked for MINED [Ministry of Education] as an Elementary School Teacher for the last 4 years.  She is asking for her first home improvement loan to make improvements to the dwelling she shares with her family creating a different environment for them.  This young woman is very hardworking and renowned in her neighborhood.  She’s been improving daily to provide a better future for her loved ones.  Her dream is to see herself fully realized as a professional and to have a home with conditions such that she feels cheerful and fulfilled as a family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to begin construction on a home

loans.name: Oscar Exequiel

texts.es:
El señor Oscar tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Los Angela. Es casado y tiene dos hijas, de 4 y 8 años de edad. Su esposa Alba es comerciante y sale a vender mercadería de forma ambulante, 3 veces a la semana. Ella empezó vendiendo mercadería hace 3 años. 

Hace 8 meses, la pareja puso una pulpería donde vende comestibles y granos básicos. Don Oscar vendió su vehículo para poner el negocio porque quería tener un fuente de ingreso fuera de su trabajo actual. Don Oscar sigue trabajando en el taller de camiones de su padre, pero dedica 6 horas diarias a la pulpería. Cuando no está Don Oscar, la señora Alba cuida el negocio y atiende a la clientela. 

El señor Oscar va a utilizar el préstamo de L6500 para comprar granos básicos como maíz y frijol, y mercadería como ropa, calzados y cosméticos, con la esperanza de surtir a la pulpería y a la venta ambulante de su esposa. Oscar espera que en un futuro, cuando la pulpería está suficientemente grande, los dos podrán dedicarse solo a ella.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old, and he lives in the village of Los Angela.  He is married and has two daughters, ages 4 and 8.  His wife, Alba, is a merchant.  She sells merchandise in an itinerant manner three times a week.  She started selling merchandise three years ago.

Eight months ago the couple established a grocery store where food and basic grains are sold.  Oscar sold his vehicle in order to set up this business.  He wanted to have a source of income aside from his current job.  Oscar continues working in his father’s truck workshop.  However, he devotes six hours a day to the grocery store.  When Oscar is not there, Alba takes care of the business and tends to the customers.

Oscar will use the loan for 6,500 lempiras to buy basic grains like corn and beans.  He will also buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to stock his grocery store and his wife’s itinerant sales.

Oscar hopes that in the future, when the grocery store is big enough, the two of them will be able to only work there.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old woman who works along with her husband, Emad, in a tailoring shop that she owns. They have two daughters and one son.

Both Amal and her husband have been working in the shop for the last 7 years, and are dependent on it as their income source.
