Now Amal has applied for a loan to fix the interior decoration and arrangement to be more flexible for them to work in; she also wants to buy more fabric and material.

Since Amal is a conservative person, her husband Emad has agreed to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to improve the interior decoration and to buy more fabric and material.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old has three children between the ages of 11 and 18 years old. Two of her children are in school. She is a widow. She has had a business selling breads in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Roxana Jessica

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de flores.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta y alquiler de vestidos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de dos docena de vestidos, una docena de zapatos.  Nos cuenta que la mercadería lo compra en Lima y ls vende en la ciudad. En le negocio le ayuda su mamá, su esposo trabaja como policía.

La señora desea tener su propio stand de venta de ropa.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Brisas del Lago communal bank, located in the province and department of Puno.  She is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She studied at the university level.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for five years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 PEN, which she investing in her business selling flowers.  Currently she works selling and renting dresses.

She will request a new loan for the sum of 2000 PEN, which she will invest in buying two dozen dresses and one dozen pairs of shoes.  She tells us that she buys her merchandise in Lima and sells it in the city.  Her mother helps her in the business.  Her husband works as a police officer.

She wants to have her own stand to sell clothing.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease and the usefulness of the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy two dozen outfits and one dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bibi operates a cereal-selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers needs.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and green grams. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and green grams.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: With her desire to improve her family's living situation, Rosalie has devoted herself full-time to her pig-raising business for several years. She is 45 years old and is married to Miguel, a farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. They work hard to give their two children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs. She hopes to grow and increase her turnover with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder de 35 años es soltero, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Wilder es un hombre dedicado al servicio de la sociedad, de profesión educador, actualmente se desempeña como regidor en el distrito de Sivia. Wilder tiene un terreno agrícola que heredó de sus padres, en el ha plantado cacao (injerto). Asimismo para que pueda desempeñar con mator rapidez su trabajo contrata dos jornaleros que siempre están al tanto del mantenimiento, pero Wilder no deja de supervisar sus plantas. Actualmente no tiene benficio alguno de su trabajo, por lo que ahora esta invirtiendo esperando que mas adelante pueda cosechar las ganancias que le dejará su producción de cacao y esto será dentro de 2 años. Wilder está feliz por el buen trabajo que vienen realizando en su campo agrícola. Por tanto solicitará un segundo credito con MFP, y del que se compromete otra vez  en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Wilder es el secretario en su banco comunal por lo que agradece a los que lo integran por esa confianza. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el pago al personal.
texts.en:
Wilder is 35 years old, he is single and he lives in own house which is located in the district of Sivia. Wilder provides services to society by working in the education sector. He is currently working as a stage manager in the Sivia district. Wilder has an agricultural plot of land which he inherited from his parents in which he has planted cocoa beans. In order to finish his work more quickly, he also hires two day laborers who always keep on top of the maintenance but Wilder always oversees his staff. 

He currently has no income from the work so he is investing, in the hope that in the future he will be able to reap the profits that his cocoa production will generate, which will be within 2 years. Wilder is happy with the good work that is carried out on his agricultural land. Therefore he is applying for a second loan with MFP and again he promises to make all his repayments on time. Wilder is the secretary of his communal bank so he is grateful to the members for trusting him with this role. He will pay his staff with the 2,500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to pay his day laborers.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Mr. Hiep is 39 years old and has two children. He is a tailor and is managing a tailor shop. His business started many years ago. His shop is always busy with customers. Joining our credit program in 2006, he used loans to buy a sewing machine and fabric. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy fabric to meet the increasing demand of customers for the Tet holiday (Vietnamese new year).

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Eudo Rafael

texts.es:
Eudo es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer un mayor bienestar a su familia. Eudo se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos a quienes les quiere ofrecer la oportunidad de acceder a una educación universitaria. Eudo tuvo que abandonar su municipio natal con el ánimo de buscar mejores alternativas de trabajo, por lo que tuvo que abandonar su familia durante un tiempo mientras el generaba una estabilidad con la que pudiera sostener en el nuevo municipio a su familia; esta fue una situación muy difícil para Eudo y tuvo que superarla con gran fortaleza. Eudo se ha dedicado a la actividad de la carpintería durante toda su vida, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy niño trabajaba junto a el. Gracias a esto aprendió la actividad y pudo generar un negocio del cual pueda sostener a su familia. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, Eudo es reconocido en su sector y esto le ha venido muy bien con sus ventas. Con el ánimo de seguir produciendo sus trabajos, Eudo aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina colilladora e insumos como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para su taller.

Eudo espera que su negocio le siga generando buenos ingresos y este le permita ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Eudo espera que sus ventas aumenten con la nueva máquina, pues podrá hacer trabajos que antes no podía y esto significará un aumento considerable en sus ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina colilladora e insumos como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para su taller.

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio   tiene 42 años de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Joffre Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos orgánicos, químico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar buena semillas.

Las compras  y las ventas lo harán en Ventanas. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos y comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

He is a member of VRC El RECREO, which is located in San Vicente, Las Lomas precinct. Belonging to Ventanas canton, the members of this community bank work in farming and raising livestock.

Joffre Antonio works as a farmer, growing corn, beans and rice. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, and organic and chemical fertilizers. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy good seeds. 

He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Joffre Antonio's dream is to be able to provide his children with an education, and buy land to continue planting. In his free time he enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: to buy seeds, and organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Chwele District. She is 45 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Alice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2015 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. Alice plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Alice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Kévin

texts.en:
Born on September 22, 1983, Mr Kévin S. is a photographer. To make enough money, he goes to visit his customers from district to district because he does not have the money to establish a photo studio. Very dynamic and devoted, he has quickly gained the trust of his customers and is in high demand, especially for big events. At the request of many of his customers, he would like to open his own studio. This project requires the capital that Mr. S.'s small income would not be able to support. He would therefore like to ask for a credit of $700 to open his own studio, buy a high-quality camera as well as a video camera for event reporting. This credit will allow him to bring his work to a more professional level and, ultimately, earn a better income.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 22 Septembre 1983, Monsieur S. Kévin est photographe de formation. Pour se prendre en charge, il se promène de quartier en quartier pour aller vers les clients car il n’a pas les moyens d’avoir un studio photo. Très dynamique et dévoué, il gagna vite la confiance de ses clients et est très sollicité aujourd’hui surtout dans les grandes manifestations. A la demande de ses nombreux clients, il souhaite ouvrir son propre studio. Ce projet nécessite assez de moyens que les petites économies de Monsieur S. ne pourront pas supporter. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $700 pour ouvrir son atelier, acquérir un appareil photo de bonne qualité et une caméra pour les minis reportages des fêtes. L’octroi de ce crédit lui permettra de professionnaliser son travail et d’en tirer plus de revenu.

loans.use: Open a photo studio, buy a high-quality camera and a video camera

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en: M. Mikayil is 38 and married with 4 children. He is the owner of a small food store in Bilasuvar. His dream is to enlarge his store and start to sell gifts and accessories. To approach his dream, he has decided to borrow 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: Going to broaden his food store

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S. is 32 years old and earns $3 a day selling fish. She has a husband (pictured) who grows a variety of vegetables. Together they have 3 children. Yen S. is a hardworking woman who would like to expand her business and improve efficiency by purchasing a motorcycle so that she can transport the fish that she sells more easily.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for business purposes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
“I have a business in which I sell pre-owned shoes and clothing. With the cold season approaching, I have received requests from my customers for warmer clothing and would like to purchase additional merchandise to fulfill their requests. I am requesting $1,200 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Christian García , Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos usados y me gustaría comprar más mercancía ya que se acerca la temporada de frío y los clientes ya me lo están solicitando”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use:
Business investment

Invertir para negocio

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe C. is 45-years-old, has been separated for more than 12 years, and lives in his own house with his two daughters, one who is 15, and the oldest, who is 17. His daughters go to high school and are now in their last years there. Felipe used to sell electronic products on the border market with Argentina, but he had to close his business due to the decline in value of the Argentine peso, since most of his clients came from Argentina.

Now he has a business where he sells drinks, including soft drinks, beer, wine, liquor, whisky, etc., and he has all of the necessary equipment for this type of work. He has had his store right in the middle of the city for two years now. The business is attended to personally by Felipe, and of course, with the constant help of his two daughters. Since his business is getting better every day, Felipe's current project is to finance a hamburger restaurant to be able to attract more clients and to have a larger income.

Felipe is a very hard-working and sacrificing person, since he had to raise his two daughters by himself. But even then he was still able to give them the best. He is requesting a loan to expand his store and to arrange it better to give space to his clients who come to eat and drink there.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Felipe C. tiene 45 años de edad, esta separado hace más de 12 años y vive en su casa propia junto con sus dos hijas, una de 15 años y la mayor de 17 años. Sus hijas van al colegio cursando ya los últimos años.

Felipe se dedicaba a la venta de productos electrónicos en el mercado fronterizo con Argentina, pero tuvo que cerrar su negocio por la caída del valor del peso argentino, de donde provenían la mayor parte de sus clientes.

Hoy día posee un negocio de ventas de bebidas, en donde comercializa gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, licores, wiskies, etc. y cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para este tipo de trabajo. El local esta ubicado en pleno centro de la ciudad y de esto ya va 2 años. El negocio es atendido personalmente por el señor Felipe y claro, con la ayuda constante de sus dos hijas. Como el negocio va cada día mejor, el proyecto de Felipe es habilitar mas adelante una hamburguesería, para así captar más clientelas y tener mayor ingreso.

Felipe es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada por el hecho que tuvo que criar solo sus dos hijas, pero aun así pudo darle siempre lo mejor. El solicita el crédito para hacer una ampliación del local comercial, de este modo distribuir mejor su tienda y dar espacio a los clientes que vienen a consumir en su local.

loans.use: Expansion of his store (to pay for labor and construction materials like bricks, cement, sand, and whitewash).

loans.name: Bawala

texts.en:
Bawala has operated a canteen, or small grocery store, for the past seven years. As I have written dozens of stories about these type of stores, I wanted to take a moment to talk about the wonderful people who operate them. Balwala is one of so many who have enrichened my life with their warm personalities and welcoming ways. I have traveled extensively and the people of Uganda are some of the most welcoming people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.

Bawala is a delight. She is married with 8 children. Since her business is like so many others, it is her personality that brings her a strong clientele and sets her store apart. Bawala radiates warmth and caring and is a strong leader in her village. With her loan she will add more staple foods to her store.

loans.use: Bawala plans to use her loan to buy more staple foods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1973. and she lives in Zukići, a small village near the town of Živinice. She is married and together with her husband runs a small farm with cows and heifers. Their monthly income is too little for  their 5-member  family. She has 3 children and they are all going to the primary school. This is her first loan with MCO WWI in the amount of  US$ 450. She is going  to buy food  for her livestock, and in that way she will try to manage not to have to sell off her animals because  the livestock is their only income source.

loans.use: Buying farm supplies

loans.name: Sayu Kadek Lastri

texts.id:
Sayu Kadek Lastri is a resilient woman and she never stops to rest. Each day Sayu works hard to help her husband add to their family earnings. Her husband Putu Suatra works as a contract farmer, and so his job is not stable. Through their Tempek group (a traditional organization) in their village, Sayu Kadek Lastri has received a loan from Yayasan Dinari (Kiva partner organization coordinating this listing). With these funds she has purchased female cows with the hope that in the future she will get the cows to birth calves. In addition, the funds were used to buy three pigs. After raising them for three months, the plan is to sell two and keep one for breeding. Each day Sayu Kadek Lastri tends to and cares for her cows and pigs.The calf would only need to be fed grass and tender green leaves that are readily available in Sayu’s garden. For her pigs, Sayu has to buy bran grains and feed mixture. The hope is that within three months the pigs are ready for sale with an estimated price of Rp.1,800,000 (USD equivalent $196) for two. The net gain in those three months could reach Rp.500,000 (USD equivalent 54), and she could use that income to fulfill her family’s needs. Her hope for the future is that her efforts with the cows and pigs will pay off for the family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Sayu Kadek Lastri adalah seroang ibu rumah tangga yang ulet dan tidak pernah tinggal diam saja. Setiap hari Sayu bekerja keras membantu suaminya untuk dapat memperoleh penghasilan tambahan. Suaminya, Putu Suatra, bekerja sebagi petani upahan yang pekerjaan tidak tetap. Melalui kelompok Tempek ( organisasi adat ) didesanya, Sayu Kadek Lastri mendapat pinjaman dana dari Yayasan Dinari. Dengan dana ini Sayu Kadek Lastri membeli sapi betina dengan harapan kedepan nanti dapat mendapatkan anak sapi dari sapinya. Selain itu dana tersebut dibelikan 3 ekor babi penggemukan yang rencananya akan djual setelah dipelihara 3 bulan dan satu ekor akan dijadikan induk babi. Setiap hari Sayu Kadek Lastri memelihara dan merawat sapi dan 3 ekor babinya. Anak sapi hanya diberi makan rumput dan daun hijau yang mudah didapat di kebunnya. Untuk babinya Sayu Kadek Lastri harus membeli dedak padi dan konsentrat sebagai campurannya dengan harapan dalam 3 bulan babi siap dijual dengan perkiraan harga Rp.1.800.000,-.untuk dua ekor. Keuntungan bersih dalam setiap tiga bulan bisa mencapai Rp.500.000,- dan dari keuntungan yang didapat dipergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya. Harapan kedepannya agar usaha ternak sapi dan babinya dapat menguntungkan.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
A few metres from the Central Cemetery in the city of Juliaca we find a very happy Simona, selling her beautiful flower bouquets. She’s originally from the Mañazo district. She comes from a very modest family so instead of finishing grade school, she stayed home and helped out on the farm. She married at 21 and the result of this union was her dear son Carlos. But, a short time later they decided to mutually separate. A few months later, she decided to move to Juliaca where she began working a few different jobs to make ends meet. Today she sells beautiful, colorful flowers. Her hard work is motivated by her desire to provide her dear son the opportunity to finish his studies. To accomplish this, she is asking for a loan so she can increase her business capital.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

A pocos metros del cementerio Central de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos muy contenta a doña Simona vendiendo los hermosos y variados ramos de flores. Ella es natural del distrito de Mañazo, no pudo concluir sus estudios primarios porque sus padres provenían de una familia muy humilde, es por ello que desde muy niña se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a sus padres en su actividad agrícola y ganadera.A los 21 años contrajo matrimonio, fruto de su unión nació su querido hijo Carlos, pero poco tiempo después en mutuo acuerdo decidió separase de su esposo, a los pocos meses de su separación decidió radicar junto a su hijo en la ciudad de Juliaca y en dicha ciudad se dedicó a diversas actividades con el fin de brindarle lo mejor.Actualmente se dedica a la venta de coloridas y hermosas flores, el motivo de su esfuerzo es para otorgarle la oportunidad de concluir la carrera que está estudiando su querido hijo.Para cumplir su más grande anhelo requiere aumentar sus ingresos económicos, es por esa razón que recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en: I am Mariam I. from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two sons, both of whom attend a local school. My husband has run a canteen in one of the local schools for the last eight years. I help him to prepare snacks for his canteen.  My loan group consists of: Rubina B. (who sews clothes to order), Anwer J. (her husband is a turner) as well as Shamshad A. and Nazia B. (both are borrowing for their families’ construction business).

loans.use: to expand the cafeteria situated in a local school

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz A., 58, keeps cows and sells milk to the neighbors and local bazaar traders. He started his business in 1992 and has very good experience in raising livestock and making yoghurt for sale. He is going to use the loan to purchase two milch cows at US$ 600 each.

Mubariz and his family live in a settlement for internally displaced people. He is married and has two daughters and two sons. This will help him to increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two milch cows

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L., 37 years old, currently live with her husband, Mr Nguyen Anh Tuan and her two small children. Her family main source of income is retailing mobile phone. As the standard of living increase and the demand for technology rise, she realize that mobile phone is becoming a norm in the society. In 2005, her family decided to open up a small mobile phone retail store at home. As mobile phone is currently in high demand, they were achieving many success. With these confident, and the appearance of TYM in the later year, they took out many loans and were able to diversify their products and achieving even more success. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7 million VND to invest more in her store. Her family income is 5 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị L. 37 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Tuấn Anh, Nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình anh chị là buôn bán điện thoại di động. Nhận thấy xã hội phát triển, nhu cầu thông tin liên lạc đang là một trong những mặt hàng không thể thiếu của mỗi gia đình. Năm 2005 gia đình anh chị đã bàn bạc và mở 1 của hàng buôn bán điện thoại di động ngay tại nhà, đúng như nhận định ban đầu việc làm ăn của gia đinh chị không gặp khó khăn. Khách hàng có nhu cầu sử dụng điện thoại di động ngày càng đông ở mọi tầng lớp, khi Quỹ về hoạt động tại địa bàn anh đã động viên chị tham gia vào quỹ để vay vốn, với việc vay vốn của Quỹ các mặt hàng của gia đình anh chị nhiều và phong phú hơn từ đó cửa hàng của anh chị đã đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, 2 con anh chị đang còn trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 7.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng điện thoại. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
Originally from Sakété in the Ouémé department, Mrs. Victoire A. was born on 1st September 1967. She is married and has 4 children, all adults. She does not live with her husband. Having settled and survived by herself for a decade, she is very dynamic and organized in her work. She owns her own shop situated in Agongbomey, where she sells various convenience goods. She travels to neighbouring Nigeria herself to make her purchases.She is asking for her very first loan, and would like to have a larger shop in order to enlarge her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire de Sakété dans le département de l'Ouémé, dame A. Victoire est née le 01/09/1967. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous majeurs. Elle ne vit pas avec son mari. Installée à son propre compte depuis une dizaine d'année elle est très dynamique et organisée dans son travail. Elle possède sa propre boutique située à Agongbomey où elle vend divers produits de consommation courante. Elle se rend elle même au Nigéria voisin pour faire ses achats. Elle est à son tout premier crédit et voudrait disposer d'une plus grande boutique pour des besoins de croissance.

loans.use: To buy one box of food paste, and 2 boxes of canned food

loans.name: Ezhar

texts.en:
Ezhar A. is 21; he lives in the Shewa district with his two children and his wife. Ezhar is uneducated, but clever and active. During the last three decades, because of the war in Afghanistan, Ezhar couldn't go to school and was unable to realize his dreams. His two small brothers are studying in a public school and Ezhar helps them and attempts to provide all the necessary things for them.

When Ezhar A. got married, his father gave him just 30,000 Afghanis ($600). He was tired of farming, so he changed his business and immediately opened a small retail shop with 18,000 Afghanis and purchased some goods with the remainin money. At the beginning, Ezhar encountered some difficulties because he was new to this business and didn't have previous experience in shopkeeping. He didn't know how to find customers and increase his sales, but after a few months he got this skill and was finally able to purchase more retail goods for his shop.

Ezhar A. is not just a breadwinner for his own family, but he must provide some medicines for his sick parents and support his small brothers also.

Two months ago he completed a mobile phone repair private course, and then he decided to change his business and started a mobile repair and sales shop. He thinks that there is much demand for these things, but he needs some money to purchase enough equipment and different models of mobile phones. Thereford he has applied to AFSG for a 50,000 Afghanis loan for 18 months.

Ezhar dreams that if he able to increase his daily income from 400 Afghanis ($8) to 700 Afghanis ( $14), he will learn some English and computer skills. He sincerely thanks the lenders who assist poor people hard times and encourage them to work.

loans.use: To buy phone repair equipments and mobiles

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 34-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. She is a tailor who makes clothes in the local village.

In her business, Mrs. Yang S. now faces a small problem because her sewing machine is too old and cannot produce a good product for her consumers so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to make a good product for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home repairs and improvements.

loans.name: Capullo De Rosa Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five very excited people! They come from the group "Capullo De Rosa". Each member is living in extreme poverty and feels like starting their own business could be a way to break cycle of poverty.

Jacquelin is the representative of this group and was chosen because of her strong nature. She is only 23 years old but wants to change things early in her life. She says she wants to be able to provide for her kids and family someday. She currently has a small business selling clothes. She started it with her first loan and wants to continue increasing and growing her business. She feels like this is her chance to change her future and she wants to take advantage of it!

On behalf of Jacquelin, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N. lives in Svay Prey village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her pig breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Sum Sophat, is a farmer who cultivates rice. Mrs. Ny N. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is two years old. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Exsilda

texts.es:
La señora Exsilda, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín Provincia y distrito Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes en general y frutas y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Exilda tiene 62 años de edad y es madre de 06 hijos. Ahora vive con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar su casa para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exsilda is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín Region, in the Province and district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries in general and fruit. Her business is located in her own house.

With this loan for $350 (S/.1,000), she will buy basic necessities such as rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy her customers' needs. The loan will be repaid in 6 months.

Exsilda is 62 years old and the mother of 6 children. Now she lives with her husband who works in agriculture. She is thankful for the support given to her because it allows her to build up her business. Her goal is to fix her house to provide security for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "AMISTAD" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA GRACIELA ELLA AL IGUAL QUE SUS COMPAÑERAS VAN CURSANDO SU PRIMER CICLO DENTRO LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL PERO SE SIENTEN CAPACES PARA CUMPLIR CON LAS EXPECTATIVAS D. LA INSTITUCIÓN. LA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICA A ACTIVIDADES D. VENTA D. COMIDA, ROPA, COSMÉTICOS POR CATÁLOGOS, ABARROTES EN TIENDAS D. BARRIO Y A LA COSTURA D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR. LAS SOCIAS RECONOCEN QUE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO Y PARA VENCERLA SE TIENE QUE CONTAR CON MUCHO ENTUSIASMO Y PRODUCTOS D. CALIDAD Y ES AHÍ DOND. LA FUNDACIÓN COLABORA CON LOS PEQUEÑOS VENDEDORES, BRINDANDO UN APOYO FINANCIERO PARA NUEVOS PROYECTOS D. EXPANSIÓN Y MEJORA D. PRODUCTOS, QUE CONLLEVA A MEJORES INGRESOS PARA BRINDAR A LOS SOCIOS Y A SUS FAMILIAS MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amistad” is represented by Graciela. She and the other bank members are starting their first loan cycle with Agrocapital Foundation. However, they feel capable of meeting the institution’s expectations. The majority of the members are in the business of selling food, clothes, cosmetics for catalogues, groceries in neighborhood stores and tailoring clothes. The members know that there is a lot of competition in the marketplace, and in order to overcome it, much enthusiasm and good quality products are needed. It is with this that the foundation helps the small business owners, by providing finaincial support for new expansion projects and improvement of products, which produces higher income and ultimately a better quality of life for members and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo A. is a dried fish vendor. He buys fish from his friends who are fishermen and sells all his fish in the streets. From his business, he is able to buy food for his family, pay all their family expenditures and save a little amount for their future use. Now, as he is already 42, he wants to expand his business so he can send all his four children to college, an educational attainment that he and his wife were not able to have when they were young. Aside from dried fish, Leonilo is raising livestock. In this way, he has more sources of income for his growing family.

Leonilo is requesting a loan of 18,000 pesos from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more dried fish and part of the loan is intended to buy more livestock to sell.

Leonilo has been a CEVI client for more than three years. He enjoys credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that the CEVI credit program gives.

loans.use: To buy dried fish and livestock for sale.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
K. Mavluda was born in 1960 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Mavluda works in Khujand, so she has to go to Khujand every day. She works in the local bazaar, where she trades in children wear. Mavluda likes her work and attends to it creatively. She is very polite and kind by nature.

Mavluda works with straight suppliers from China and brings assortments of goods from Istaravshan, where she goes twice a month. Mavluda is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to use to import seasonal goods. Mavluda thanks Kiva for its support and wishes it all the best in the future.

loans.use: Import seasonal goods

loans.name: Theary

texts.en: Mrs. Theary N. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She runs a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phoeung Sophak, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also an ice-cream seller. Mrs. Theary N. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for her husband to  use for his ice cream selling rounds. She would use the rest of the money to buy pig meal and piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase the family income and improve her family's living conditions. She is 27 years old and the mother of four children. One goes to the local school while the others are still very young. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motocycle for her husband to transport ice cream to sell; to buy pig meal and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Manallasac Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Rosas D. Manallasacc son D. L. comunidad D. Manallasacc, Distrito D. Chiara, Provincia D. Huamanga, L. comunidad se ubica a 2 horas D. L. ciudad D. Huamanga, a 3400 m.s.n.m., las actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. agricultura y ganadería.

Celestina es casada, sus hijos son ya mayores D. edad, Celestina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, actividad que realiza hace muchos años, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará abarrotes y artículos D. ferretería, los sueños D. Celestina son viajar y ahorrar los suficiente.

Nicolaza es casada, Nicolaza se dedica a L. compra y venta D. quesos, además D. venta D. cereales, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. útiles escolares que venderá en L. feria D. su comunidad. El sueño D. Nicolaza es construir su casa en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Vanesa es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos D. 4, 6  años, Vanesa iniciará con L. venta D. gelatinas y chupetes, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. gelatinas, elL. espera que su negocio mejore.
texts.en:
The members of the Rosas D. Manallasacc Communal Bank are from the community of Manallasacc, Chiara District, Province of Huamanga. The community is located two hours from the city of Huamanga at 3,400 meters (11,150 feet) above sea level. The principal activities of the community are agriculture and raising livestock. Celestina is married and her children are now adults. She has a grocery store which she has run for many years. She will use her loan to buy groceries and hardware. Celestina's dreams are to travel and to save up enough money. Nicolaza is married and devotes herself to buying and selling cheeses. She also sells grain which she learned from her parents. Her loan will be invested in buying school supplies which she will sell at her community's fair. Her dream is to build herself a house in the city of Ayacucho. Vanesa is a single mother with two children, ages four and six. Vanesa will begin by selling gelatinas (gelatin snacks) and lollipops. Her loan will be used to buy more gelatinas. She hopes that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the members' businesses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49-year-old married mother of eight children. Her husband does not work so to help keep her children in school Joyce sells cereals such as maize, rice and beans. She purchases them in Busia, Kenya, on the Ugandan border. She is asking for 10 000 KES to increase her food stock so she can sell more. Her main challenges are inadequate capital, a high inflation rate, transport, and feeding her children.

Joyce recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Rehana Kosar Muhammad Saleem Shahid Group

texts.en:
Jannat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy a horse cart for loading.
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 
Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 
Rehana kosar baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Rehana baji is married to M. S. S. who is a driver of a vehicle named auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rehana baji helps him with her sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to pay for the utilities of her house. She is applying for a loan to pay the remaining installments of her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining installments of auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Zeudi

texts.es:
La señora Zeudi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 533, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella y son por la que ella trabaja constantemente.

Motivada por su espíritu joven y su energía emprendedora, inicio su negocio con un capital de S/. 300.00 con la Venta de limones, en un puesto del Mercado “El Huequito” de la misma ciudad, tiene clientes fijos y es ella quien  los atiende con su carisma y buen trato. 
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio esta satisfecha con lo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  07 sacos de limones, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas para ubicar sus limones.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Zeudi belongs to the “Las Estrellitas II” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Progreso Nº 533, in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, in the San Martín Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has two dependent children who are the reason she works constantly.
Driven by her youthful spirit and enterprising energy, she started selling lemons at a stall in the city’s “El Huequito” Market with 300 PEN in capital. She has regular customers and, with charisma, she provides them excellent customer service. She continues to runs the same business and is happy in what she does.
With this 1000 PEN loan, she will buy 7 sacks of lemons and will also use part of the money to purchase tables to display them.
She is very happy since she has been able to overcome difficulties together with her family. She acknowledges and is grateful for the support that the Manuela Ramos Movement provides her and other women who wish to start up a business and make it, without depending on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of lemons and tables to display her products

loans.name: Courtesy Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old woman who managed to stay in school until 8th grade.  Mary has 4 children who all attend private school.  The oldest child is currently 13 and the youngest is 6.  She also cares for her sister’s child, who goes to school with her own.    

Mary supports the family through her dry goods stand in front of her house. In this shop she sells the necessities like rice, eggs, and pounded cassava.  Her primary method of attracting customers is by talking politely to them.    Mary dreams that her business will grow very large and she will be able to build or buy her own house.

loans.use: 2 or 3 bags of rice, 13 dozen eggs, 2 bags of sugar, and other things

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa,  vive en el centro poblado de Molino.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de redes de pesca. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la reparación de su bote, ella se dedica a la pesca.  Paralelamente se dedica a elaborar artesanías que luego las vende en las ferias.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la cuenta interna y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Molino-Juli” village bank that is in the village of Molino, in the Juli district, Chucuito province, and the Puno department. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has completed a secondary school education and lives in the village of Molino. She has partnered with Manuela Ramos for almost 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy fishing nets. She currently needs a loan of 300 nuevos soles to repair her boat as her work is in fishing. In parallel with fishing, she makes crafts that she later sells at markets. Her desire is to continue working and be able to educate her children. She likes the internal account and the meetings at her village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her boat

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of Area Five . She is a 26-year-old women, she is married, and  a  mother of two children .Her children aged 6 and 2 years.

Zainabu started her own clothing business  selling clothes for five years. She works twelve hour a day and earn a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tsh.

This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zainabu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Analda Josefa

texts.es:
La sra. Analda R. tiene 50 años de edad, es comerciante y su actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tajaditas de platano fritas, las vende en los diferentes institutos y escuelas de la ciudad, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, dicha actividad le genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia y demas compromisos que tiene.
Analda esta solicitando este credito para el complemento de compra de una motocicleta, ya que su 
producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante haciendo uso de una bicicleta.
tiene la colaboracion de su hijo para repartir su producto.
ella considera que es necesario la compra de motocicleta para poder realizar las entregas mas rapido.
ya que por el tiempo que se demora en entregar no puede repartir mas bolsas de tajaditas.
texts.en:
Sra. Analda R. is 50 years old. She is an entrepreneur who makes and sells plantain chips. She sells her product to various institutions and schools throughout the city. Sra. Analda has been in business for 5 years and says that she is able to generate enough income to cover her family expenses and other financial commitments.

She is requesting a loan in order to complete the purchase of a motorcycle. Her son currently distributes her products door-to-door on a bicycle. Sra. Analda believes having a motorcycle is necessary in order to make faster deliveries. With the time it currently takes to make deliveries, she is not able to distribute all of her inventory of chips.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making plantain chips & a motorbike for making deliveries

loans.name: Parey Gul Group

texts.en:
Parey G. is the group leader of the Parey G. Group. There are four members in this group. They want a loan to improve and expand their businesses, so they are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani. 

Parey G. wants a loan for her husband who has a wood shop. Shellah wants a loan for her bag weaving business. Jamela wants a loan for her tailoring business. Fatama wants a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver. 

They are very thankful to all Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina has been working patiently to provide the needs of her children. She is engaged in a retail business but she still does not have her own stall where she can display her products.  She admits that her daily profits are not sufficient to meet their daily needs. For this reason, she is also working as a stay-out housemaid and accepts laundry in their village to earn additional income. With the business she is engaged in, she is accumulating an income which is sufficient for her family and sometimes providing for other needs of her grandchildren.

As a businesswoman, Martina would like to expand her retailing business to be more profitable and somehow develop her own retail stall where she could display her products.  She hopes to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 from the Kiva lenders.  She will use the loan to purchase more stock for her store that will result in an income increase.  Since she is getting old, she hopes that she can have good health so she can pursue helping her family. Two of her children are already married but she still supports her grandchildren.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old man who lives with his wife in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon.

Ali owns a shop and he works as a car electrician. He needs a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand his business by purchasing merchandise. This is the third time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he works on both mechanical and electrical problems for cars. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his work and opening a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Josefa is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Josefa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josefa joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josefa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin V. is from the village of Dela Paz. She is 40 years old. Joaquin is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Joaquin plants, harvests, and sells vegetables from her garden. She has been in business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Joaquin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joaquin is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This  will be Joaquin's 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Munkhtuya R. is 59 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Khovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son and daughter are university students and her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school.

Munkhtuya used to work as a nurse but now operates a small grocery shop in her town with the help of her husband. Her salary as a nurse was very low and she started her grocery shop in 2006 so that she could earn more money to support her family. Munkhtuya has found success with her new business and due to her good management has doubled her profits in just two years. She recently purchased a van using her savings from the business. 

Munkhtuya is focused on continuing her success in the future and says, "It is hard to live if in Mongolia if you don't conduct your own business. Our shop is the only source of income for my family, therefore, my dream is to continue to grow my business in the future." Munkhtuya is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase grocery items for her shop.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Khao

texts.en:
Khao S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. This couple has four children, three of who are students and one is too young to attend school.

Khao S. grows vegetables and raises pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is a recycler and make US$4 of profit each day. 

Khao S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.en:
D. Hikmatullo lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan where he was born in 1958. With God's help, he has become an excellent supplier of vegetables for his community. He is responsible for seven people (his wife and six children) and earns his family's living with his farming. Hikmatullo knows all the ins and outs of this business. He has 13 years of experience. His greatest triumph is his production of vegetables in the off-season. However, in order to accomplish this, he needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to be able to supply enough vegetables to meet the demand. This will allow him to better provide for his family. Let's help Hikmatullo as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 35 años, vive con  su esposo Julio de  47 años, junto a sus 3 hijos; Eliel de 15, Miguel de 10 y Selena de 4 años, juntos habitan su casa que es propia.Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa, maíz, habas en sus tierras ; realiza esta actividad con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras con el abono adecuado para asegurar su productividad; así vende sus productos con facilidad en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene fieles  clientes, para el futuro tiene planeado  sembrar habas, arveja y papa en mayor cantidad, además se proyecta aperturar una panadería dentro de su localidad porque quiere generarse mayores ingresos , que le permitan brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y aS. que será puntual en sus pagos para acceder a más créditos.Con el dinero del préstamo, Mayela piensa comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de habas, 2 botellas de insecticida y varios sacos de abono orgánico además de  fertilizantes para cuidar sus cosechas y su productividad.
texts.en:
Mayela is 35 years old and lives with her husband Julio, 47, along with their three children, Eliel, 15; Miguel, 10; and Selena, 4; in a house they own. For the past 20 years Mayela has made a living harvesting peas, potatoes, corn and beans. She carries out this work with the unconditional help of her husband, and what she likes most about her job is cultivating the lands with adequate fertilizers to ensure productivity. Then she can sell her products with ease at the city's wholesale market, where she has faithful clients. For the future, she plans to harvest beans, peas and potatoes in higher quantities. She also has plans to open a bakery inside her home because she wants to generate more income, which would allow her to provide an adequate quality of life for her children. This is the second loan she has had from Kiva partner MFP, and she assures us that she will be punctual with her payments so she can gain access to more credit. With the money she is requesting, Mayela plans to purchase three sacks of bean seeds, two bottles of insecticide, and various sacks of manure and other fertilizers so she can care for her crops and ensure their productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria T. solicito el crédito para uso personal específicamente para compras de útiles escolares y uniformes ella es profesora de primaria,  tiene de trabajar con CEPRODEL ya casi dos años y medio, ella vive en Masaya en un barrio llamado pancasan, tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar y prácticamente ella con su salario y el préstamo compra todo lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maria T. is requesting a loan for personal use, specifically to purchase school supplies and uniforms. She is an elementary school teacher and has been involved with CEPRODEL for nearly two and a half years. She lives in Masaya in a neighborhood called Pancasan. She has two children who are of school age, and with her salary and the loan, she will be able to buy them everything they need to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells foodstuffs and fruit at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist and he supports the home. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruit to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle started her hog-raising business with only one piglet.  She raised it and when she sold it, she was able to buy three piglets.  With her continuous efforts, her business started growing and now it is the main source of her income.  Michelle is planning to expand her pen so more pigs could be accommodated.  She requested a loan of Php6,000, which she will use to buy feed for her pigs and materials to expand of their pen.  Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Michelle’s growing business.

loans.use: Feeds for pigs and supplies to expand their pen.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila G., 46, is working to provide for her family's daily needs. Her husband, Hernando G., is a Granite Craft Operator and they are blessed with five children. She has been managing their granite craft business for quite some time now.

Mila has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve their granite craft business.     

Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000. This amount will be used as a source of capital to buy granite needed to expand their business and continue production of their products like table tops.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying granite to create table tops and othe products.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Diana del Socorro Blandón G. comercializa vigoron comida típica que consiste en yuca cosida, chicharrón y ensalada de repollo. Ella inicio vendiendo en las aceras de registro civil en una pequeña mesa con libra y media de chicharrón.
Hoy en día tiene su propio local con cinco mesas, bien ordenado y comercializa más variedad de comidas. Ella con el préstamo comprara más sillas y mesas además de invertir en la producción.
texts.en:
Diana del Socorro Blandón G. sells Vigorón, a traditional dish comprised of cooked manioc, fried pork rinds and coleslaw. She started out selling on the sidewalk, outside the municipal public records office, with a little table and a pound and a half of chicharron. Now, she has her own, well organized, space with five tables and she sells a wider variety of dishes. She will use the funds to buy more tables and chairs as well as invest in ingredients for her production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and make improvements to her locale.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato D. C. is from the village of Olango. He is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Renato plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $1020 whenever he harvest his rice plants (palay).

In 2008, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Renato is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be his fifth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde is the mother of four and she is 50 years of age. She sells and supplies building materials like sand, gravel and granite and she has been in the business for about twelve years.

With her years in the business, Kehinde is well-known and she has numerous customers. She is very happy with her business improvement but wants more growth in future. She wishes to improve her business so that she can make more profit to reinvest and take good care of her family.

Kehinde needs the loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more building materials like sand, gravel and granite to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials like sand, gravel and granite to sell

loans.name: Gulchaman

texts.en: H. Gulchaman is 39 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Gulchaman dedicates herself to raising and selling livestock and, with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Gulchaman asks for a 7,000 Somoni loan in order to buy more young livestock to raise and sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more young livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Mr. Chea Chheang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for eleven people located in Chres village in Prey Veng province. Mr. Chea C. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each group member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mr. Chea C. is 45 years old. He is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell in order to support his family. Now he has some problems because the soil in his field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Chea C. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. His wife, Mrs. Houn Mey, owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money from selling groceries. He is the father of two children, all of whom are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima lives in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan, where her husband sells crockery to earn income for his family. Her family has been settled in Borewala for over twenty-five years. 

Halima knits clothes by taking orders from her neighborhood to help her husband in bearing the financial burden of the family. She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. One of her sons is employed in a shoe-selling business while the other sells the crockery like his father. Her other children are getting their education. 

Last year Halima helped her son get started in his crockery business by receiving a loan from Asasah. This time she has applied for a loan because her son wants to buy more crockery such as glass dinner sets, tea sets, and so on for his business.

loans.use: Purchase crockery for reselling

loans.name: Salud

texts.en: Salud M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 84 years old and is widowed with one adult child. Salud owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Salud joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Salud is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E., a married woman who lives in Prk. Pine Tree, Brgy. Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fishing business. Her husband, 42-year-old Rogelio E. Jr., works as a fishermen and assists in his wife's business activities. They have four children ranging from 11 to 22 years old.

Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24000 to buy additional supplies for her sari-sari (general) store as well as materials to make some repairs to her house. Myrna E. is a Dungganon woman, following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Felicitas es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Felicitas se dedica a la venta de frutas en las diferentes ferias de la región, a donde viaja 2 veces por semana y de las ferias compra maíz, queso, productos que luego comercializa de casa en casa, en un inicio vendía también frutas pero en menor cantidad y de manera ambulatoria, ahora su negocio ha crecido.
Felicitas solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de manzanas, plátanos.
Felicitas sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the community bank named Dignity. Felicitas is married and she has 5 children, all of whom are attending school. Felicitas sells fruits in various fairs in the region. She travels twice per week to purchase corn and cheese, products that later she resells door to door. At first she only sold fruit but now her business has grown. Felicitas requests a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to purchase apples and bananas. Felicitas dreams to see her kids in a career.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase apples and bananas.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhorn Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn, 26, is the mother of a child who is four years old. She is a weaver while her husband, Mr. Kuntha Lang, is a construction worker. They both are farmers as well in Kandal village in Takeo province. They own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Sokhorn’s problem is that she does not have enough oxen to plow the land.

Sokhorn was selected as village bank president by the fourteen other members who will use their portions of the loan in various ways to support their families. To improve her production, Sokhorn is seeking a loan to buy an ox.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a hairdresser who also sells hair creams and weave-ons (hair extensions) at Elmina. She has received junior high education and is married with two children. She responsibly supports her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.

Nancy’s loan will be used to buy more hair products to sell. She plans on using the new earnings from her business to save towards furthering her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more hair products for sale.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-coungo, sous préfecture de Fana,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce d’habits, du lait et d’articles divers.                                                                                                              
Ces femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. MARIAM MOUSSA C. du groupe Sabougnouman compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter beaucoup d’articles divers.
Elle s’approvisionne généralement avec les grossistes de la ville et à Bamako, elle effectue sa vente sur place à la maison au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouman group are all married with three children, are around 42 years old and live in large extended families in the village of Marka-Coungo in the municipality of Fana, the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through friends and family, and are involved in foodsales and selling clothes, milk and other items. These women are on their 8th loan. Mariam Moussa C., a member of the group, aims to use her loan in order to purchase several items. She generally sources her goods from the wholesalers in her town and from Bamako, and she sells her goods from her home for cash or credit to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her family's needs, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Norma
