texts.es: Norma, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 43 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Norma sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su producción. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: 42 year old Norma is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 43 year old husband Cesar and her 4 dear children, to whom she wishes to provide a better future. Early mornings every day, Norma starts working her fields; for her there are no days of rest, because she must work continuously to obtain a good crop. Her main products are potatoes and peas, which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her job is the freedom she gets from working on her crops, as she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been doing this activity for 20 years and considers that the hardest thing is protecting her crops from the plagues of insects that may damage her production. For the future she wishes to buy more land, to increase production. This is the first MFP credit and she hopes to be very punctual in her payments. In her communal bank she is liked by the rest of her colleagues because she is so happy. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to enjoy better production

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man and the father of 2 school-age children. He has been working as an electrician and sanitary since 2000. He works as a traveler upon request of his clients. He is the main income provider for his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a Rapid car to facilitate his movements instead of the unsecure motorcycle he has been using. It will be more comfortable during the winter season. He has already made some savings and he needs an additional amount to be able to purchase it. He says that he is certain that his business demand will increase because he will be able to provide faster services. In the future, he hopes to continue expansion of his occupation.

loans.use: purchase a Rapid car

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud has two children, Rahaf and Karam, and is married to Haitham, who is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Kholoud's husband bought a store four years ago, paying the down payment from his savings and the rest from the store's returns. Now that he has one last payment to pay, he came to FATEN and took a loan for this purpose.

Owning the store converts the amount he used to pay in rent to returns and improves his financial situation. The store, which sells books, stationary, toys and other things, is located in a good area surrounded by schools.

Kholoud comes from a conservative background, so her husband Haitham appears in the picture here in the store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: Last payment to fully own the bookstore

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma E. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Delma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delma is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Delma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula L. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Valencia, Alegria, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two businesses: a general store and video rental. She has three children who are between 30 and 38 years old. 

Romula joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Romula has been lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus improving the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her seventh loan, she hopes to borrow PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell. Romula L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Luz Melida

texts.es:
Luz de 53 años, es una mujer trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que está separada de su esposo. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso ha trabajado en su casa vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos y conocidos. Tiene horarios variados desde las 09h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Vende ropa de hombre y mujeres para poder mantener a los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene muchas proyecciones por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y dedicar otra parte para construcción de su casa con cemento y pinturas. 

Uno de sus objetivos y metas para el futuro es terminar de construir su casa y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Luz , age 53, is a hardworking woman who always likes having her own money in order to support her two children. She is separated from her husband.

Luz lives in a periurban area called Paraíso where she works from home selling clothing to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her schedule varies between the hours of 9am and 5pm. She sells men’s and women’s clothing to cover the household expenses. Luz has many projects and wants the loan to buy clothing and set aside part of it to build her house with cement and paints.

One of her goals and objectives for the future is to finish the construction of her house and secure her retirement.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell and acquire materials to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dozens more slippers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M., 53, is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling cosmetics and beauty products from Natasha and Avon in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as deodorants and lotions. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as deodorants and lotions.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a young married man who has a small child. Naimjon manufactures and sells doors and windows. He always offers reasonable prices and friendly customer service, which helped him gain a good reputation in town. Naimjon has a good discount system for all his wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for 4 years together with his father. 

Naimjon is requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase raw materials and increase the assorted merchandise he offers for sale. His business can boast very stable financial standing even in this time of economic volatility. 

Naimjon is dreaming about buying a facility for his business to save on rent expenses. We hope financial assistance will help his business grow and develop and make his dream come true one day.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing materials for door and window manufacturing

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
La señora Leoncia O. F. es de la localidad de Santani, tiene casa propia,  tiene 55 años de edad y está casada con el  señor Juan Bautista Sanabria  de 66 años de edad.
Es propietaria de una despensa y librería, con 12 años de funcionamiento, tiene buenísima ubicación en frente del Colegio Nacional de dicha localidad.
Es su cuarta operación de créditos con la Fundación Paraguaya, excelente cliente y gracias a los préstamos que recibe de la empresa su negocio está surgiendo cada día más.
Su marido también trabaja en la agricultura, tiene plantaciones de mandioca y maiz.
Ella solicita el préstamo para abastecer mejor su despensa con comestibles.
texts.en:
Señora Leoncia O. F. lives in the community of Santani. She has her own house, is 55 years old, and married to 66-year old Juan Bautista Sanabria. She owns a shop and a bookstore in a good location opposite the local Colegio Nacional.

This is Leoncia’s fourth loan with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. She is an excellent client, and thanks to the loans her business does better with each passing day. 

Her husband is a farmer and grows cassava and corn.

Leoncia is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura,  al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

La señora Margarita está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y está muy contenta porque gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la  Fundación Espoir ha podido mejorar su negocio. Tiene 65 años y está soltera, no tuvo hijos y vive con una compañera de trabajo. Es una mujer muy activa y alegre que le encanta su trabajo.

Se dedica al comercio vende productos naturales de Omnilive y Forlive,  también vende semijoyas de Visón, entre los productos que más vende están: aloe, fibra, multivitaminas, adelgazantes entre otros. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00. También cría gallinas criollas y vende los huevos y los pollos a muy buen precio ya que son mejores que los de granja.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de sus productos naturales sobretodo los adelgazantes. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
In Mejía, which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people who make thier livings largely in agriculture, farming and selling coconuts, the members of the Banco Comunal Mejía (Mejía Communal Bank) hold a biweekly meeting.

Señora Margarita has been with the communal bank since its inception.  She is very happy with the bank because thanks to the loans she has received from Fundación Espoir, she has been able to improve her business.  She is 65 years old, is single and never had children.  She lives with a co-worker.  She is an active and happy woman, and she loves her work. 

Señora Margarita makes her living selling the natural products Omnilive and Forlive.  She also sells Visón costume jewlery.  The items she sells the most of are:  aloe, fiber, multivitamins and weight-loss products.  She works from Monday to Friday from 8:00am-3:00pm.  She also raises Creole hens; she gets a good price for the eggs and the chickens she sells because hers are better quality than farm chickens.
 
She is going to use this loan to purchase more natural products, especially those for wieght loss.  Señora Margarita dreams of having her own house and to continue in her work.

loans.use: To purchase Omnilife and Forlive products.

loans.name: Mutalib

texts.en: Mutalib R.  is a young, tenacious farmer of 21. Mutalib usually buys small calves in the livestock bazaar, raises and fattens them, and sells them for profit. Mutalib is now applying for a 1,200 AZN loan to increase his herd and to improve his living standards. This loan will be used to buy three calves. Mutalib plans to get married next year and he hopes to save enough money to have a great wedding party.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. Lani works very hard to provide for them.

Lani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Lani has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Lani would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more essential goods.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 39 years old and the mother of three. Her husband, John, is a businessman. 

Harriet runs a grocery shop in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last five years. This marks her third borrowing from KADET, and she plans to add stock of potatoes, fruits, tomatoes, onions and cabbage into her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business and repayment of the loan.

Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add stock of potatoes, fruits, tomatoes, onions and cabbage

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gualberto es soltero, vive la zona de kuluyo a 30 minutos de la localidad de sacaba Cochabamba,  vive en la casa de sus padres  tiene terrenos para sembrar papa , habas ,   el se dedica a la venta de papa por cargas  en el mercado de sacaba  mas conocido como la cancha de papas. Es muy responsable en su trabajo y tiene mucha experiencia ya que en su familia desde pequeños  les enseñan  a trabajar en el campo, Gualberto augura buenas cosechas  para diciembre,  es por eso que la compra de semillas  la realizara con este préstamo y también para herramientas de trabajo, es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gualberto is single and lives in the Kuluyo zone 30 minutes from Sacaba, Cochabamba, in his parents’ house.  He has agricultural fields where he plants potatoes and broad beans.  He sells the potatoes by the loan at the market in Sacaba which is better known as “Cancha de Papas.”

He is very responsible in his work and has much experience since his family taught him while still very young to work in the field.  Gualberto foresees good harvests come December.  This is why he will use the loan to buy seed as well as work tools.  He is a young person with a strong wish to improve himself and is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy seeds and work tools.

loans.name: Dolores Moserrate

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon. Lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería.
 
La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y buenas amigas. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar como planchas, colchones, ventiladores, etc.  Su forma de venta es a través de cartillas o sistema acumulativo. También vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo. Tiene diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos para el hogar y productos Yanbal.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentar su negocio
texts.en:
In San Ignacio in the Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank "San Ignacio De Colon" meet every fortnight.  The place is known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and livestock.
 
Dolores is a founding member and also secretary of the communal bank.  She likes it because her partners are very responsible and also good friends. She is 33 years old, married and has three children, aged 13, 11 and 5 years old.   The oldest is in high school and the younger children in elementary school. Her husband is a driver.

Dolores is a housewife who sells household items like sheets, mattresses, fans, etc.  She sells her products  through booklets or a cumulative system. She also sells Yanbal also products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works three days a week, leaving her goods on credit and collecting payment every week.  Her products are received at a distributor in Portoviejo.  She has been selling for 10 years and is doing quite well.

The requested loan is to buy household items and Yanbal products.  Her dreams are to continue working and increase her business.

loans.use: To buy household items and Yanbal (beauty) products.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Elsie has a shop in which she sells candies, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, candies, biscuits, powdered milk & chocolate drinks.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies, biscuits, powdered milk & chocolate drinks

loans.name: Mouhanad

texts.en:
Mouhanad is a 23 year old single man from Ain. He  has been selling mobile phones and their accessories in his rented shop since July 2010, with 5 years of experience in this field.
Mouhanad is a hard worker. His family are against him taking a loan because his father can help him increase his capital, but because he prefers to handle his own business alone, he has applied for his first loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to increase his business capital.
Mouhanad hopes to open a new branch in the future, and to be well known in the region.

loans.use: To increase his prepaid cards capital

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Don Alberto de 39 años y tiene 5 hijos todos estan estudiando en una escuela de la comunidad los dos mayores le ayudan con las ventas por las tardes don alberto tiene 16 años de estar trabajando con su negocio de ventas de ropa el credito que esta solicitando es para compra de ropa variada ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar y asi con las ganacias ayudar a darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Don Alberto is 39 years old and has 5 children, who are all studying at a community school. The two eldest children help him with sales in the evenings. Don Alberto has been running his business selling clothes for 16 years. Don Alberto needs to raise more capital for his business. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a variety of clothing, and the profits will help to provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has eight children. She is 59 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Gertrudes has had a piggery for two years. She has requested 7000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase more pigs. 

Gertrudes has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Urbana que nació en la ciudad D. Paruro (Cusco, Perú), tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a  la elaboración D. mana y llevo a vender a diferentes ciudades como Urubamba, Calca y Abancay. Ya son varios años con este negocio y me va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplos arroz, maíz, fideos, azúcar, papel y otras cosas más que se necesitan para elaboracion”.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Let’s Go Together) Communal Bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

This is where we meet Urbana, who was born in the city of Paruro (Cusco, Perú).  She is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  She tells us, “I currently live in the city of Cusco, which is where I conduct my business activities.  I make "mana" (a candy similar to marzipan), and I take it to sell in different cities like Urubamba, Calca, and Abancay.  I have had this business for several years, and it is going very well for me."

At this point I need the loan to buy more supplies like rice, corn, noodles, paper, and other things that are needed for food preparation.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, corn, noodles, paper, and other things.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a hardworking 24-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last year, he has been operating a retail shop so as to meet the needs of his family. He wants in the next 5 years to have upgraded his shop into wholesale. His dream is to own a piece of land and develop it. 

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy a bag of rice, sugar, maize and wheat flour. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy a bag of rice, sugar, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia, de 54 años convive con Rómulo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Ivan, Ángel y Fredy. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.
La vestimenta negra que le caracteriza, es símbolo del luto que lleva. Ya que hace poco sufrió la perdida de uno de sus hijos, pero a pesar de ello; está valerosa mujer sigue trabajando arduamente, la ganadería y la agricultura, son sus principales actividades económicas. Sus sembríos constan principalmente de papa, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y en épocas de campaña agrícola, los lleva a la capital, donde adquiere mejores ganancias, pero como ella dice “depende mucho de precio de venta en el mercado”. Mientras que la carne que compra, lo lleva a la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde vende a buen precio, ya que la carne de ovino escasea y por ello la demanda. Ahora, está valiente mujer desea comprar un auto, con el cual piensa incursionar en el trasporte público y así seguir apoyando a sus hijos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, que fueron personas solidarias y le brindaron apoyo en el momento más difícil de su vida. Razón por lo que es puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Ambrosia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
54-year-old Ambrosia lives with her husband Rómulo.  The couple have eight children but only live with three of them: Ivan, Ángel and Fredy.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.

The black clothing which Ambrosia wears is a symbol of her mourning as, a short time ago, she lost one of her children.  However, in spite of that, this brave woman continues working hard.  Livestock raising and farming are her main business activities. She mainly grows potatoes which she sells in the wholesale market in Tarma after each harvest.  During the season, she takes them to the capital where she makes better profits but, as she says, "it depends a lot on the sale price in the market".  Ambrosia takes her meat to the town of San Ramón (in the central Peruvian rainforest) and sells it there for a good price.  Mutton and lamb are in short supply so there is a lot of demand.  This brave woman would like to buy a car as she plans to break into the public transport business so that she can continue supporting her children.

Ambrosia is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is her eighth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the support of her community bank.  They are supportive people and they gave her support during the most difficult moment of her life.  For this reason, she makes her loan repayments on time.  With your support, Ambrosia will invest the money that she has requested in buying natural fertilizers for the crops that she is about to sow.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en: Ancille is a widow and has two children, ages 16 and 18. Her children have been unable to finish school. She runs a general store in which she sells donuts, water, soda, tea, and a local drink called ubushera which is made out of sorghum. She has been running this business for eight years and it has enabled her to care for her children. She needs a loan to buy sorghum to make the local soft drink and buy some other snacks to stock her store. She will use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients for a local soft drink ans snacks that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Dalay

texts.es: Dalay, tiene la edad 71 de años, está viuda, vive sola actualmente. Ella con le crédito va comprar los repuestos para la reparación del camión. Ella cuenta con el camión el cual el facilita su trasporte y su trabajo. Con esta mejora de su camión le facilitara su trabajo y así realizar sus trabajos a tiempo. Ella con esta mejora lo que pretende es tener la mayoría de ganancias para su bienestar y así mantener su camión en buen estado para seguir adelante con sus proyectos de vida.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Dalay, is 71 years old. She is a widow and lives alone. She will use this loan to buy spare parts to repair her truck. She relies on her truck as a means of transport and for her work. Carrying out these improvements to her truck will make her work easier and allow her to complete her jobs on time. 

She is doing this so that she can use her earnings to improve her well-being and to keep her truck in good condition so that she can make make progress with her life's projects. 

This is the first loan she has received from Kiva Field Partner, FUDECOSUR. She has not had any loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair her truck.

loans.name: Framierie

texts.en:
Framierie is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga del Sur.

Framiere runs a sari sari (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase stock and add to her capital.

Framierie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Framierie hopes to help her family and provide for their daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Jacquellin Araceli

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 47 años, una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de ser madre soltera ha sabido cómo salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
El negocio de ella es un taller de confesiones, trabaja sola en su taller que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Su horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 8:30am hasta las 19:30pm.
Tiene un hijo de 14 años, estudia en escuela pública.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: blusas, vestidos, etc.
Su sueño es implementar y agrandar su taller con nuevas maquinas y con personal operario donde ella pueda brindar empleo.
texts.en:
Jacquellin, 47, is a hard-working lady who despite being a single mother has learned how to get ahead with God's help.  She has a sewing shop set up in the front part of her house where she works alone.  Her schedule is Monday through Sunday, 8:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m.

She has a 14-year-old son who attends the public school.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make blouses, dresses, etc.

Her dream is to expand her shop, buy new machines and hire workers to whom she can provide employment.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme  âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur . Elle a 04 enfants.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et divers depuis 2006. Elle vend à la devanture de son domicile. Elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Afiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté, des torchons, des biscuits et bonbons.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 30-year-old woman.  She is married to a welder and has four children.

Afiwa has worked as a seller of cosmetics and other miscellaneous products since 2006.  She sells her products in front of her home and buys them from  the Grand Marché, Lomé's central market.

Afiwa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products, dish towels, cookies and candies.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Yien

texts.en:
Yien, a 29-year-old married woman, sews clothes in a garment factory in the Ang Snoul district.  She is able to earn approximately $3.00 each day to support her family. 

Her husband is a construction worker. 

This couple is blessed with two children who attend a local public school. 

Yien has encountered a difficulty in traveling to work.  She doesn’t have her own motorcycle, so every day she has to spend money taking a motor taxi service. 

Now Yien would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a second-hand motorcycle. 

This loan will help her family reduce its transportation expenses.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Imelda has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She has had a sari-sari store (general store) for six years. She sells items such as plastic bags, brooms, and straws. She earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month.

Mary Jane is requesting a loan to buy items such as canned goods and plastic bags to sell.  She hopes her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods and plastic bags to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad, allí se dedica a la venta de películas  y también ofrece los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras,  desde hace 2 años en su propio apartamento,  a vecinos del sector y de sus aledaños,  con una frecuencia de ventas diarias y  de contado, con lo que obtiene un margen de utilidad no menor del 50% . Su idea emprendedora inició cuando compró su DVD, con un televisor y sus amigos y vecinos se reunían en su casa para ver y alquilaban películas; así fue como pidió a su esposo poner  el aviso de alquiler y  venta de películas,  con el que le ha ido muy bien,   posteriormente agregó a esta clientela doméstica el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, que había conocido por experiencia de su madre.  Sus dos negocios  le han permitido generar ingresos,  con los que ha apoyado el bienestar de su hogar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 2 lavadoras mas,  con ellas ampliará su potencial de acceso al mercado y responderá a la de manda de su clientela que muchas veces se va sin el servicio resuelto, porque sus lavadoras están ocupadas en varios sectores del barrio. Rosa se ha caracterizado por ser una persona que le gusta ahorrar, por eso no le fue difícil tener su primer capital de trabajo y hacer su primera inversión en el emprendimiento de su microempresa. Hoy se siente muy satisfecha y con ganas de continuar el crecimiento de su negocio y por eso se esmera en su trabajo diario, porque está construyendo el futuro de su hijo y espera que este tenga buenas posibilidades educativas, para que tenga la potencialidad de ser exitoso en lo que el decida emprender.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, lives with her spouse and six-year-old son to the south of the city, where she works selling movies.  Also, for two years she has been offering a service from her own apartment renting washing machines to neighbors in her neighborhood and nearby.  With a frequency of daily sales and installments, she gets a profit margin of no less than 50%.

She started her enterprising idea when she bought her first DVD player.  With her friends and neighbors and a television set they would get together in her house and rent movies to watch.  This is how she asked her husband to put up the announcement of renting and selling movies, which has gone very well for her.  Later she added to her domestic clientele the service of renting washing machines, which she had known about through her mother's experience.  Her two businesses have allowed her to generate income, with which she has supported the well-being of her home.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first funding she has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy two more washing machines, with which she will expand her potential for accessing the market and she will respond to her customers' demand, which often goes away unmet because her machines are busy in various areas of the neighborhood.

Rosa has described herself as a person who likes to save.  This is why it was not difficult for her to get her first working capital and make her first investment in the entrepreneurship of her small business.

Today she feels very satisfied and wants to continue the growth of her business.  For this reason she does her best in her daily work, because she is building her son's future and she wants him to have good educational possibilities, so he will have the potential to be successful in what he decides to undertake.

loans.use: to buy two more washing machines to expand her access to market potential.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Mr Thang is taking this loan out for his son, student Cuong.  Cuong is attending Hanoi National College for Economics and Technology.  His tuition lasts for three years and he will graduate in 2014. 

Studying at this college, Cuong hopes to be a mechanic and will work for a mechanical manufacturing factory as an engineer.  Currently, he is coping with difficulties affording his education fees and supplies.  He wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to solve this.

loans.use: to pay education fees and buy some supplies.

loans.name: Ashirgul

texts.ru: Аширгуль родилась на юге страны, в селе Красный Октябрь и выросла в большой семье простых рабочих.  После окончания школы она помогала семье по хозяйству, о дальнейшем получении образования в то время не могло быть и речи. Основным источником дохода семьи было выращивание риса, работа с домашней живностью и полеводством. Выйдя замуж за своего односельчанина, молодая семья трудится на поле, так же выращивая рис. С тех пор прошло 28 лет, через многие трудности прошла семья. Жить в родном селе становилось все трудней и трудней, земли не хватало для всех, а у Аширгуль с мужем к тому времени подрастали 8 детей. В 2000 году семья решается переехать в Чуйскую долину (северная часть). На накопленные средства семья покупает небольшой домик, четверо сыновей помогают отцу заниматься земледелием, сама Аширгуль возделывает земельный участок с овощами, собранный урожай продают на рынке. Благодаря доходам от полеводства, в конце 2000 года семья смогла купить себе корову. На сегодняшний день, Аширгуль и ее семья обрабатывают 8,5га арендованной земли, где выращивают лук и другие овощи, в хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аширгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры и  минеральных удобрений, так как зимой данное сырье дешевле и в сезон посевных работ резко вырастает в цене. В будущем, Аширгуль мечтает открыть свою мини- ферму.
texts.en:
Ashirgul was born in the south of the country, in the village of Red October, and grew up in a large family of ordinary workers. After finishing school, she helped her family on the farm, as there could be no talk of further education at that time. The main source of income for the family was growing of rice, work with livestock and field crop cultivation. 

Marrying a fellow villager, the young family was working in the field, growing rice as well. 28 years old went by, and the family went through many difficulties. It became harder and harder to live in the native village, the land was not enough for everyone, and Ashirgul and her husband were by this time raising eight children. 

In 2000, the family decided to move to the Chuy valley (northern part). From their accumulated funds, the family bought a small house. The four sons helped the father with farming. Ashirgul grew vegetables on a plot of land, and sold the harvest at the market. Thanks to the income from the field crop cultivation, the family was able to buy a cow at the end of 2000. At present, Ashirgul and her family work 8.5 hectares of rented land, where they grow onions and other vegetables, and the farm has two dairy cows. 

With an aim to further expand her business, Ashirgul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fertilizers, because this raw material is cheaper in winter, and in the plating season the price rises sharply. In the future Ashirgul dreams of opening her own mini-farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar le han permitido salir adelante y progresar junto a su familia. Gloria inició su negocio debido a que su esposo se quedó sin empleo por un accidente que sufrió en una mina, lo que le ha hecho sufrir grandes problemas de salud. Gloria con su negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Gloria montó su choza de venta de dulces y cigarrillos en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, y poco a poco ha ido posicionándolo entre sus clientes. Con el ánimo de aumentar su surtido, Gloria aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de confitería y dulces, con los cuales pueda surtir su negocio.

Gloria espera que su negocio le permita ofrecerles a sus hijos y su esposo una mejor calidad de vida, además, de que este le permita tener una estabilidad económica. Gloria sueña con poderse ubicar en un local donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y poder heredarlo a su hijo menor que no ha podido encontrar oportunidades laborales.

loans.use: Compra de productos de confitería y dulces, con los cuales pueda surtir su negocio.

loans.name: John Owino

texts.en:
John  was born in Magoya village and has beeen working on a rented motorcycle for for three years. He  is married with two children and lives in Siaya County.  John has committed to  provide transport to CHWs working in a local CBO in Siaya. He aims to target the youth especially young boys providing peer support. John is happynto own a motorcycle, he says he will give back to his community one day every week, he is ready to start and sto send his progress report.

 John will also be able to provide for his family and support the community as well, John belongs to a motorcycle taxi association and hopes to encourage many more members to join in supporting the CHW work in working very closely with the local health outreach CBO.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to support Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Ariane Dudeyza

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Ariane's dream. To achieve her goal, Ariane has enrolled in the Universidad Saint Paul. She plans on graduating in July 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that she will need to defer his graduation.

With the loan, Ariane plans to pay for her tuition. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $15 a day. As the youngest of 2, with one older sibling attending college already, Ariane is unsure how she will be able to finance her education without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Ariane currently works 30 hours a week as a tour guide to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi a 41ans. Elle est mariée avec 02 enfants de 08 et 06ans en charge. Pour contribuer aux besoins des charges familiales, Afi a décidé de vendre des articles scolaires dans un établissement de la place. Son activité se déroule à KPALIME et ses approvisionnements se font au même lieu et à Lomé. Afin ouvrir une librairie et assurer l’épanouissement social de la famille, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit tiré de cette vente lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Notons qu'elle a démarré en 2011.
texts.en: Afi is 41 years old.  She is married and she has two children (ages 6 and 8) under her care.  In order to cover some of her family's expenses, she has decided to sell school supplies in a local shop. She works in Kpalimé and buys her supplies in Kpalimé and Lomé.  Eager to open her own stationery store and to see her family thrive, socially, she is taking a first loan to buy school supplies.  Her profits will enable her to reach her goals.  Afi started in this activity in 2011.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Her desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her tender age (26) and the obstacles she has experienced, she doesn't reduce her efforts to achieve her objective. What she sets out for she gets. She is so humble and honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Ruth is the mother of two lovely children that she really adores so much.

Ruth hails from the Sanga, Kericho area of Kenya. Ruth started farming and has been doing farming for the past five years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. 

Ruth practices mixed farming on her farm and, through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her  two children a good education.

Ruth is a woman who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Ruth wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Ruth to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Ruth hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Help this woman with dreams and goals to realize. 
Come on, make a loan and make her holiday season wonderful!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Nyengeterai

texts.en: Nyengeterai is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Chiredzi District. She sells clothing from her stand at the local flea market and uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees. Nyengeterai used her first Kiva loan to purchase more stock and expand her business into clothing sales.  Nyengeterai is requesting a second Kiva loan to construct a large shop from which to sell her clothes. She plans to use the profit she earns to continue expanding her shop and to build a house for her family. Nyengeterai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students at the local high school about active citizenship. The interest on Nyengeterai’s social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: To construct a large shop

loans.name: Digan

texts.en:
Digan is a street vendor of clothes but also has a small business at home. She started the business with the help of her husband who provided $200 in start up in capital. She started selling only children’s clothes but now also provides clothes for men and women. Although the clothes sales do provide for her family, she needs to make more money in order to provide a better standard of living. She wants to invest the loan she receives in household items that she can also sell and provide more profit. She is 42 years old and moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector known as Los Rios. She has one daughter who she wants to educate past the high school level.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in household products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in materials that will allow him to cover orders he has from his customers and also in making improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en: Q. Shirkhan is a 41 year old father of 4 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He began his business by buying a cow, and later decided to purchase another cow and a calf.  To reach his plans, he borrowed 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Loas

texts.en: Mrs. Loas Y. is a 37 year old widow. She has 2 children who are both students. Laos Y. earns $4 a day making rooves out of leaves and selling wood. She would like this loan so that she can purchase more tools to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tools for her business

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: This young man has seven years of experience in cattle breeding. He lives in Ashagi-Zeyid village, in the Khachmaz region. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Saturdina De Los Ang

texts.es:
Miss H. makes both spices (an example: little onions in vinegar) and 'chileros.' Furthermore, she buys the artisans some products to decorate and improve the presentation of her products, having prepared all these spices by herself.

She has been in this business for twenty five years, and her mother helped her with the initial capital. She prepared the spices in her mother's house, and then they took a little table outside the door of their house and the exposed their product in plastic bags, selling also in the sidewalks of the Central de León market.

With time she began to elaborate other products and she took advantag the clients she had in order to sell national products made by hand like 'jicaras,' 'comales,' wooden spoons, piggybanks, etc. All these objects would be exposed in some sweaters on the floor just by the little table. Her first credit was 3 years ago and she invested it to complete the money and to buy her space within the market we mentioned, and with this she began to produce.

She comments that before she worked in this business she worked as a maid, cleaning and ironing clothes in domicile. When she changed jobs, however, all her family saw how profitable this business was and how much support she got from this organization who has given her the credits. Thanks to the things she has been able to do with these credits she has been able to mantain her business active and she is very thankful to those individuals for their help.

La señora H. elabora por una parte especies como Encurtidos (un ejemplo; cebollitas en vinagre) y tambien chileros. Además compra a los artesanos algunos productos para decorar y mejorar la presentación de su producto, todas las especies son preparadas por ella misma.

Lleva 25 años de tener el negocio, su madre le ayudo con el capital inicial. Ellas preparaban en su casa los encurtidos, luego sacaban a la puerta de su casa una mesita de madera y exponian su producto en bolsas de plástico, tambien vendian en las aceras del mercado Central de León.

Con el tiempo empezaba a elaborar otros productos y aprovechaba la clientela que tenia para vender productos nacionales hechos a mano como JÍCARAS, COMALES, CUCHARAS DE MADERA, ALCANCIAS DE BARRO etc. Todo eso lo extendía en unos sacos en el suelo a lado de su mesita. Su primer crédito fué hace tres años y lo invirtió para completar el dinero y comprar su tramo(módulo) dentro del Mercado, ya con esto ella comenzó a surtir más el negocio.

Ella nos comenta que antes de trabajar en este negocio se desempeñaba como doméstica, lavaba ropa y planchaba a domicilio. Toda la familia ha visto lo rentabnle que es este negocio y cuanto apoyo ha recibido con la organización que le ha brindado los créditos. Gracias al trabajo con los créditos ha podido mantener activo este negocio y esta muy agradecida por su ayuda.

loans.use:
To buy vegetables to prepare 'chileros' and other spices

Destinado a comprar las verduras para preparar sus chileros y encurtidos

loans.name: Zikreta

texts.en: Zikreta is a 36-year-old married housewife who lives in a small town near Sarajevo. She is uneducated; because of that, she cannot find a job. Her husband works only in the summer. They have two sons, and her older son does not attend school because they do not have enough money. The younger son attends school. The cow is their only secure source of income during the winter. Zikreta has taken this second loan from Women for Women International because she needs to provide food for the cow. She earns money by selling milk, which provides income to support the family during the whole year. She hopes her income will increase and she will be able to provide primary school education for her younger son.

loans.use: To buy a hay for her cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 45 years old, is a widow and has two children (ages 21 and 20). Since 2006, she has been making money selling bottles. Elizabeth works from 8 am to noon daily and makes a monthly profit of about US$90.

She hopes to receive a loan to buy a stock of bottles for sale. Elizabeth belongs to a loan group called Mshikamano which has a total of 40 members who help one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of bottles for sale

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mrs. Khin S., 28, is married with two little children. She works at home to feed her family, while her husband drives a motor-taxi.  He typically makes about 5 dollars each day. Mrs. Khin S. would like to request a loan to purchase a new motor-bike for her husband, because his old motor-bike is broken beyond repair. Mrs. Khin S. is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new motor-bike for her husband to operate a businesss.

loans.name: Maria Adolfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Adolfina T. T. is a member of the Communal Bank. “Saint Rose of Lima,” lives in the San Martin region, in Mariscal Caceres province, in the district of Juanjui. She is developing her business in a stand in the Pomarrosas market in the city. There, on a daily basis, she tends to the residents that visit the market to buy food products. Thanks to her dedication she has managed to make her business prosper. When she first began, she was selling small quantities of fruits on the ground on one of the main streets in the city. Her clientele has increased considerably and now she has her own sales stand where she sells fruits and vegetables in larger quantities. With the credit of 1000 PEN ($375 U.S. dollars,) which she would be able to pay back within a period of 6 months, she would buy guineos (small fruit similar to a banana,) papayas, oranges, and other fruits and vegetables typical to the region to sell to her clients from day to day. Maria Adolfina is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and 4 of her youngest children, for whom she works daily and tirelessly, with the firm desire that they will one day have in their own home a shop where she can sell her groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Adolfina T. T. es socia del Banco.Comunal. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, desarrolla su negocio en un puesto del mercado Pomarrosas de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden los moradores a comprar productos alimenticios. Gracias a su y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio prospere, pues cuando empezó vendía en el suelo en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, pequeñas cantidades de frutas, actualmente posee un puesto propio done vende frutas y verduras en mayores cantidades, su clientela ha crecido considerablemente. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará guineos, papaya, naranjas, sapotes, coconas en cientos, culantro, cebolla china en kilos, ajíes de distintas variedades, entre otros, para vender a sus clientes día a día. María Adolfina es una mujer trabajadora, vive con su esposo y 4 de sus hijos menores, por quienes día a día trabaja sin descanso, con el firme deseo que en el futuro pueda tener en su propia casa una bodega donde pueda vender abarrotes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Burna's Group

texts.en:
I am Burna G., the group leader. I am married and a mother of two, both of my children attend a neighboring school. We live in Pakistan’s second largest city Lahore. To earn a living my husband manufactures shoe buckles. He has 16 years of experience manufacturing these buckles. His income is just enough to cover the major household expenses. By acquiring a loan, we plan to improve and expand our business further.

I would like to borrow in a group of several other women who are also in need of loans. Rafia M. and Seema B. also want to invest in their shoe buckle businesses; Nasreen B.’s son also manufactures shoe buckles and Rehana K. embroiders clothes with threads and sequins.

loans.use: to mass manufacture shoe buckles

loans.name: Usubeyli

texts.en: Usubeyli Y. is a 55-year-old man who raises livestock in a small southern village of the Imishli region. He started his business in 1980 and at the same time, he is helping his close relative to look after a big livestock farm. Having his own business in the main source of income for his big family, as he has 3 sons and 1 daughter. He dreams of having as big a farm as possible, but to achieve his main goal he needs to work hard and increase the number of animals he raises. For his purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase 3 calves at US$ 300 each and fodder for US$ 100.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Ghulam Batool's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Batool is the wife of M. Zulfiqar and has lived in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan for the last 50 years. They have a two-room brick house and are the parents of ten children; eight sons and two daughters. The two eldest sons have a vegetable business. The younger three have a paint shop. Another son is a tailor and has been in this profession for the last eight years. Their oldest daughter is in the 10th level of school and the next oldest daughter is in 8th level.

The daily income is $10 to $13. Ghulam Batool successfully repaid her loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She is requesting a second loan for the son who is tailor and wants to start a garment business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Naseem baji (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) wants a loan to expand her cement business; Latifan baji wants to expand her grocery shop; Najma baji wants to buy a sewing machine and Razia baji needs funding for her paint shop.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a garment business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is an enterprising woman with two children. Since she was no longer able to work, she decided to start a business to care for her children and support her husband with the household expenses since they are now paying for their home. She began her business a year a go with her mother's help. She started a grocery store and little by little the business has improved.

She is seeking a loan for $1,000, which she will repay in 6 months, to restock merchandise and to remodel some things in the store such as advertisements. With your help, Carmen will advance.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer emprendedora tiene 2 hijos pequeños y decidió iniciar un negocio ya que ella ya no pudo trabajar para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que actualmente estan pagando su casa. Comenzó el negocio hace un año con la ayuda de su mamá, inicio la tienda de abarrotes y así poco a poco ha ido mejorando el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y también para remodelar algunas cosas de la tienda como anuncios. Con tu ayuda Carmen saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and remodel the store.

loans.name: Apaikunda's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Apaikunda is 41 years old. She is married with 4 children ages 20, 17,16 and 10. She has been a maize, beans and milk seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Apaikunda now hopes for a loan to buy more maize, beans, and milk for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Beatrice and Bertha, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Bosiljka

texts.en:
Bosiljka R. was born in 1953. She is divorced and she lives with her two children. She works in a bakery earning 300 KM monthly. She has also another income of making cakes at home.

This will be her first loan with WWI in the amount of 600 KM ($US450). She wants to buy materials for making cakes at home, so she will sell more cakes after work time and in that way her life and life for her children will be easier.

loans.use: To buy materials for making of cakes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.

Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 1 hija vive con ella, Juana vive en la ciudad de Palmapampa en la selva ayacuchana, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende ropa variada, para grandes y pequeños, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho y a veces en la ciudad de Lima dependiendo del capital que tenga. Además Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de cacao y lo vende en el mismo lugar.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, camisas. Los sueños de Juana son tener capital propio, una tienda amplia, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank El Roble. Juana is married and is 48 years old. She has 5 children, of whom 1 live with her. Juana lives in the city of Palmapampa, in the jungle. Juana has a store in her home where she sells various clothing, for big and little people. She gets her products in the city of Ayachucho, and sometimes in the city of Lima, depending on the capital that she has. Also, Juana and her husband work in growing cacao and she sells it in the same place. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, and blouses. Juana’s dreams are to have her own capital, a big store, and to educate her children so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of pants, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
Esta señora Martha Esperanza E. P. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 3 hijas sus edades son: la mayor tiene 24 años y estudia recientemente ciencias médicas, otra de 21 años la cual trabaja en la empresa ARNECOM y la menor que tiene 6 años y cursa el 3 nivel de primaria, los deseos de ella es de construir y ampliar  unos cuartos  con el fin de que estos sean alquilados y generar ingresos para su familia  que lo necesita, otros de sus deseos es de instalar una maquina de coser de tipo industrial  por lo que ella posee conocimiento de la costura y así ofrecer estos productos y proporcionarle un futuro de estudios a sus hijos.



 Su actividad económica es una pulpería en la vende los productos como: hilo, zipper, golosinas y pasta de dientes el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 18 años, Doña Martha inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener ingresos a su familia ya que otro de los oficios que tiene conocimientos es de costura, pero lo que la impulso a establecer una pulpería  fue ella misma y a medida que pasaba el tiempo decidió invertir mas ya que no tenia competitividad  en su cuadra es por esa circunstancia que necesita el financiamiento para la compra de sus productos que estos serian: cartulinas, lápices de colores cartulinas y cuadernos ya que dice que sus clientes le hacen estos tipos de pedidos.
texts.en:
This woman, Martha Esperanza E. P., is 48 years old. She is single and has three daughters; the eldest is 24 years old and is most recently studying medical sciences, another is 21 years old who works for the company ARNECOM, and the youngest is six years old and is in level three of primary school. Martha wishes to build and expand some rooms in her home with the goal of renting them and generating needed income for her family. She also wishes to install an industrial-grade sewing machine because she is familiar with sewing and that way, she could offer these extra products and provide a future for her children where they can study. Her business is a shop where she sells products such as thread, zippers, candy and toothpaste. She has been conducting this business for 18 years. Mrs. Martha initially started this business because she needed to earn income for her family. She was also familiar with the sewing trade, but the initial momentum was to establish a shop. Now that time has passed, she decided to invest in her shop more because there is not any competition on her block. It is for this circumstance that she needs funding to purchase products such as cards, colored pencils, and notebooks since her customers have said that they will order these kinds of products.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa, who is married and with two children, lives in Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabel, Philippines. She has a hog-raising business while her husband works on their farm. Currently, she has more than three pigs, but she is planning to raise additional piglets in order to improve her income. 

Since her husband has a limited income from his harvest, their earnings are not enough to buy additional piglets.  They will have to buy item to meet their family's needs and to buy food of her pigs first. So she needs a loan of Php7,000 from an institution which has been helping people like her who want to help themselves. Half of this amount will be used to buy additional piglets and pig food and to add pig pens.  
 
According to her, she does these things for the sake of her children’s education and their brighter future. She strongly believes that faith, religiosity, and strong bonding are the secrets of a successful family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “San Gabriel “.Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por catorce mujeres que trabajan de manera organizada hace mucho tiempo.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación, son de todo tipo, una de  ellas tiene una pensión, donde ofrece almuerzos todos los días, también se  dedican a venta de relojes y otros accesorios; venta de mandiles, venta de ropa y otros. Ahora por las fiestas navideñas, además de la venta tradicional de sus productos, quieren vender adornos navideños, focos y otros productos que sean fácilmente comercializados por estas fechas.Por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de mercadería, para  poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
There is a center in the villa Tejada area that goes by the same name. It pertains to the San Gabriel Association, a charming group comprised of fourteen women who have been working in an organized manner for a long time. The members of the association partake in different business activities. One of them has a guesthouse in which she offers lunch everyday, other members sell watches and other accessories, while still other members sell aprons, clothing and other goods. Because of the holiday season, they want to sell Christmas ornaments, lights, and other products that are easily sold this season. They need more capital to purchase merchandise so that they can expand their businesses and increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Martha Azucena C. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Martha tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 14 años y cursa el 2 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como mecánico, sus propósitos  son de sacar adelante a su familia ya que dependen de ella y tiene que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su casa además están los gastos de su hijo, sus sueños son de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia para que no les afecte la situación económica que enfrentan actualmente ya que la situación económica es la mas difícil de superar es por eso que le gustaría trabajar mas y recaudar lo suficiente para descansar y disfrutar de la vida sus deseos son de transportar frutas a diferentes departamentos del país en un vehiculo propio y ampliar su negocio y así ser una comerciante que pueda vender la mercadería al por mayor y de esta forma obtendría mas ingresos para su familia.

Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general frutas, granos básicos, ropa, calzado y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, ella inicio su negocio por cuenta propia ya que desde muy temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar y además tenia que cuidar a su hijo por lo que realizo un viaje a Costa Rica gano dinero con lo cual inicio su actividad y decide empezar ofrecer unos cuantos productos como: ropa para niños y frutas pero con el paso del tiempo piensa que necesita incrementar mas en su mercadería y es capaza de lograrlo ya que utilizaba muy bien su capital de trabajo pero necesita mas dinero por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de frutas, granos básicos, calzado y plásticos ya que su lugar de confianza para realizar estos tipos de prestamos son Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que hacen posible el financiamiento para los pequeños empresarios.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena C. is forty-nine years old and lives with her life partner. She has a fourteen-year-old son who is in his second year of highschool. Her partner is a mechanic. Martha’s family depends on her and she wants to keep them afloat. She has to take care of the house expenses and child expenses on top of that. She dreams of improving the quality of life for her family. The economic situation which they face now is most difficult to surpass. Martha wants to work more, so that they will not be affected by the financial difficulty. She wants to make enough money that she can rest and enjoy the life of her dreams; she would like to transport fruit to different parts of the country in her own vehicle, and increase her businesses – then she would be a businesswoman who could sell wholesale, which would increase her income and help her family. Martha sells merchandise: general fruits, basic grains, clothes, footwear, and more. She is a traveling vendor. She has had her business for twenty years. She started her business when she was very young, and learned to work. She also had to take care of her son. It was when she made a trip to Costa Rica that she earned the money with which she started her business. She decided to start selling things like children’s clothes and fruit. She thinks now that she needs to add to her merhcandie. She feels that she is capable of doing this – she already uses her working capital very well – but she needs more money, which is why she is requesting this loan. The money will be used to buy fruits, basic grains, footwear, and plastics. Fundación León 200 and other organizations have confidence in small-business people and make it possible for loans like this to be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S., 65, is a widow who lives with her daughter in the Bati district, Takeo province. She and her daughter are weavers who work from their home and make US$7 of profit every day. They use silk to weave clothes and scarves and then sell them in the Phnom Penh market. The silk dress is a Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during the Water Festival, P’chum Ben and on Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer handmade dresses over machine made. Mrs. Sam S. is asking for a loan to purchase supplies of silk to weave more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of silk for weaving.

loans.name: Chaplain

texts.en:
Chaplain B. is currently in the business of selling bread at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Chaplain is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house for rent

loans.name: Mrs. Sarorn Leong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarorn L. is president of a village bank, formed by a group of eight people who all live in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province. All the members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sarorn L. is a tobacco seller. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. In her plantation, she faces an obstacle which is that her field is infertile, and this badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She intends to use the rest of her loan to buy gasoline to pump water to irrigate the field, which will make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Long Pang, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sarorn L. is 52 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a cow breeder, another three of whom are laborers, and the rest are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for an irrigation pump.

loans.name: María Justina

texts.es:
La dama María Justina F. es se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas para venderlas a sus clientes en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Mangua.

Ella es una persona muy esforzada que a raíz de sus ventas ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida. Hoy en día espera que Ceprodel le brinde su crédito para  la compra del maíz y así continuar en su negocio y así superarse y beneficiar a su familia que depende de ella.
texts.en:
